question_src: Je! Kwa nini tuliamua kuwa maneno fulani yalikuwa "mbaya" na hayapaswi kutumiwa katika mipangilio ya kijamii?
all_claims: Tulikubaliana kwamba maneno fulani ni “mbaya” kwa sababu yamekuwa zana za kuwanyima watu ubinadamu na hivyo kuendeleza ubaguzi; kwa mfano, ape na monkey yalitumika tangu miaka ya 1800 kuwalinganisha Waafrika-Waamerika na sokwe, jambo lililodhaniwa kisayansi wakati huo lakini lililolenga kuwathibitisha kuwa si binadamu kamili [2].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The Science of Swearing (www.psychologicalscience.org)
Content: Courts presume harm from speech in cases involving discrimination or sexual harassment. The original justification for our obscenity laws was predicated on an unfounded assumption that speech can deprave or corrupt children, but there is little (if any) social-science data demonstrating that a word in and of itself causes harm. A closely related problem is the manner in which harm has been defined — harm is most commonly framed in terms of standards and sensibilities such as religious values or sexual mores. Rarely are there attempts to quantify harm in terms of objectively measurable symptoms (e.g., sleep disorder, anxiety).

Document ID: 2
Title: Maneno haya yote ni ya kukera (lakini wakati mwingine tu) (www.dictionary.com)
Content: Kwa hivyo, shida iko wapi? Ape na tumbili huchukuliwa kuwa maneno ya kukera wakati hutumiwa kuelezea mtu wa rangi. Ni ile inayojulikana kama lugha ya ubinadamu, "Lugha ambayo inamnyima mtu sifa za kibinadamu au sifa."


Hasa wakati maneno yalipokuwa slurs haijulikani, lakini kulinganisha kukera kwa watu weusi na nyani huanzia mamia ya karne. Hivi majuzi kama miaka ya 1800, kwa mfano, wakati wanasayansi Yosia C. Nott na George R. Gliddon waliunda aina ya 1854 ya wanadamu (basi maandishi ya kisayansi yanayoongoza kwenye mbio), walilinganisha watu weusi sio watu wengine (weupe) lakini kwa chimpanzee, gorilla, na orangutan.


Inapotumiwa katika muktadha huu, Monkey na Ape huchukuliwa kuwa mbaya sana.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: All Of These Words Are Offensive (But Only Sometimes) (www.dictionary.com)
Content: The word savage has taken a circuitous path through the lexicon over the years, first showing up in English in the 1200s from Middle English. As an adjective, it’s typically meant “fierce, ferocious, or cruel; uncivilized; barbarous.” When referring to a savage lion ripping an antelope apart on the African Sahara, that’s all well and good.


But, the use of savage as a noun to describe human beings dates back to approximately the 1400s. At a time when Christopher Columbus was enslaving Native Americans and claiming their lands and work for his own, the word became a slur used by white Europeans to describe Native American people. The usage stuck around for hundreds of years, and it’s still a word that many indigenous peoples around the world find offensive.

Title: All Of These Words Are Offensive (But Only Sometimes) (www.dictionary.com)
Content: So, where’s the problem?Ape and monkey are considered offensive terms when they’re used to describe a person of color. It’s what is known as dehumanizing language, “language that deprives a person of human qualities or attributes.”


Exactly when the words became slurs is unknown, but offensive comparisons of black people to apes date back hundreds of centuries. As recently as the late 1800s, for example, when scientists Josiah C. Nott and George R. Gliddon created the 1854 Types of Mankind (then the leading scientific text on race), they compared black people not to other (white) people but to chimpanzees, gorillas, and orangutans.


When used in these contexts, monkey and ape are considered extremely derogatory slang.

Title: Maneno haya yote ni ya kukera (lakini wakati mwingine tu) (www.dictionary.com)
Content: Neno Savage limechukua njia ya mzunguko kupitia lexicon zaidi ya miaka, kwanza ilionekana kwa Kiingereza katika miaka ya 1200 kutoka Kiingereza cha Kati. Kama kivumishi, kawaida ilimaanisha "mkali, mkali, au mkatili; haijakamilika; barbarous." Wakati wa kurejelea simba wa Savage akivunja antelope kando ya Sahara ya Kiafrika, hiyo ni sawa na nzuri.


Lakini, utumiaji wa savage kama nomino kuelezea wanadamu huanzia takriban 1400s. Wakati ambao Christopher Columbus alikuwa akifanya watumwa wa Wamarekani Wamarekani na kudai ardhi zao na kufanya kazi yake mwenyewe, neno hilo likawa la kutumiwa na Wazungu weupe kuelezea watu wa Amerika ya Kaskazini. Matumizi yalizunguka kwa mamia ya miaka, na bado ni neno ambalo watu wengi wa asilia ulimwenguni kote hupata kukera.

Title: Sayansi ya kuapa (www.psychologicalscience.org)
Content: Korti husababisha madhara kutoka kwa hotuba katika kesi zinazohusu ubaguzi au unyanyasaji wa kijinsia. Uthibitisho wa asili kwa sheria zetu za upumbavu ulitabiriwa kwa dhana isiyo na msingi kwamba hotuba inaweza kuwapunguza au kuwa na mafisadi, lakini kuna data ndogo ya sayansi ya kijamii inayoonyesha kuwa neno ndani na yenyewe husababisha madhara. Shida inayohusiana sana ni njia ambayo madhara yamefafanuliwa - madhara huandaliwa kawaida kwa hali ya viwango na hisia kama vile maadili ya kidini au hali ya kijinsia. Mara chache kuna majaribio ya kumaliza madhara kwa hali ya dalili zinazoweza kupimika (k.v. shida ya kulala, wasiwasi).

question_src: Kwa nini mtoto wa tar kutoka kwa "Wimbo wa Kusini" ni ubaguzi wa rangi?  Kwa nini, haswa, sinema kwa ujumla inachukuliwa kuwa ya ubaguzi wa rangi?
all_claims: “Mtoto wa lami” ni ubaguzi kwa sababu neno “tar-baby” limetumika kama tusi la rangi dhidi ya Wamarekani Weusi, lakini katuni ya Splash Mountain inalitumia kana kwamba ni kisa kisicho na athari, hivyo kuendeleza kejeli hiyo ya kikabila [1]; hadithi ya “tar-baby” yenyewe, iliyoandikwa 1881 kama sehemu ya simulizi za Mjomba Remus, inatoka katika muktadha wa hadithi za watumwa ambazo zilifululizwa na waandishi Weupe na kuonesha Watu Weusi kama viumbe wajanja lakini waliokwama, jambo linalotukuza mitazamo ya kikoloni [2].

Filamu nzima ya “Wimbo wa Kusini” inadhaniwa kipindi cha Ujenzi Upya (miaka ya 1860–1870) ambapo mtoto Mzungu Johnny anashirikiana na mtumwa wa zamani Mjomba Remus “anayefanya kazi kwenye shamba” bila malalamiko, hivyo kupaka rangi ya upole na maridhiano miaka ya utumwa na ukandamizaji [3].

Taswira hii hufikia kilele kupitia trope ya “mtu mweusi mwenye nguvu, anayefurahi” kuishi na kutumikia waliokuwa wamiliki wake, jambo linalodhibitiwa na wakosoaji kuwa ni udhalilishaji unaofuta mateso halisi ya utumwa na kumfanya Mjomba Remus kuwa kielelezo cha “happy slave” [4].

Kwa jumla, matumizi la tusi la kivyombo, uwasilishaji wa hadithi za watumwa bila muktadha wa ukatili, na uromantisishaji wa mahusiano ya mabwana na watumwa ndizo sababu kuu filamu na “mtoto wa lami” wake hutajwa kuwa za kibaguzi.

all_claims: “Mtoto wa lami” ni ubaguzi kwa sababu neno “tar-baby” limetumika kama tusi la rangi dhidi ya Wamarekani Weusi, lakini katuni ya Splash Mountain inalitumia kana kwamba ni kisa kisicho na athari, hivyo kuendeleza kejeli hiyo ya kikabila [1]; hadithi ya “tar-baby” yenyewe, iliyoandikwa 1881 kama sehemu ya simulizi za Mjomba Remus, inatoka katika muktadha wa hadithi za watumwa ambazo zilifululizwa na waandishi Weupe na kuonesha Watu Weusi kama viumbe wajanja lakini waliokwama, jambo linalotukuza mitazamo ya kikoloni [2].

Filamu nzima ya “Wimbo wa Kusini” inadhaniwa kipindi cha Ujenzi Upya (miaka ya 1860–1870) ambapo mtoto Mzungu Johnny anashirikiana na mtumwa wa zamani Mjomba Remus “anayefanya kazi kwenye shamba” bila malalamiko, hivyo kupaka rangi ya upole na maridhiano miaka ya utumwa na ukandamizaji [3].

Taswira hii hufikia kilele kupitia trope ya “mtu mweusi mwenye nguvu, anayefurahi” kuishi na kutumikia waliokuwa wamiliki wake, jambo linalodhibitiwa na wakosoaji kuwa ni udhalilishaji unaofuta mateso halisi ya utumwa na kumfanya Mjomba Remus kuwa kielelezo cha “happy slave” [4].

Kwa jumla, matumizi la tusi la kivyombo, uwasilishaji wa hadithi za watumwa bila muktadha wa ukatili, na uromantisishaji wa mahusiano ya mabwana na watumwa ndizo sababu kuu filamu na “mtoto wa lami” wake hutajwa kuwa za kibaguzi.

Title: Dr. Dre (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The turning point for Aftermath came in 1998, when Jimmy Iovine, the head of Aftermath's parent label Interscope, suggested that Dr. Dre sign Eminem, a white rapper from Detroit. Content: For real SWAN-like “never have to work again” thinking, you need to have a portfolio large enough to kick off a stream of dividend income so that you don’t have to touch the capital. And then, considering inflation, your portfolio needs to grow by at least the nominal level of inflation per year, because $100,000 in today’s income isn’t the same as $100,000 in tomorrow’s income.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How Much Money Do You Need To Never Have To Work Again? Let's Do The Math. | The Kickass Entrepreneur (www.thekickassentrepreneur.com)
Content: My estimate is only an approximation, which will vary from person to person. But the SWAN never-have-to-worry-about-money-again formulas are as follows:


* SWAN Wealth Number Level 1 = Current Yearly Spend × 28 (quite comfortable)
* SWAN Wealth Number Level 2 = Current Yearly Spend × 32 (very comfortable)
* SWAN Wealth Number Level 3 = Current Yearly Spend × 36 (completely comfortable)

Document ID: 4
Title: How Much Money –Exactly– To Never Work Again? (www.twopluscrew.com)
Content: The answer is $1,475,000, for the average US household.


How?


At the time of this writing, the median US household income is ~$59,000. Discounting households with poor debt or spending management, this means withdrawing 4% (aka a "safe withdrawal rate") annually on a $1,475,000 diversified investment (an index fund) should usually provide said households with the $59,000 of income they're already receiving. This is how much money the average household would need invested at a nominal rate of return (usually given as 10%) in order to (1) provide for the household expenses, (2) be able to suffer a few years of bad markets, and (3) be at parity with inflation. All this without ever having to change their lifestyle.

Title: How Much Money Do You Need To Never Have To Work Again? Let's Do The Math. | The Kickass Entrepreneur (www.thekickassentrepreneur.com)
Content: So there you go. Your number to sleep well at night, never have to worry about money, is somewhere in the range of 28 to 36 times your yearly spend, and of course, the higher the multiple, the more secure you’ll feel, and the less stock market risk you’ll have to take. Anything above 40 and you’re feeling very comfortable.


And the question of whether $1 million is enough to retire on? If your yearly spend is $30,000, then, yes, $1 million is probably fine. If your yearly spend is more than $30,000, then you’re probably going to be tight, you might have to take more stock market risk, and in turn, not sleep quite as well at night!

Jinsi?


Wakati wa uandishi huu, mapato ya wastani ya kaya ya Amerika ni ~ $ 59,000. Hii ndio pesa ngapi kaya ya wastani ingehitaji kuwekeza kwa kiwango cha kawaida cha kurudi (kawaida hupewa kama 10%) ili (1) kutoa gharama za kaya, (2) kuweza kuteseka miaka michache ya masoko mabaya, na (3) kuwa kwa usawa na mfumko. Yote haya bila kuwa na mabadiliko ya maisha yao.

question_src: Ikiwa sitastahili kusafisha masikio yangu na ncha ya Q, kwa nini inahisi vizuri na wakati mwingine husafisha dhambi zangu?
all_claims: Baadhi ya watu huhisi raha wakitumia ncha ya Q kwa kuwa huamsha vagus nerve inayopita sikioni, neva inayoweza kutoa hisia za kustarehe mwilini [5].

Walakini, earwax ni kinga asilia inayolainisha mfereji, kunasa vumbi na kuzuia bakteria kupenya ndani zaidi [2].
Unaposukuma ncha ya Q ndani, mara nyingi unasukuma nta ndani zaidi, ukizuia uondoaji wake wa asili na kusababisha mkusanyiko unaoweza kuleta maumivu, hisia ya kujazwa au kusikia kwa mushi [3].
Inaweza pia kukwaruza ngozi au hata kuharibu ngoma ya sikio, na hivyo kusababisha kutokwa na damu au maambukizi [4].

Kwa hiyo, ingawa ncha ya Q inaweza kutoa nta kidogo na kukupa hisia nzuri kwa muda, hatari ya kuumia na kuongezeka kwa mkusanyiko wa nta huzidi faida zake; wataalamu wanashauri usafishe tu sehemu ya nje ya sikio kwa upole [1].

claim: Ulinganifu sahihi kati ya curve ya ndani ya lenzi (base-curve) na umbo la mbele la jicho hutengeneza upatanifu unaopunguza nafasi ya hewa kati ya lenzi na kornea, hivyo kuzuia lenzi kuteleza au kuzunguka; ikiwa curve hiyo ni gorofa sana lenzi hutembea kwa urahisi zaidi juu ya filamu ya machozi
question_src: Je! Lensi za mawasiliano zinakaaje kwenye iris yako? Ni nini huwazuia kusonga mbele kwa jicho lako?
all_claims: Lensi za mawasiliano hazikai moja kwa moja kwenye iris yako bali “huogelea” juu ya filamu nyembamba ya machozi inayofunika kornea, na uimara wa safu hii ya machozi hutengeneza nguvu ya kunata (capillary attraction) inayozishikilia lenzi katikati ya jicho [2].

Ulinganifu sahihi kati ya curve ya ndani ya lenzi (base-curve) na umbo la mbele la jicho hutengeneza upatanifu unaopunguza nafasi ya hewa kati ya lenzi na kornea, hivyo kuzuia lenzi kuteleza au kuzunguka; ikiwa curve hiyo ni gorofa sana lenzi hutembea kwa urahisi zaidi juu ya filamu ya machozi [2].
Filamu hiyo hiyo ya machozi pia hutunza unyevunyevu wa lenzi, kuifanya ijisikie vizuri na kubaki mahali pake muda wote wa matumizi [1].
Pamoja na kunata kwa machozi, shinikizo dogo la kope linalokandamiza lenzi taratibu dhidi ya kornea na mvuto mdogo wa maji kati ya nyuso mbili husaidia kuzuia lenzi kusonga mbele hadi itoke.

Muunganiko wa vipengele hivi vitatu—kunata kwa machozi, mlingano wa curve, na usaidizi wa kope—ndio unaofanya lenzi kaa salama katikati ya iris yako huku ikisonga tu inapohitajika wakati wa mruko wa macho.

Kitaalamu, theluji inapopashwa moto huelekea kuyeyuka, lakini maji yanayozalika hunyonya ndani ya muundo wake wenye matundu mengi, hivyo hayashuki kama matone yanayoonekana, kama alivyoeleza mwanafizikia Phil Plait [1].
Mwanga wa kiberiti au taa hutumia butane, hidrokarboni ambayo hutoa chembe za kaboni zisizoweza kuyeyuka; soot hii hukaa juu ya theluji na kuifanya ionekane “imeungua” [2].
Sehemu ya barafu pia inaweza kusublimu, yaani kubadilika moja kwa moja kutoka hali thabiti kwenda gesi bila kupitia kioevu, mchakato wa kawaida katika mzunguko wa maji [4].
Wataalamu wanasema hii si nadharia ya njama bali ni maelezo rahisi ya kisayansi yanayoweza kumchanganya asiyezoea mienendo ya barafu baridi kali [3].
Hivyo, hakuna ushahidi wowote kuwa theluji hiyo imetengenezwa na binadamu; kinachoonekana ni fizikia na kemia ya kawaida katika mazingira yasiyo ya kawaida kwa Texas.

all_claims: ACTA ni makubaliano ya kimataifa yanayoweka wajibu kwa Marekani kudumisha viwango fulani vya ulinzi wa hakimiliki, hivyo “hufunga mikono ya Congress” kwa kiasi fulani ikiwa taifa linataka kutimiza “majukumu yetu ya kimataifa” [4]; hata hivyo, makubaliano hayo hayaondoi mamlaka ya kikatiba ya Bunge kubadilisha au kukataa sheria mpya, kwa sababu “ahadi za makubaliano ya Merika hazipunguzi nguvu za kikatiba za Congress” [5].
Aidha, sheria ya kimataifa inatambua kuwa Marekani inaweza kusimamisha, kusitisha au hata kujiondoa kwenye mkataba, hatua ambayo ingeondoa wajibu wowote uliowekwa na ACTA [6].

Kwa msingi huo, kisheria Marekani hailazimiki kupitisha miswada kama SOPA au PIPA ili kutekeleza ACTA; Congress inaweza kuchagua kurekebisha sheria zilizopo, kutumia mbinu nyingine za utekelezaji, au kutoshiriki kabisa katika mkataba huo, kulingana na tathmini ya kisera na kisiasa.

Title: What Is ACTA And Why Is It A Problem? (www.techdirt.com)
Content: Beyond just locking in parts of copyright law, ACTA also expands it. First, it takes things that would normally be considered non-commercial file sharing (which is potentially against the law), and turns it into commercial scale criminal infringement. Title: The Fall of the Maya: 'They Did it to Themselves' (science.nasa.gov)
Content: "The Maya are often depicted as people who lived in complete harmony with their environment,' says PhD student Robert Griffin. "But like many other cultures before and after them, they ended up deforesting and destroying their landscape in efforts to eke out a living in hard times."


A major drought occurred about the time the Maya began to disappear. And at the time of their collapse, the Maya had cut down most of the trees across large swaths of the land to clear fields for growing corn to feed their burgeoning population. They also cut trees for firewood and for making building materials.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why can't bones grow back? (www.sciencefocus.com)
Content: Bones do repair themselves to some extent. But they can’t regenerate or replace themselves fully for the same reason that we can’t grow ourselves a new lung or an extra eye.


Although the DNA to build a complete copy of the entire body is present in every cell with a nucleus, not all of that DNA is active. Most of our cells become specialised during embryonic development so that they only divide to produce cells appropriate to their location in the body.


This is an essential mechanism that keeps us all looking roughly the right shape, despite the fact that our cells are continually dividing and dying off. There seems to be an inverse relationship between how complex an organism is and how well it is able to regenerate after an injury.

question_src: Je! Ufunguzi wa vidole hufanyaje kazi kwenye simu?
all_claims: Ufunguzi wa vidole kwenye simu hufanyika kupitia skana ya uwezo (capacitive) iliyo nyembamba – kwa Apple Touch ID ni takriban microns 170 tu – lakini yenye uwezo wa kunasa maelezo ya alama ya vidole kwa mwonekano wa 550 ppi, hivyo kutoa uchambuzi wa hali ya juu [1].

Chini ya sehemu ya kioo kuna safu ya mamia hadi maelfu ya capacitors ndogo zinazofanya kazi kama “sensori” zinazohifadhi chaji ya umeme; matuta ya alama ya vidole yanapogusa eneo hili hubadilisha chaji kwenye capacitor iliyo chini yake, ilhali mabonde (nafasi za hewa) hayaibadilishi, na mzunguko wa OP-AMP hufuatilia tofauti hizo kabla ya kubadilishwa kuwa data ya kidijiti kupitia ADC [2].

Data hiyo huchambuliwa ili kubaini vipengele vya kipekee na kuhifadhiwa kama kiolezo cha siri; unapoweka kidole tena, simu inaleta upya data hiyo na kulinganisha na kiolezo, na ikifanana, huondoa kizuizi cha skrini papo hapo [3].

Kwa kuwa skana husoma ngozi hai iliyo chini ya uso badala ya ngozi iliyokufa, na hutegemea ishara za kielektroniki zisizo rahisi kunakiliwa, ni vigumu kudanganywa na picha, vidole bandia au mbinu za filamu za kijasusi [1].

Pia ina uwezo na inasoma alama za vidole kwa kiwango cha chini. Hiyo inamaanisha sio kusoma ngozi iliyokufa juu ya kidole chako, lakini ngozi mpya, hai chini ya uso. Hiyo inafanya kuwa chini ya uwezekano wa kudanganywa na alama za vidole bandia, vidole vilivyokatwa, na mitego mingine ya sinema ya kupeleleza ya sci-fi
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How fingerprint scanners work — Optical, capacitive, and other variants (www.androidauthority.com)
Content: nstead of creating a traditional image of a fingerprint, capacitive fingerprint scanners use arrays of tiny capacitor circuits to collect data. As capacitors store electrical charge, connecting them up to conductive plates on the surface of the scanner allows them to be used to track the details of a fingerprint. The stored charge will be changed slightly when a finger’s ridge is placed over the conductive plates. Conversely, an air gap will leave the charge at the capacitor relatively unchanged. An op-amp integrator circuit is used to track these changes, which can then be recorded by an analog-to-digital converter
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How fingerprint scanners work — Optical, capacitive, and other variants (www.androidauthority.com)
Content: Once captured, this digital data is analyzed to look for distinctive and unique fingerprint attributes. They can then be saved for comparison at a later date. What is particularly smart about this design is that it is much tougher to fool than an optical scanner. The results can’t be replicated with an image. Additionally, they are incredibly tough to fool with some sort of prosthetic, as different materials will record slightly different changes in charge at the capacitor. The only real security risks come from either hardware or software hacking.

Creating a large enough array of these capacitors, typically hundreds if not thousands in a single scanner, allows for a highly detailed image of the ridges and valleys of a fingerprint to be created from nothing more than electrical signals. Just like the optical scanner, more capacitors result in a higher resolution scanner

Title: How Touch ID works: Making sense of Apple's fingerprint identity sensor (www.imore.com)
Content: The Touch ID sensor is wafer thin, measuring only 170 microns. However, it can take 550ppi scans, which allows for a good level of detail analysis. It's also capacitive and reads the fingerprint at a sub-dermal level. That means it's not reading the dead skin on the top of your finger, but the new, living skin beneath the surface. That makes it less likely to be fooled by fake fingerprints, severed fingers, and other sci-fi spy movie tropes

Document ID: 2
Title: How fingerprint scanners work — Optical, capacitive, and other variants (www.androidauthority.com)
Content: nstead of creating a traditional image of a fingerprint, capacitive fingerprint scanners use arrays of tiny capacitor circuits to collect data. As capacitors store electrical charge, connecting them up to conductive plates on the surface of the scanner allows them to be used to track the details of a fingerprint. The stored charge will be changed slightly when a finger’s ridge is placed over the conductive plates. Conversely, an air gap will leave the charge at the capacitor relatively unchanged. An op-amp integrator circuit is used to track these changes, which can then be recorded by an analog-to-digital converter

question_src: Kwa nini huwezi kuhisi mawimbi ya sumaku kati ya sumaku?

question_src: Je! Kwa nini Mashariki ya Kati na subcontinent ya India ina utofauti mkubwa kwa dini?
all_claims: Mashariki ya Kati ni kiini cha ustaarabu wa kale na njia kuu za kibiashara kati ya Afrika, Ulaya na Asia; hali hii iliifanya kuwa kitovu cha mwingiliano wa watu, hivyo dini mbalimbali kama Uyahudi, Ukristo na Uislamu, na hata imani za kale za Mesopotamia na Kanaani, ziliibuka na kuendelea sambamba, na leo Wakristo ni 40.5 % ya watu wa Lebanon licha ya kutawaliwa na Uislamu kieneo [1].

Katika subkontinenti ya India, mazingira ya kiutamaduni yenye ustaarabu mrefu yalisababisha kuzaliwa kwa Uhindu takriban miaka 4,000 iliyopita [2], kisha Ubuddha (≈2,500 BP) [5], Jainism iliyohusishwa na Ustaarabu wa Bonde la Indus [6] na Sikhism ya karne ya 15 [4]; baadaye wimbi la Waarabu na Waajemi liliingiza Uislamu karne ya 7 [3] na hata wakimbizi wa Zoroastrianism walipata hifadhi baada ya ushindi wa Kiislamu Iran [7].

Mfuatano huu wa kuzaliwa kwa dini ndani ya maeneo hayo, pamoja na uhamiaji, uvumilivu wa kiutamaduni na mahitaji ya hifadhi ya makundi madogo, umeacha urithi wa dini nyingi zilizoishi bega kwa bega, hivyo kueleza kwa nini leo maeneo haya yana utofauti mkubwa wa kidini.
claims_retained: Mashariki ya Kati ni kiini cha ustaarabu wa kale na njia kuu za kibiashara kati ya Afrika, Ulaya na Asia; hali hii iliifanya kuwa kitovu cha mwingiliano wa watu, hivyo dini mbalimbali kama Uyahudi, Ukristo na Uislamu, na hata imani za kale za Mesopotamia na Kanaani, ziliibuka na kuendelea sambamba, na leo Wakristo ni 40.5 % ya watu wa Lebanon licha ya kutawaliwa na Uislamu kieneo [1].

Wakristo wanawakilisha 40.5% ya Lebanon, ambapo rais wa Lebanon, nusu ya baraza la mawaziri, na nusu ya Bunge hufuata moja ya ibada mbali mbali za Kikristo za Lebanon. claim: Wakati unapotazama kitu mara ya kwanza ubongo wako hulazimika kuchukua na kuchakata habari nyingi mpya—mahusiano ya wahusika, rangi, sauti na matukio—na kadiri habari hiyo inavyoongezeka ndivyo unavyohisi muda unavutwa; mwanasaikolojia Robert Ornstein alionyesha hili miaka ya 1960 alipogundua kuwa watu walikadiria kipindi kuwa kirefu zaidi wakati mkanda ulipokuwa na kelele nyingi zaidi, hata mara mbili ya idadi ya mibofyo ya awali
question_src: Kwa nini inaonekana kama wakati ninapotazama kitu mara ya pili kuzunguka, huenda haraka kuliko mara ya kwanza nilipoiangalia?
all_claims: Wakati unapotazama kitu mara ya kwanza ubongo wako hulazimika kuchukua na kuchakata habari nyingi mpya—mahusiano ya wahusika, rangi, sauti na matukio—na kadiri habari hiyo inavyoongezeka ndivyo unavyohisi muda unavutwa; mwanasaikolojia Robert Ornstein alionyesha hili miaka ya 1960 alipogundua kuwa watu walikadiria kipindi kuwa kirefu zaidi wakati mkanda ulipokuwa na kelele nyingi zaidi, hata mara mbili ya idadi ya mibofyo ya awali [1].
Unapokiangalia tena, taarifa nyingi tayari zimehifadhiwa kwenye kumbukumbu, hivyo ubongo unachakata kidogo tu kilicho tofauti; “mzigo” mdogo wa taarifa husababisha hisia ya kasi zaidi ya muda.
Kwa kifupi, upya wa taarifa hupanua mtazamo wa muda, na ukishaisha—kama katika kutazama mara ya pili—hisia hiyo ya muda “kupungua” huifanya dakika zilezile zionekane kupita haraka.
claims_retained: Wakati unapotazama kitu mara ya kwanza ubongo wako hulazimika kuchukua na kuchakata habari nyingi mpya—mahusiano ya wahusika, rangi, sauti na matukio—na kadiri habari hiyo inavyoongezeka ndivyo unavyohisi muda unavutwa; mwanasaikolojia Robert Ornstein alionyesha hili miaka ya 1960 alipogundua kuwa watu walikadiria kipindi kuwa kirefu zaidi wakati mkanda ulipokuwa na kelele nyingi zaidi, hata mara mbili ya idadi ya mibofyo ya awali [1].

Katika mfululizo wa majaribio, Ornstein alicheza bomba kwa kujitolea na aina mbali mbali za habari za sauti juu yao, kama sauti rahisi za kubonyeza na kelele za kaya. Mwishowe, aliwauliza wakadiria ni muda gani walisikiliza mkanda. Aligundua kuwa wakati kulikuwa na habari zaidi juu ya mkanda, kama vile mara mbili idadi ya kubonyeza kelele, watu wa kujitolea walikadiria kipindi cha muda mrefu.

all_claims: Sababu kuu unaruhusiwa kula ukungu fulani kwenye jibini ni kwamba aina hizo za ukungu huchaguliwa na kufugwa kwa makusudi, hazitoi sumu (mycotoxins) na ndizo zinazoipa jibini laini kama Brie na Camembert ladha na muundo wake, hivyo kwa watu wazima wenye afya ni salama kuzila [1].

Ukungu unaojitokeza bila kudhibitiwa kwenye mkate, matunda au mabaki ya chakula ni wa porini; nyuzi zake hupenya ndani ya chakula na unaweza kutoa mycotoxins kama aflatoxin, ambayo inaweza kusababisha matatizo ya upumuaji, mzio na hata saratani, ndipo unatakiwa kukitupa chakula hicho badala ya kukiondoa sehemu iliyoathirika [2].

Tofauti nyingine ni unyevu: vyakula laini na vyenye unyevunyevu huruhusu ukungu kusambaa haraka, ilhali kwenye jibini gumu kama Cheddar au Parmesan ukungu haupenyi kwa urahisi, hivyo unaweza kukata takribani inchi 1 (≈2.5 cm) kuzunguka eneo lililoathirika na kula sehemu iliyobaki [2].

Hivyo, ni suala la aina ya ukungu, mazingira ya utengenezaji na uwezo wa kuingia ndani ya chakula; ukungu uliodhibitiwa kwenye jibini ni rafiki, lakini ule wa bahati mbaya kwenye vyakula vingine unaweza kuwa adui hatari.

Document ID: 2
Title: You Asked: Can I Scrape Mold Off of Food and Eat It? (time.com)
Content: when visible mold is present, its tentacles—called “threads”—have likely penetrated deep into your food, contaminating even those parts that appear to be mold-free.


The health risks of mold exposure are many. “Mold can produce toxic substances, called mycotoxins,” says Katie George, a clinical dietitian at the University of Kansas Hospital. These toxins can cause respiratory problems, allergic reactions and illness. George says aflatoxin, a specific type mycotoxin found in nuts and grains, can even be cancer-causing.


Mold is usually easy to spot. It often appears as a blue or green discoloration, which can grow a hairy coat if left long enough, Kirkpatrick says. If you’re examining foods in jars—things like pasta sauce or salsa—it’s best to check the underside of the lid and rim of the container for suspicious growths.


Just don’t sniff your foods, Kirkpatrick warns, which could lead to you inhaling mold spores. If you’re worried about mold but don’t see any growths, use common sense. “If the food doesn’t look the way it normally would, and especially if it seems moisture-soaked, toss it,” Kirkpatrick says.


The exceptions: Hard block cheeses like parmesan, cheddar or Swiss. “With those, the mold generally won’t penetrate deep into the product,” Kirkpatrick says. But don’t start scraping, which can release mold spores into the air or allow them to spread to your countertops or other foods. The only safe way to remove that mold is to cut away an inch of cheese all the way around the spot, she says. “You’ll probably cut away some safe parts, but that’s a good rule of thumb.”

Title: Should you eat that moldy cheese? (www.mayoclinic.org)
Content: Of course, not all molds pose a risk. Some types of mold are used to make cheeses, such as Brie and Camembert. These molds are safe for healthy adults to eat. However, these cheeses, as well as other soft cheeses and cheeses made with unpasteurized milk, are best avoided by people with weakened immune systems, older adults, pregnant women, infants and young children.

Document ID: 2
Title: Uliuliza: Je! Ninaweza kuvua chakula na kula? (time.com)
Content: Wakati ukungu unaoonekana upo, mahema yake-inayoitwa "nyuzi"-ina uwezekano wa kupenya ndani ya chakula chako, ikichafua hata sehemu hizo ambazo zinaonekana kuwa hazina ukungu.


Hatari za kiafya za mfiduo wa ukungu ni nyingi. "Mold inaweza kutoa vitu vyenye sumu, inayoitwa mycotoxins," anasema Katie George, mtaalam wa kliniki katika Chuo Kikuu cha Hospitali ya Kansas. Sumu hizi zinaweza kusababisha shida za kupumua, athari za mzio na ugonjwa. George anasema aflatoxin, aina maalum ya mycotoxin inayopatikana katika karanga na nafaka, inaweza kusababisha saratani.


Mold kawaida ni rahisi kuona. Mara nyingi huonekana kama rangi ya bluu au kijani kibichi, ambayo inaweza kukuza kanzu yenye nywele ikiwa imeachwa kwa muda mrefu, Kirkpatrick anasema. Ikiwa unachunguza vyakula kwenye mitungi - vitu kama mchuzi wa pasta au salsa - ni bora kuangalia chini ya kifuniko na mdomo wa chombo kwa ukuaji wa tuhuma.


Usivue vyakula vyako, Kirkpatrick anaonya, ambayo inaweza kusababisha wewe kuvuta pumzi za ukungu. Ikiwa una wasiwasi juu ya ukungu lakini hauoni ukuaji wowote, tumia akili ya kawaida. "Ikiwa chakula haionekani kama kawaida, na haswa ikiwa inaonekana kuwa na unyevu, itupe," Kirkpatrick anasema.


Isipokuwa: jibini ngumu kama Parmesan, Cheddar au Uswizi. "Pamoja na hizo, ukungu kwa ujumla hautaingia ndani ya bidhaa," Kirkpatrick anasema. Lakini usianze kubonyeza, ambayo inaweza kutolewa spores ya ukungu angani au kuiruhusu kuenea kwa vifaa vyako au vyakula vingine. Njia salama tu ya kuondoa ukungu huo ni kukata inchi ya jibini njia yote karibu na mahali hapo, anasema. "Labda utakata sehemu salama, lakini hiyo ni sheria nzuri ya kidole."

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Here's Why Alcohol Labels Don't Show Nutritional Information (www.huffpost.com)
Content: Here’s the short answer: alcohol is not regulated by the FDA, so it’s not subject to the same rules as other food and drink (such as nutritional labels).


Alcohol is regulated by the Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau (TTB) and it would be up to this organization to require alcohol companies to disclose nutritional information.


After Prohibition was repealed in 1932, Congress passed the Alcohol Administration Act in 1935 which would eventually become the TTB to ensure that tax revenue was generated from newly legal alcohol. And so in the ’90s, when the FDA required nutritional labels on other goods, alcohol was not affected. (With the exception of alcoholic drinks with seven percent alcohol or less that don’t contain malted barley, because those are regulated by the FDA.)

Title: Why it's impossible to tickle yourself (www.healthdigest.com)
Content: The area of our brain responsible for the tickle response is the cerebellum (via Scientific American). The cerebellum performs a variety of functions, like the regulation of timing and motor movement (via UT Health). Because of this, our brains are able to anticipate our next move before we make it. A study conducted by researchers at Queen's University found that self-administered physical stimuli were less perceived by the brain than stimuli administered to participants from an external source (via Science Daily). This occurrence is known as sensory attenuation and results in our brain deactivating our own tickle response.


Try as we might, it's not possible to outsmart our own brains. Tickling serves a specific physical purpose when it comes to detecting danger, but it also plays a role in our emotions as well. Studies have found that the same part of our brain is stimulated when we're tickled as when we hear a funny joke. Therefore, tickling can serve multiple purposes — as long as we don't see it coming.

Title: Kwa nini huwezi kujisumbua? (Sayansi.HowStuffworks.com)
Content: Hatujui hisia nyingi zinazozalishwa na harakati zetu. Kwa mfano, labda haujali sana kamba zako za sauti wakati unazungumza. Kwa sababu hiyo hiyo, hatuwezi kujisumbua. Ikiwa tunachukua pande zetu katika jaribio la kujisumbua, ubongo wetu unatarajia mawasiliano haya kutoka kwa mikono na kujiandaa kwa ajili yake. Kwa kuchukua hisia za kutokuwa na wasiwasi na hofu, mwili haujibu tena kama ingekuwa kama mtu mwingine angetutangaza.


Wanasayansi wa ubongo katika Chuo Kikuu cha London wameelezea cerebellum kama sehemu ya ubongo ambayo inatuzuia kujishughulisha. Cerebellum ni mkoa ulio chini ya ubongo ambao unafuatilia harakati zetu. Inaweza kutofautisha hisia zinazotarajiwa kutoka kwa hisia zisizotarajiwa. Hisia inayotarajiwa itakuwa kiwango cha shinikizo vidole vyako vinatumika kwenye kibodi yako wakati wa kuandika. Mhemko usiotarajiwa ungekuwa mtu anayeteleza nyuma yako na kukugonga begani. Wakati ubongo unakataa hisia za kuandika, inalipa umakini mkubwa kwa mtu anayegonga begani mwako. Tofauti ya athari kutoka inayotarajiwa hadi isiyotarajiwa ni majibu yaliyojengwa ambayo labda yalitengenezwa katika historia ya wanadamu ya mapema kugundua wanyama wanaokula wenza.

Title: Je! Kanuni za serikali zinaathirije sekta ya kuchimba mafuta na gesi? (www.investopedia.com)
Content: Sekta ya mafuta na gesi inakabiliwa na uchunguzi mzito kuhusu maswala ya mazingira, kama vile ubora wa hewa na maji na kanuni za pwani.
* Sheria ya Hewa safi inathiri tasnia ya kuchimba visima kwa kusudi la jumla la ACT kupunguza uzalishaji mbaya wa gesi chafu.
* OSHA inasimamia usalama wa wafanyikazi kwa kuanzisha sheria na viwango vya hali ya kufanya kazi, pamoja na miongozo maalum ya kuchimba visima.


## Jinsi kanuni zinavyoathiri sekta ya mafuta na gesi


Hakuna kampuni ya kitaifa ya mafuta na gesi huko Merika. Badala yake, kuna biashara kadhaa za kibinafsi zinazofanya kazi katika sekta hiyo, pamoja na mashirika makubwa ya kimataifa. Shughuli za kampuni hizi zinadhibitiwa kwa kiwango cha serikali na shirikisho. Kuanza uchunguzi wa kuchimba mafuta na gesi, biashara lazima ipate idhini ya maendeleo, idhini ya kuchimba visima, na idhini ya kufanya kazi. Mahitaji ya kupata vibali hivi yameorodheshwa katika kiwango cha serikali. Lazima pia kuwe na kipindi cha ukaguzi wa umma, ambacho mara nyingi huwa na ubishani. Ruhusa zote lazima zipatikane kabla ya kuanza uchunguzi, au mwombaji anaweza kukabiliwa na ucheleweshaji na adhabu ya kifedha na kisheria. Mbali na vibali, kuna viwango na sheria mbali mbali ambazo kampuni lazima zizingatie wakati wa kufanya kazi katika tasnia ya mafuta na gesi.

Title: Government and the Private Sector – Business Ethics (opentextbc.ca)
Content: For two centuries, businesses have profited from using and selling the nation’s natural resources. The tradeoff in a free but regulated economic system such as that in the United States is to allow the continued extraction of natural resources but to require a commitment to protection of the environment in return. This bargain promotes long-term sustainability by balancing the interests of the environment, state and local governments, and users of natural resources. However, this public-private collaboration is not without controversy.


The Keystone XL Pipeline


The case of the Keystone XL pipeline is an example of the emotional aspect of many environmental disputes, as our nation tries to come to grips with sustainability issues. Local and national opponents of the Keystone XL pipeline, which would carry crude oil from Canada to the Texas Gulf Coast, have protested for years to stop its construction ((Figure)). These efforts accelerated after President Trump approved the pipeline in March 2017, reversing President Obama’s decision to reject it on environmental grounds. It appears that the pipeline is likely to be completed, pending legal action still unresolved in Nebraska.

Title: How do government regulations impact the oil and gas drilling sector? (www.investopedia.com)
Content: The oil and gas sector faces heavy scrutiny regarding environmental issues, such as air and water quality and offshore regulation.
* The Clean Air Act impacts the drilling industry with the overall aim of the act to reduce harmful emissions of greenhouse gases.
* OSHA regulates worker safety by establishing rules and standards for working conditions, including specific guidelines for drilling.


## How Regulations Impact the Oil and Gas Sector


There is no national oil and gas company in the United States. Instead, there are numerous private businesses operating in the sector, including large international corporations. The activities of these companies are regulated on the state and federal level. To begin exploration for oil and gas drilling, the business must obtain a development permit, a drilling permit, and an operating permit. The requirements for gaining these permits are stipulated at the state level. There must also be a public review period, which is often contentious. All permits must be obtained prior to beginning exploration, or the applicant may face delays and financial and legal penalties. In addition to permits, there are various standards and rules that companies must comply with when operating in the oil and gas industry.

Content: Kwa karne mbili, biashara zimefaidika kutokana na kutumia na kuuza rasilimali asili ya taifa. Biashara katika mfumo wa uchumi wa bure lakini uliodhibitiwa kama vile huko Merika ni kuruhusu uchimbaji unaoendelea wa rasilimali asili lakini kuhitaji kujitolea kwa ulinzi wa mazingira kwa malipo. Biashara hii inakuza uendelevu wa muda mrefu kwa kusawazisha masilahi ya mazingira, serikali na serikali za mitaa, na watumiaji wa rasilimali asili. Walakini, ushirikiano huu wa umma na wa kibinafsi sio bila ubishi.


Bomba la Keystone XL


Kesi ya Bomba la Keystone XL ni mfano wa hali ya kihemko ya mizozo mingi ya mazingira, kwani taifa letu linajaribu kupata masuala ya uendelevu. Wapinzani wa ndani na wa kitaifa wa bomba la Keystone XL, ambalo lingebeba mafuta yasiyosafishwa kutoka Canada hadi Pwani ya Ghuba ya Texas, wameandamana kwa miaka kukomesha ujenzi wake ((takwimu)). Jaribio hili liliharakisha baada ya Rais Trump kupitisha bomba hilo mnamo Machi 2017, na kurudisha uamuzi wa Rais Obama kuikataa kwa misingi ya mazingira. Inatokea kwamba bomba linaweza kukamilika, inasubiri hatua za kisheria ambazo bado hazijasuluhishwa huko Nebraska.

Title: What Parents Need to Know About College Binge Drinking (drugfree.org)
Content: First, we know that adolescent and young adult brains are “primed” for risk-taking and exploratory behavior — some more than others. But in general, college students are likely to focus on immediate rewards and an experience that might make a “good story” later rather than think about the possible consequences of their behavior. Unfortunately, the consequences of this sort of behavior can change a life trajectory very quickly.

A second driving force behind excessive drinking behavior is the perception that it is normative and accepted — the idea that “everyone is doing it” — when in fact it’s a minority of students. Many schools try to send messages about the relative rarity of very heavy consumption of alcohol to correct these misperceptions by students.

Third, there are many individual-level factors that heighten one’s risk for binge drinking, like being impulsive, or having a tendency to break rules. Lastly, the availability of alcohol is key. Wale wasiokunywa hawapati madhara hayo kwa sababu pombe haijaingia mwilini mwao; sumu na athari zake hutegemea uwepo wake katika damu na ubongo.

Pombe ikishafika ubongoni husisimua neva katika eneo la tegmental (VTA) kuachilia dopamini, kemikali ya “zawadi”, na hisia hii huwafanya walaji waendelee kunywa hata pale madhara yakianza kuonekana [2].
Nchini Marekani karibu 40% ya wanafunzi wa vyuo vikuu huripoti tabia hii ya kunywa kupita kiasi [1].
Kundi hili pia lina tabia ya kuzingatia tu thawabu za haraka na “hadithi nzuri”, wakisahau madhara ya muda mrefu, jambo linalochochea maumivu na athari mbaya kwa wanaokunywa [3].
Kwa kifupi, ni wale wanaomeza pombe pekee wanaoumia kwa sababu ndiyo wanaoingiza kemikali hatarishi mwilini, inayobadilisha kazi za ubongo na kusababisha sumu, wakati wasiotumia hawana mfiduo huo.
claims_retained: Pombe ikishafika ubongoni husisimua neva katika eneo la tegmental (VTA) kuachilia dopamini, kemikali ya “zawadi”, na hisia hii huwafanya walaji waendelee kunywa hata pale madhara yakianza kuonekana [2].

Huko Merika, unywaji pombe ni wasiwasi mkubwa wa afya ya umma, haswa miongoni mwa watu wazima wa umri wa vyuo vikuu (wenye umri wa miaka 18 hadi 22). Karibu 40% ya wanafunzi wa vyuo vikuu huko Merika wanaripoti kunywa.^1

Document ID: 2
Title: Prone to binge drinking? This might be why (www.medicalnewstoday.com)
Content: Dopamine helps the brain learn new things, but it may also lead us down the path of addiction.

Dopamine earned its nickname because it is a feel-good chemical that is released as a reward for the brain when we learn new things or during pleasurable activities such as sex. It is also the substance that “tells” us to prolong the pleasure and continue to “chase the high.”

In the case of alcohol dependence, when alcohol reaches the brain, it causes the neurons in a region called the ventral tegmental area (VTA) to release dopamine.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: What Parents Need to Know About College Binge Drinking (drugfree.org)
Content: First, we know that adolescent and young adult brains are “primed” for risk-taking and exploratory behavior — some more than others. But in general, college students are likely to focus on immediate rewards and an experience that might make a “good story” later rather than think about the possible consequences of their behavior. Unfortunately, the consequences of this sort of behavior can change a life trajectory very quickly.

A second driving force behind excessive drinking behavior is the perception that it is normative and accepted — the idea that “everyone is doing it” — when in fact it’s a minority of students. Many schools try to send messages about the relative rarity of very heavy consumption of alcohol to correct these misperceptions by students.

Third, there are many individual-level factors that heighten one’s risk for binge drinking, like being impulsive, or having a tendency to break rules. Lastly, the availability of alcohol is key. For example, where there is widespread access and low prices, there will be a greater likelihood that students will engage in heavy drinking as compared with places where access is more lim

Title: Kile Wazazi Wanahitaji Kujua Kuhusu Kunywa Kunywa kwa Chuo (Dawa za Kulevya)
Content: Kwanza, tunajua kuwa akili za vijana na vijana "hutolewa" kwa tabia ya kuchukua hatari na uchunguzi-wengine zaidi ya wengine. Lakini kwa ujumla, wanafunzi wa vyuo vikuu wanaweza kuzingatia thawabu za haraka na uzoefu ambao unaweza kufanya "hadithi nzuri" baadaye badala ya kufikiria juu ya athari zinazowezekana za tabia zao. Kwa bahati mbaya, matokeo ya tabia ya aina hii yanaweza kubadilisha hali ya maisha haraka sana.

Nguvu ya pili ya kuendesha nyuma ya tabia ya kunywa kupita kiasi ni maoni kwamba ni ya kawaida na inakubaliwa - wazo kwamba "kila mtu anafanya" - wakati kwa kweli ni wachache wa wanafunzi. Shule nyingi hujaribu kutuma ujumbe juu ya rarity ya unywaji mkubwa wa pombe ili kurekebisha maoni haya potofu na wanafunzi.

Tatu, kuna sababu nyingi za kiwango cha mtu binafsi ambazo zinaongeza hatari ya mtu kwa kunywa, kama kuwa na msukumo, au kuwa na tabia ya kuvunja sheria. Mwishowe, kupatikana kwa pombe ni muhimu. Kwa mfano, ambapo kuna ufikiaji ulioenea na bei ya chini, kutakuwa na uwezekano mkubwa kwamba wanafunzi watajihusisha na unywaji mzito ikilinganishwa na maeneo ambayo ufikiaji ni zaidi

Content: The odds on display never reflect the true probability or chance of an event occurring (or not occurring). There is always a profit margin added by the bookmaker in these odds, which means that the payout to the successful punter is always less than what they should have received if the odds had reflected the true chances.

The bookmaker needs to estimate the true probability or chance of an outcome correctly in order to set the odds on display in such a way that it profits the bookmaker regardless of an event outcome.

Title: Understanding the Maths Behind Betting Odds (Explained) - (caanberry.com)
Content: Bookmakers don’t predict the winner to make their money, and if you understand why you’ll quickly understand how betting odds work. The structure is always the same.

“Betting odds work by reflecting the implied chance of an outcome in monetary terms inclusive of the operator’s margin.”

Let’s think about that. It doesn’t matter what sport or event you’re betting on. Betting odds come down to two things:

 * Probability * Bookmaker margin, or overround

Take a football game for example. We have three outcomes and they are all even. They all have a 33.3% chance of winning or 2/1 in betting odds terms. But the bookmaker won’t offer 2/1 on all the outcomes because they want to make a profit. They do this by taking a margin and increasing the overround.

Content: "Haitakuwa na maelezo moja tu, ndio msingi," Losey anasema. "Kutakuwa na sababu nyingi za kuchangia."


#####Kwanini ni wazuri sana?


Kuna, hata hivyo, nadharia mbili za picha kubwa ndani ya jamii ya kisayansi inayoelezea ni kwanini samaki ni wa kupendeza sana.


Moja ilizingatiwa kwanza na Alfred Russel Wallace, mtu asiyejulikana lakini muhimu sana wa Charles Darwin katika karne ya 19. Wallace alipendekeza kwamba rangi mkali zilizovaliwa na samaki wa mwamba zinaweza kuwasaidia kujificha katika mazingira ya rangi sawa. Wakati samaki ni nyekundu na kijani na zambarau na bluu, ndivyo pia matumbawe, sifongo na sehemu zingine za msingi wa kuona nyuma yao. "Alisema, vema, rangi hizi zinaweza kuwa na kazi ya kinga - zinaweza kufanya kazi kama kuficha kwa maana dhidi ya asili hizi zenye nguvu," Rosenthal anasema.

Title: Why Are Reef Fish so Colorful? The Science Behind the Beauty | Scuba Diving News, Gear, Education | Dive Training Magazine (dtmag.com)
Content: The other idea is one developed by biologist Konrad Lorenz in the mid-20th century. He suggested that fish are conspicuously colored to help them identify their own species in the crowded reef environment, where there is direct competition between not only other species, but also members of their own.


Consequently, colors may allow for individual recognition. Even with some reef fish’s intricate color pattern, no two are exactly alike. In his research on cleaner fish in the Indo-Pacific region, Lorenz studied striped cleaner wrasse (Labroides dimidiatus). While he couldn’t tag the little fish, he could photograph them and tell the difference between individuals by their markings in photographs. “If we can, you can bet they can,” he says.


By having “iconically different” color patterns, Rosenthal says, fish are able to minimize the costs of aggression — in other words, if you’re different from everyone you’re not competing with, you’re not going to have a lot of inter-species conflict that would sap your energy.
---

Title: Why Are Reef Fish so Colorful? The Science Behind the Beauty | Scuba Diving News, Gear, Education | Dive Training Magazine (dtmag.com)
Content: One of the ways they’ve done it is to use light conditions to communicate signals — mating, camouflage and territory — in a context that matches the clarity of the water.


“What this means is that fish on a reef in the Caribbean near the surface, can basically use color information and fine spatial information to encode species identity,” Rosenthal says. “In the Pacific, you don’t have that luxury anymore, because there’s not as much light, and there’s not as much fidelity of spatial information.”

Content: “There isn’t going to be just one explanation, that’s the bottom line,” Losey says. “There are going to be a lot of contributing factors.”


#### Why Are They So Pretty?


There are, however, two big-picture theories within the scientific community explaining why fish are so colorful.


One was first considered by Alfred Russel Wallace, a less-known but equally significant contemporary of Charles Darwin in the 19th century. Wallace suggested that the bright colors worn by reef fish may actually help them hide in an equally colorful environment. While fish are pink and green and purple and blue, so are the corals, sponges and other parts of the visually complex background behind them. “He said, well, these colors might actually have a protective function — they might actually function like camouflage in a sense against these heterogeneous backgrounds,” Rosenthal says.

prompt:

Title: Why Are Reef Fish so Colorful? The Science Behind the Beauty | Scuba Diving News, Gear, Education | Dive Training Magazine (dtmag.com)
Content: “There isn’t going to be just one explanation, that’s the bottom line,” Losey says. “There are going to be a lot of contributing factors.”


#### Why Are They So Pretty?


There are, however, two big-picture theories within the scientific community explaining why fish are so colorful.


One was first considered by Alfred Russel Wallace, a less-known but equally significant contemporary of Charles Darwin in the 19th century. Wallace suggested that the bright colors worn by reef fish may actually help them hide in an equally colorful environment. While fish are pink and green and purple and blue, so are the corals, sponges and other parts of the visually complex background behind them. “He said, well, these colors might actually have a protective function — they might actually function like camouflage in a sense against these heterogeneous backgrounds,” Rosenthal says.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Are Reef Fish so Colorful? The Science Behind the Beauty | Scuba Diving News, Gear, Education | Dive Training Magazine (dtmag.com)
Content: The other idea is one developed by biologist Konrad Lorenz in the mid-20th century. He suggested that fish are conspicuously colored to help them identify their own species in the crowded reef environment, where there is direct competition between not only other species, but also members of their own.


Consequently, colors may allow for individual recognition. Even with some reef fish’s intricate color pattern, no two are exactly alike. In his research on cleaner fish in the Indo-Pacific region, Lorenz studied striped cleaner wrasse (Labroides dimidiatus). While he couldn’t tag the little fish, he could photograph them and tell the difference between individuals by their markings in photographs. “If we can, you can bet they can,” he says.


By having “iconically different” color patterns, Rosenthal says, fish are able to minimize the costs of aggression — in other words, if you’re different from everyone you’re not competing with, you’re not going to have a lot of inter-species conflict that would sap your energy.
---

"Hii inamaanisha nini kwamba samaki kwenye mwamba katika Karibiani karibu na uso, wanaweza kutumia habari ya rangi na habari nzuri ya anga ili kuingiza kitambulisho cha spishi," Rosenthal anasema. "Katika Pasifiki, hauna anasa tena, kwa sababu hakuna mwanga mwingi, na hakuna uaminifu mwingi wa habari za anga."

question_src: Ni nini husababisha kituo cha barafu kuwa weupe?
all_claims: Sehemu nyeupe iliyo katikati ya kizuizi cha barafu hutokana na mkusanyiko wa viputo vidogo vya hewa na uchafu uliokuwa umeyeyushwa ndani ya maji kabla ya kuganda [1].

Maji yanapoganda huanza kufungia kutoka nje kuelekea ndani; fuwele safi za barafu hujitengeneza kwanza na kusukuma gesi (kama oksijeni) na madini kuyaelekeza kwenye kioevu kilichobaki, hivyo vitu hivi hukwama katikati sehemu hiyo inapoganda mwisho [2].

Viputo hivyo pamoja na chembechembe za madini hufanya eneo hilo litawanyishe mwanga badala ya kuupitisha moja kwa moja, na ndiyo sababu linaonekana jeupe au “lenye mawingu” tofauti na kingo za mchemraba zilizo wazi [4].

Uchafu unaohusishwa mara nyingi ni kalsiamu, magnesiamu, fluoride, nitrati na vitu vingine vya kikaboni ambavyo uchujaji wa kawaida hauondoi, hivyo kuwezesha athari hii kuonekana hasa kwenye maji ya bomba [3].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Ni nini hufanya katikati ya barafu ya barafu kuwa nyeupe? (www.forbes.com)
Content: Vitu vyeupe kwenye cubes zako za barafu ni kweli Bubbles ndogo sana za hewa. Karibu maji yote ya asili unayoshughulikia yana oksijeni kwa kiwango fulani.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: What Makes The Center Of Ice Cubes White? (www.forbes.com)
Content: As the water freezes, it wants to form a regular crystalline structure (ice). That means impurities like oxygen and other dissolved gasses are pushed away from the crystallization front into the remaining liquid. This means that the last parts of the ice cube to crystallize end up with most of the impurities. If you’ll take a look at your home made ice cubes, you’ll note that the parts of the ice cube that were at the bottom of the tray are the milky colored bits. That’s because those were the last parts to freeze. The ice cubes in your tray froze from the top downward, which pushed the contaminant air downward until it was trapped at the bottom and had nowhere else to go.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Why Are Some Ice Cubes Cloudy While Others Are Clear? » Science ABC (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: The most common impurities found in tap water include lime (also known as limescale), calcium, fluoride, nitrates, magnesium and certain other organic elements that are practically impossible to remove with regular filtration methods. So, when water freezes, the impurities that were evenly distributed in the water, tend to congregate near the middle, making ice cubes the whitest at their center.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: What Makes Ice Cubes Cloudy? (www.livescience.com)
Content: The main reason is that the (hopefully) crystal-clear water you pour into the ice trays is not as pure as it seems, containing small amounts of (hopefully) harmless suspended minerals and sediment.


Because all objects freeze from the outside in, the center of the cube is the last to solidify. Water free of minerals and impurities freezes first, pushing the cloudy parts containing the sediment (and tiny trapped air bubbles) toward the center. The result is a harmless (but not particularly photogenic) ice cube clouding.
---

Title: What Makes The Center Of Ice Cubes White? (www.forbes.com)
Content: As the water freezes, it wants to form a regular crystalline structure (ice). That means impurities like oxygen and other dissolved gasses are pushed away from the crystallization front into the remaining liquid. This means that the last parts of the ice cube to crystallize end up with most of the impurities. If you’ll take a look at your home made ice cubes, you’ll note that the parts of the ice cube that were at the bottom of the tray are the milky colored bits. That’s because those were the last parts to freeze. The ice cubes in your tray froze from the top downward, which pushed the contaminant air downward until it was trapped at the bottom and had nowhere else to go.

Document ID: 3
Title: Je! Kwa nini barafu za barafu huwa na mawingu wakati zingine ziko wazi? »Sayansi ABC (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: Uchafu wa kawaida unaopatikana katika maji ya bomba ni pamoja na chokaa (pia inajulikana kama limescale), kalsiamu, fluoride, nitrati, magnesiamu na vitu vingine vya kikaboni ambavyo haiwezekani kuondoa na njia za kawaida za kuchuja. Kwa hivyo, wakati maji yanapofungia, uchafu ambao ulisambazwa sawasawa ndani ya maji, huwa unakusanyika karibu na katikati, na kufanya barafu za barafu kuwa nyeupe katikati yao.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: What Makes Ice Cubes Cloudy? (www.livescience.com)
Content: The main reason is that the (hopefully) crystal-clear water you pour into the ice trays is not as pure as it seems, containing small amounts of (hopefully) harmless suspended minerals and sediment.


Because all objects freeze from the outside in, the center of the cube is the last to solidify. Water free of minerals and impurities freezes first, pushing the cloudy parts containing the sediment (and tiny trapped air bubbles) toward the center. The result is a harmless (but not particularly photogenic) ice cube clouding.

Yaliyomo ya maji ndani ya lensi na safu ya machozi kati ya lensi na jicho huongeza mvutano wa sidiria unaozibana sehemu sahihi, kwa hiyo “hufanya iwe ndani ya uso wa macho kwa usahihi”[4].

all_claims: Ukivaa glasi zilizo na diopter iliyotengenezwa kwa hitilafu ya macho ya mtu mwingine, lenzi hiyo hubadilisha mwanga kwa kiwango kinachofuta kosa lao; kwa macho yasiyo na kosa (au yenye kosa tofauti) marekebisho hayo hugeuka kuwa kosa jipya, hivyo karibu utaona jinsi ambavyo wao huona wanapovua glasi.

Mfano, glasi za –2 D (zinazorekebisha myopia) zikitumiwa na mtu mwenye macho ya 0 D zitasababisha upate ukungu wa mbali na utalazimika kusogeza kitu takribani sentimita 50 mbele ili kione-kane, hali inayofanana na uoni wa myopia ya –2 D bila glasi [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Are You Nearsighted or Farsighted? | Vision Test From Home | EyeQue (www.eyeque.com)
Content: A diopter is a standard unit of measurement on eyeglass prescriptions. A negative diopter number specifies nearsightedness. A positive number indicates farsightedness. A diopter designates how powerful a lens is needed to properly focus light on a person’s retina. Many people have astigmatism in addition to myopia or hyperopia. In astigmatism, the cornea has a curvature imperfection, or the lens is distorted, resulting in both near and far objects appearing blurry.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Kusoma Glasi Nguvu Chati na Mwongozo wa Makumu | Kusoma Glasses.com (www.readingglasses.com)
Content: Lenses za kusoma zimekadiriwa katika diopters, matumizi ya formula ya waganga. Watengenezaji wa glasi za kusoma mara nyingi huchangia machafuko ya watumiaji kwa kurejelea nguvu ya ukuzaji na nguvu ya diopter kwa kubadilishana. Sio kitu kimoja. Lakini ni rahisi kwa watu kuelewa ukuzaji kuliko sayansi ya lensi.

Maelezo kidogo zaidi ya kiufundi. Na kila chaguo la nguvu, au "Diopter", kuna sehemu tamu ya doa ambapo maono ya karibu huletwa kwa umakini. Hii inabadilika kutoka kwa mtu hadi mtu. Ikiwa diopter ni dhaifu sana kwa mahitaji yako ya kibinafsi, utahitaji kusonga mbali mbali na uso wako ili kuiona wazi. Ikiwa diopter ni nguvu sana, aina hiyo ya tamu itakuwa karibu kuliko unavyopendelea. Mtu wa kawaida husoma nyenzo kati ya inchi 14 - 18 mbali na uso wao. Ikiwa ungetaka kurejesha safu ya kusoma vizuri ambayo iko ndani ya hiyo, pata diopter inayoongeza umakini katika safu hii. Kwa kulinganisha, ikiwa unafanya kazi kwenye dawati lako na mfuatiliaji wa kompyuta yako ni umbali wa inchi 24, utahitaji nguvu dhaifu kuliko vile ungesoma.

question_src: Je! Ni tofauti gani kubwa kati ya kalenda ya Julian na Gregorian ambayo ilifanya ulimwengu ubadilike?
all_claims: Kalenda ya Julian, iliyobuniwa 46 KK, iliongeza mwaka kuwa na urefu uliozidi uhalisia kwa takriban dakika 11, hivyo ilikwama siku moja kila baada ya miaka 128 [2].
Kufikia 1582 hitilafu hiyo ilikuwa imefikia siku 10 ukilinganisha na majira ya jua, jambo lililosababisha sikukuu na misimu kutolingana na tarehe rasmi [2].
Ili kusahihisha tatizo hilo Papa Gregory XIII alianzisha kalenda ya Gregorian na kuagiza siku 10 (Oktoba 5–14, 1582) zifutwe mara moja ili kurudisha ulinganifu kati ya tarehe na majira [4].
Kalenda mpya ilitengenezwa kuwa sahihi zaidi kuliko ya Julian, hivyo kupunguza kasi ya kukusanya makosa na kudumisha ulinganifu wa tarehe na misimu kwa muda mrefu [3].
Tofauti hii ya kimsingi katika usahihi ndiyo iliyosababisha, kati ya 1582 na 1927, karibu kila nchi kuacha kalenda ya Julian na kuhamia kalenda ya Gregorian [6].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Kwa nini usukani hauko katikati? (carssimplified.com)
Content: Kwa kweli kuna sababu chache kwa nini usukani hauko katikati ya dashibodi.


## Kukaa kwa watu wazima


Gari ingelazimika kuwa pana zaidi ya kukaa kwa raha watu wazima watatu kwenye safu ya kiti cha mbele. Watu wazima wawili kwenye kiti cha mbele wangesababisha dereva kukaa kidogo kushoto au kulia. Kuongeza gari kungefanya kuwa ngumu zaidi kuegesha, na kuongeza upinzani wa upepo.


## Safu ya uendeshaji


Safu wima inahitaji chumba cha kuungana na vifaa vingine vya uendeshaji chini ya kofia, na katika magari mengi (yale yaliyo na injini yao mbele, haswa), injini ingekuwa njiani, na kusambaza uhusiano wa karibu na injini ingefanya usukani kuwa mzito.


## Kujulikana


Wakati kukaa katikati kunamaanisha pande zote mbili za gari ziko mbali na dereva, pia ingefanya kuwa na kioo cha katikati kuwa ngumu, na ingemsogeza dereva zaidi kutoka katikati ya barabara, na kuifanya kuwa ngumu kuona karibu na pembe kadhaa, kama zile za miingiliano/barabara kuu.


## Ingiza/toka kwa urahisi


Kiti katikati ya gari kinaweza kuchukua juhudi zaidi kuingia na kutoka kwa urahisi, ndiyo sababu magari mengi ya mbio bado yamebaki au upande wa kulia.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Is Your Car’s Steering Wheel on the Left? Blame the Teamsters (www.gearpatrol.com)
Content: There are plenty of rumors and conflicting reports out there about the origins of the driving positions, but the most likely reason might surprise you. The reason you drive on the right and your wheel is on the left? Teamsters.


No, not the union of truck drivers that made Jimmy Hoffa famous. The people who gave them their name: those who actually drove teams of horses to pull wagons around in the pre-Industrial Revolution days. As best as our research could dig up, many wagons lacked a place to sit, so the teamster who was driving the horses would sit in the next-best place to see both road and steeds: atop one of the horses pulling up the rear. As most people are right-handed, most teamsters would need the whip in their right hand — so it made more sense to sit on the left-hand horse.


And with most drivers sitting on the left-hand side of their rides, it made sense to arrange traffic so that vehicles would ride on the right-hand side of the road. This, as we all know from driving today, enables the drivers to sit closer to the center line — and thus closer to oncoming traffic, so they could better gauge how close they were passing to those onrushing vehicles.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Kwa nini usukani hauko katikati? (carssimplified.com)
Content: Kwa kweli kuna sababu chache kwa nini usukani hauko katikati ya dashibodi.


## Kukaa kwa watu wazima


Gari ingelazimika kuwa pana zaidi ya kukaa kwa raha watu wazima watatu kwenye safu ya kiti cha mbele. Watu wazima wawili kwenye kiti cha mbele wangesababisha dereva kukaa kidogo kushoto au kulia. Kuongeza gari kungefanya kuwa ngumu zaidi kuegesha, na kuongeza upinzani wa upepo.


## Safu ya uendeshaji


Safu wima inahitaji chumba cha kuungana na vifaa vingine vya uendeshaji chini ya kofia, na katika magari mengi (yale yaliyo na injini yao mbele, haswa), injini ingekuwa njiani, na kusambaza uhusiano wa karibu na injini ingefanya usukani kuwa mzito.


## Kujulikana


Wakati kukaa katikati kunamaanisha pande zote mbili za gari ziko mbali na dereva, pia ingefanya kuwa na kioo cha katikati kuwa ngumu, na ingemsogeza dereva zaidi kutoka katikati ya barabara, na kuifanya kuwa ngumu kuona karibu na pembe kadhaa, kama zile za miingiliano/barabara kuu.


## Ingiza/toka kwa urahisi


Kiti katikati ya gari kinaweza kuchukua juhudi zaidi kuingia na kutoka kwa urahisi, ndiyo sababu magari mengi ya mbio bado yamebaki au upande wa kulia.

Document ID: 2
Title: Why Is Your Car’s Steering Wheel on the Left? Blame the Teamsters (www.gearpatrol.com)
Content: There are plenty of rumors and conflicting reports out there about the origins of the driving positions, but the most likely reason might surprise you. The reason you drive on the right and your wheel is on the left? Teamsters.


No, not the union of truck drivers that made Jimmy Hoffa famous. The people who gave them their name: those who actually drove teams of horses to pull wagons around in the pre-Industrial Revolution days. As best as our research could dig up, many wagons lacked a place to sit, so the teamster who was driving the horses would sit in the next-best place to see both road and steeds: atop one of the horses pulling up the rear. As most people are right-handed, most teamsters would need the whip in their right hand — so it made more sense to sit on the left-hand horse.


And with most drivers sitting on the left-hand side of their rides, it made sense to arrange traffic so that vehicles would ride on the right-hand side of the road. This, as we all know from driving today, enables the drivers to sit closer to the center line — and thus closer to oncoming traffic, so they could better gauge how close they were passing to those onrushing vehicles.

prompt:

Title: What Is a Bathroom Shaver Socket? (www.wise-geek.com)
Content: The bathroom shaver socket is mounted in an isolation transformer that cuts it off from the rest of the electrical system. This limits the risk of electrical shock, a concern in the bathroom where lots of water can be present. In addition, the current is very low. It will power a shaver or electric toothbrush, but not an item like a heater or a hair dryer. The circuit will shut down if it gets too hot, thus keeping the user as safe as possible.


Often a bathroom shaver socket is mounted up high and may be behind a hidden panel. There may be a small plaque indicating that it should only be used with bathroom shavers.
---

Title: Kwa nini soketi za kunyoa bafuni ziko salama? (www.thenakedscientists.com)
Content: Wanatumia kinachojulikana kama kibadilishaji. Mwili wako umeunganishwa na 'ardhi', kupitia miguu yako. Ukigusa waya wa moja kwa moja wa usambazaji wa kawaida wa umeme unapata voltage kamili ya mains (230V jamaa na dunia) na ikiwa utagusa waya wa upande wowote una volts chache (karibu jamaa ya sifuri na Dunia). Na transformer ya kutengwa, waya ni 'kuelea'. Bado kuna voltage kamili ya mains kati yao lakini wote 'wametengwa' na Dunia. Yeyote unayogusa, ni ndogo tu ya sasa itapita kupitia wewe na voltage yake, jamaa na Dunia, itakuwa karibu sifuri - hautapata mshtuko. Waya mwingine utakuwa katika voltage kamili ya mains lakini, kwani hauiguse, haupati mshtuko.

Title: Socket Outlets For Shavers: What Do You Need To Consider? - Professional Electrician (professional-electrician.com)
Content: The transformer of a shaver supply unit is an isolating transformer, intended to provide protection against electric shock by ‘electrical separation’. The transformer is of the short-circuit proof type (either inherently or noninherently).


A thermal cut-out is provided in a shaver supply unit to limit the temperature of the transformer under conditions of short-circuit or overload. The cut-out may be of either the self-resetting type or the manually resetting type.

Hii inazuia hatari ya mshtuko wa umeme, wasiwasi katika bafuni ambapo maji mengi yanaweza kuwapo. Kwa kuongezea, ya sasa ni ya chini sana. Mara nyingi tundu la kunyoa bafuni limewekwa juu na linaweza kuwa nyuma ya jopo lililofichwa. Kunaweza kuwa na jalada ndogo inayoonyesha kuwa inapaswa kutumiwa tu na shavu za bafuni.

Document ID: 2
Title: Why are Shaver Sockets in the Bathroom Safe? (www.thenakedscientists.com)
Content: They use a so-called isolating transformer. Your body is connected to 'earth', through your feet. If you touch the live wire of a normal electrical supply you get the full mains voltage (230V relative to earth) across you and if you touch the neutral wire you only have a few volts (about zero relative to earth). With an isolating transformer, the wires are 'floating'. There is still the full mains voltage between them but they are both 'isolated' from earth. Whichever one you touch, only a tiny current will flow through you and its voltage, relative to earth, will be nearly zero - you will get no shock. The other wire will be at full mains voltage but, as you aren't touching it, you don't get a shock.

Title: Dead Pixel Tests To Fix a Stuck Pixel On Your Monitor (helpdeskgeek.com)
Content: A stuck pixel appears in one of the three colors its sub-pixels form, which is either red, green or blue. If you spot an odd pixel and it’s in one of these colors, it’s a stuck pixel.

Dead pixels, on the other hand, appear like small black rectangles because their sub-pixels are completely off owing to a broken transistor, which means no power is supplied to the pixels for them to light up.

[Image]

In some cases though, a black pixel could be stuck, not necessarily dead. The main distinction is that a stuck pixel is permanently on, while a dead pixel just won’t turn on anymore. Unlike dead pixels, which are rarely resurrected, stuck pixels are just stubborn, and can respond to different remedies.
---

Title: fidia (www.nationalgeographic.org)
Content: Condensation ni mchakato ambapo mvuke wa maji huwa kioevu. Ni mabadiliko ya kuyeyuka, ambapo maji ya kioevu huwa mvuke.


Condensation hufanyika moja ya njia mbili: ama hewa imepozwa hadi kwa umande wake au inakuwa inajaa sana na mvuke wa maji ambayo haiwezi kushikilia maji zaidi.


Uwezo wa umande


Uhakika wa umande ni joto ambalo fidia hufanyika. (Dew ni maji yaliyopunguzwa tu katika anga.) Joto la hewa linaweza kufikia au kuanguka chini ya kiwango cha umande kwa kawaida, kama kawaida hufanya usiku. Hiyo ndio sababu lawn, magari, na nyumba mara nyingi hufungwa na matone ya maji asubuhi.


Condensation pia inaweza kutoa matone ya maji nje ya makopo ya soda au glasi za maji baridi. Wakati hewa ya joto inapiga uso baridi, inafikia hatua yake ya umande na inajitokeza. Hii inaacha matone ya maji kwenye glasi au inaweza.

Title: UCSB Science Line (scienceline.ucsb.edu)
Content: The drops of water on the outside of a cold cup come from the air.Believe it or not, there is a significant amount of water vapor in the air that we breathe. This is why we have humidity. A cold cup can take thermal energy out of the water vapor in the air next to the cup, causing the water vapor to condense into liquid water. The same kind of phenomena occurs when you take ice cream out of the freezer - you see frost on the outside of the container. In this case the cup (or ice cream container) is below the freezing point of water. Therefore, the water vapor from the air will freeze when it comes in contact with the container, forming a layer of frost.

Title: Steamy Science: Demonstrating Condensation (www.scientificamerican.com)
Content: Ever wonder where those little drops of water on the outside of your cold can of soda pop or bottle of water come from? That’s condensation! Cold surfaces can cause water vapor in the air to cool down, condense and form tiny beads of liquid. The molecules in these miniscule droplets of water are grouped far more closely together than when they were in their gas phase, and exert less pressure—a fact that has some pretty cool physical implications.

Title: 20 Surprising Things That Can Keep You Cooler All Summer (bestlifeonline.com)
Content: The shade from trees is actually cooler than shade from buildings and other man-made objects, thanks to a process called transpiration. A tree maintains its temperature by circulating water around inside itself and releasing moisture into the atmosphere, to keep itself and the air around it cool. Buildings, on the other hand, trap heat and radiate it back into the surrounding environment.

Title: Why Is Gold So Valuable? [UPDATED for 2021] (www.gainesvillecoins.com)
Content: Gold’s Special Properties Have Many Industrial Applications


On the Periodic Table of Elements, gold is shown as the symbol Au, referencing the Latin aurum. Its atomic number is 79, grouping it with the "noble metals." Its chemical properties distinguish gold from alkaline metals such as lithium.


Science has shown that gold is commonly found in industrial settings. It's an extremely useful material beyond its applications in jewelry, finance, and art.

Title: Why do we value gold? (www.bbc.com)
Content: Silver tarnishes - it reacts with minute amounts of sulphur in the air. That's why we place particular value on gold.


It turns out then, that the reason gold is precious is precisely that it is so chemically uninteresting.


Gold's relative inertness means you can create an elaborate golden jaguar and be confident that 1,000 years later it can be found in a museum display case in central London, still in pristine condition.

Title: Why is gold considered so valuable. It is not the rarest metal, it is not the most useful, so why the worship of this yellow metal. | Notes and Queries (www.theguardian.com)
Content: Mainly ancient tradition. It is fairly easy to process and as far as ancient people were concerned it was indestructible it does not tarnish like silver or copper. It does not dissolve in normal acids and solvents. It is pretty and if you alloy it with other metals it can have a variety of colours. Ancient people used it as a form of exchange as people desired it and if you put it in a damp cupboard it would still be unchanged when you came to use it. Gold has retained its value because it is still rare and people like to adorn them selves with it.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why does Milk Form a Skin When It is Heated? (with pictures) (www.delightedcooking.com)
Content: Milk forms a skin on top when heated because of a chemical reaction that affects how protein and fat molecules interact with each other. When milk is heated rapidly, some of the water in it evaporates from the surface. This exposes proteins and fat molecules, which bind and dry out as warming continues. Skin most commonly forms when milk is heated over a stove top, as stoves are generally capable of reaching very high temperatures quite quickly, though it can happen in the microwave as well. The film is not harmful, but is distasteful to many and can be prevented with constant stirring and a close eye on temperature.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why does Milk Form a Skin When It is Heated? (with pictures) (www.delightedcooking.com)
Content: It is often surprising to see a film or skin on nonfat or “skim” milk, since it would seem that, without fat, the proteins would have nothing to bind to. In truth, it is rare to encounter milk that is truly fat free. Most of the skim milk that is sold commercially has very low fat content, but is rarely ever truly fat-free. Even trace amounts of fat on the surface can contribute to skin formation.


A similar phenomenon happens with soy milk, which is generally marketed as fat free. Natural fats still occur in trace amounts, and can be drawn to the surface when exposed to very high temperatures. Soy film can be discarded, but is also considered a delicacy in many Asian cultures. When removed and dried, it is referred to as yuba, or soybean curd, which is used in a variety of recipes.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Ngozi ya maziwa (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Ngozi ya maziwa au lactoderm inahusu filamu nata ya protini ambayo hutengeneza juu ya maziwa ya maziwa na vyakula vyenye maziwa ya maziwa (kama chokoleti ya moto na supu kadhaa). Filamu ya maziwa inaweza kuzalishwa kwa njia ya kuchemsha kawaida na kwa kusafisha kioevu, na kwa hivyo mara nyingi inaweza kuzingatiwa wakati wa kupokanzwa maziwa kwa matumizi ya vinywaji kama vile kunywa chokoleti. Inasababishwa na kuharibika kwa protini kama vile beta-lactoglobulin (protini ya Whey). Unene wa ngozi hutofautiana kulingana na sababu kadhaa, pamoja na joto la maziwa, sura ya chombo, na kiasi cha maziwa kwenye chombo.

Document ID: 2
Title: Why does Milk Form a Skin When It is Heated? (with pictures) (www.delightedcooking.com)
Content: It is often surprising to see a film or skin on nonfat or “skim” milk, since it would seem that, without fat, the proteins would have nothing to bind to. In truth, it is rare to encounter milk that is truly fat free. Most of the skim milk that is sold commercially has very low fat content, but is rarely ever truly fat-free. Even trace amounts of fat on the surface can contribute to skin formation.


A similar phenomenon happens with soy milk, which is generally marketed as fat free. Natural fats still occur in trace amounts, and can be drawn to the surface when exposed to very high temperatures. Soy film can be discarded, but is also considered a delicacy in many Asian cultures. When removed and dried, it is referred to as yuba, or soybean curd, which is used in a variety of recipes.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Milk skin (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Milk skin or lactoderm refers to a sticky film of protein that forms on top of dairy milk and foods containing dairy milk (such as hot chocolate and some soups). Milk film can be produced both through conventional boiling and by microwaving the liquid, and as such can often be observed when heating milk for use in drinks such as drinking chocolate. It is caused by the denaturation of proteins such as beta-lactoglobulin (whey protein). The thickness of the skin varies dependent on a number of factors, including the temperature of the milk, the shape of the container, and the amount of milk in the container.


When milk is boiled, soluble milk proteins are denatured and then coagulate with milk's fat and form a sticky film across the top of the liquid, which then dries by evaporation. The layer does not need to be discarded and can be consumed, as protein's nutritional value is unaffected by the denaturation process. Milk film is often considered to be desirable and is used in several recipes for various foods.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why does Milk Form a Skin When It is Heated? (with pictures) (www.delightedcooking.com)
Content: Milk forms a skin on top when heated because of a chemical reaction that affects how protein and fat molecules interact with each other. When milk is heated rapidly, some of the water in it evaporates from the surface. This exposes proteins and fat molecules, which bind and dry out as warming continues. Skin most commonly forms when milk is heated over a stove top, as stoves are generally capable of reaching very high temperatures quite quickly, though it can happen in the microwave as well. The film is not harmful, but is distasteful to many and can be prevented with constant stirring and a close eye on temperature.
