Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Here's The Frustrating Reason Only One Side of Your Nose Gets Blocked at a Time (www.sciencealert.com)
Content: During the day, the sides switch and the other nostril goes into 'work mode', but why?


This process is automated by the aptly named autonomic nervous system, which is the same system that controls many things your body does all by itself such as digestion and heart rate.


For your nose, this system controls your 'nasal cycle', so that each nostril operates effectively.


The nasal cycle happens, according to the US National Library of Medicine, several times during the day, and is only brought to your attention if your nose is clogged up more than usual.


In order to open one side of your nose and close the other, your body inflates tissue with blood in the same way that a man gets an erection, except, you know, in your nose.


"Increased blood flow causes congestion in one nostril for about 3 to 6 hours before switching to the other side. There is also increased congestion when one is lying down, which can be especially noticeable when the head is turned to one side," Jennifer Shu reports for CNN.

Content: Instead regulators should sharpen tools that are already available in Europe. They could lower the cap on non-audit fees charged to an audit client from today’s generous level of 70% of the audit fee. Under rules introduced in 2016, British companies with the same auditor for ten years must re-tender; they are forced to rotate after 20. Such rules look draconian to American eyes, where the average auditor tenure for the first 21 companies in the Dow Jones Industrial Average to have made disclosures this year is a cosy 66 years. Content: Katikati ya miaka ya 1800, mtaalam wa fizikia wa Scottish James Clerk Maxwell alianzisha kuwa mwanga ni aina ya nishati ya umeme ambayo husafiri katika mawimbi. Swali la jinsi linaweza kufanya hivyo kwa kukosekana kwa kati inaelezewa na asili ya vibrations ya umeme. Wakati chembe inayoshtakiwa inatetemeka, hutoa vibration ya umeme ambayo huchochea moja kwa moja sumaku - mara nyingi wanafizikia wanaona vibrations hizi zinazotokea katika ndege za kawaida. Oscillations ya paired hueneza nje kutoka kwa chanzo; Hakuna kati, isipokuwa kwa uwanja wa umeme ambao unaingia kwenye ulimwengu, inahitajika kuziendesha.

Document ID: 2
Title: UCSB Science Line (scienceline.ucsb.edu)
Content: When I say "waves of electric and magnetic fields," I'm talking about something similar to the waves in the rope. Similar to wiggling the end of the rope, we can change the electric or magnetic field at one point, and that disturbance travels away from us. (One way to change the magnetic field at a point is to hold a magnet there, then wiggle it back and forth.) Unlike the wave in the rope, these waves actually travel away from us in all directions. It turns out that in a vacuum, for example in outer space, these waves travel at exactly the speed of light! It doesn't matter how rapidly the fields wiggle back and forth, they will always travel at the same speed. (In air, the waves go ever so slightly slower than in vacuum, and in glass, they can go only about two-thirds as fast as they would in vacuum, but this is not important right now. From now on, when I talk about the speed of light, I mean the speed of light in a vacuum, and I'm talking about waves traveling in a vacuum.) The conclusion that physicists have drawn from this result is that light consists of waves of electric and magnetic fields. This is a fascinating result: that we learn something about light by studying magnets and electrical currents.

Title: Q & A: Does light travel forever? | Department of Physics (van.physics.illinois.edu)
Content: In contrast, light waves can travel through a vacuum, and do not require a medium. In empty space, the wave does not dissipate (grow smaller) no matter how far it travels, because the wave is not interacting with anything else. This is why light from distant stars can travel through space for billions of light-years and still reach us on earth. However, light can also travel within some materials, like glass and water. In this case, some light is absorbed and lost as heat, just like sound. So, underwater, or in our atmosphere, light will only travel some finite range (which is different depending on the properties of the material it travels through).

---
Document ID: 2
Title: What exactly is the heat death of the universe and where can I find out more? (www.physlink.com)
Content: The 'heat-death' of the universe is when the universe has reached a state of maximum entropy. This happens when all available energy (such as from a hot source) has moved to places of less energy (such as a colder source). Once this has happened, no more work can be extracted from the universe.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: What exactly is the heat death of the universe and where can I find out more? (www.physlink.com)
Content: Since heat ceases to flow, no more work can be acquired from heat transfer. This same kind of equilibrium state will also happen with all other forms of energy (mechanical, electrical, etc.). Since no more work can be extracted from the universe at that point, it is effectively dead, especially for the purposes of humankind.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: What is Heat Death? | Space Facts – Astronomy, the Solar System & Outer Space | All About Space Magazine (www.spaceanswers.com)
Content: Entropy, which is the number of ways in which a system can be arranged should never decrease, evolving to a state of maximum disorder (or thermodynamic equilibrium). When this happens, all energy will be evenly distributed throughout the cosmos, leaving no room for any reusable energy or heat to burst into existence.

Title: What Will Happen to Earth When the Sun Dies? (www.livescience.com)
Content: On the bright side, the sun's luminosity is increasing by a factor of about 10 percent every billion years. The habitable zone, where liquid water can exist on a planet's surface, right now is between about 0.95 and 1.37 times the radius of the Earth's orbit (otherwise known as astronomical units, or AU). That zone will continue to move outward. By the time the sun gets ready to become a red giant, Mars will have been inside the zone for quite some time.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Heat death of the universe (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The heat death of the universe (also known as the Big Chill or Big Freeze)[1] is a theory on the ultimate fate of the universe, which suggests the universe would evolve to a state of no thermodynamic free energy and would therefore be unable to sustain processes that increase entropy. Heat death does not imply any particular absolute temperature; it only requires that temperature differences or other processes may no longer be exploited to perform work. In the language of physics, this is when the universe reaches thermodynamic equilibrium

claim: Simu ya rununu huanza kazi pale unapoongea, kipaza sauti wake hubadilisha sauti yako ya masafa mbalimbali kuwa ishara dhaifu za umeme
question_src: Je! Simu zinafanyaje kazi?
all_claims: Simu ya rununu huanza kazi pale unapoongea, kipaza sauti wake hubadilisha sauti yako ya masafa mbalimbali kuwa ishara dhaifu za umeme [1].
Microchip ndani ya simu hubadili ishara hizi kuwa kamba za nambari dijitali (bits) [1].
Bits huwekwa juu ya wimbi la redio na kutumwa kutoka antenna ya simu, likisafiri kwa kasi ya mwanga hadi kufika mnara wa seli wa karibu, ujulikanao pia kama kituo cha msingi [1].
Mnara huo hupokea, kuchakata na kupeleka mawimbi hayo kupitia mtandao unaounganisha minara mingine mpaka kufikia mnara uliokaribu na mpokeaji wa simu [2].
Sehemu ya safari inaweza kupita kwenye nyaya za nyuzi-macho, satelaiti au minara ya microwave kutegemea umbali na upatikanaji wa miundombinu [3].
Mnara wa mwisho hurusha wimbi la redio kwa simu ya marudio ambayo hufanya mchakato ule ule kwa kurudisha nambari kuwa ishara za umeme na hatimaye sauti tunayoweza kusikia [4].
claims_retained: Simu ya rununu huanza kazi pale unapoongea, kipaza sauti wake hubadilisha sauti yako ya masafa mbalimbali kuwa ishara dhaifu za umeme [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Simu za rununu hufanyaje kazi? (www.explainthatstuff.com)
Content: Unapoongea ndani ya simu ya rununu, kipaza sauti kidogo kwenye kifaa cha mkono hubadilisha sauti za juu na chini za sauti yako kuwa muundo unaofanana na wa chini wa ishara za umeme. Microchip ndani ya simu hubadilisha ishara hizi kuwa kamba za nambari. Nambari hizo zimejaa ndani ya wimbi la redio na hutolewa kutoka kwa antenna ya simu (katika nchi zingine, antenna inaitwa angani). Radio wimbi hukimbilia angani kwa kasi ya taa hadi ifikie kingo ya simu ya karibu.

Title: How do cellphones work? (www.explainthatstuff.com)
Content: Calls made from a cellphone to another cellphone on the same network travel to their destination by being routed to the base station nearest to the destination phone, and finally to that phone itself.
---

Title: How Telephones Work (electronics.howstuffworks.com)
Content: Your voice normally travels over a fiber-optic line to the office of the receiving party, but it may also be transmitted by satellite or by microwave towers.

prompt:

Title: How do cellphones work? (www.explainthatstuff.com)
Content: When you speak into a cellphone, a tiny microphone in the handset converts the up-and-down sounds of your voice into a corresponding up-and-down pattern of electrical signals. A microchip inside the phone turns these signals into strings of numbers. The numbers are packed up into a radio wave and beamed out from the phone's antenna (in some countries, the antenna is called an aerial). The radio wave races through the air at the speed of light until it reaches the nearest cellphone mast.

Sasa, kwa kutumia neno "Latino," na mtaji, jamii hii ya ukiritimba imekuzwa kuwajumuisha watu wa asili isiyo ya Uhispania ikiwa wanataka kugawanywa. Kimsingi, mtu yeyote ambaye anaweza kuhalalisha madai hayo, sasa anaweza kudai kuwa "Latino" kwa madhumuni ya ukiritimba, na wengi hufanya hivyo ili kuvuna aina mbali mbali za faida za serikali zilizohifadhiwa kwa mkusanyiko fulani, au "vikundi vya kitambulisho."


Kwa kuongezea, neno Latino sasa linatumika kuainisha watu hao ambao hutoka Amerika ya Kusini, au kutoka kwa watu kutoka Amerika ya Kusini, ambapo lugha inayozungumzwa ni ya Kihispania, lakini ambao hawafurahii na nomino kama "Rico," ambayo ni ya Uhispania sana, nchi ambayo wengi wa wale walioainishwa zamani kama "Wahispanics" hawataki kuhusishwa. Hii ndio kesi, kwa mfano, ya wakaazi wengine wa asili ya Mexico huko Merika, ambao hawataki kuitwa "Hispanics," lakini "Latinos." Sababu moja iliyotolewa ni kuwa na kitambulisho chao cha pamoja na cha vitambulisho vingine vya pamoja vinavyohusishwa na Uhispania na urithi wake. Sababu nyingine inayowezekana ni hamu ya kuhusishwa na tamaduni ya Mexico ("Aztec"), ambayo ilishindwa na Wahispania, na ambayo mara kwa mara na kwa sababu inasifiwa kwa mafanikio na fadhila zake nyingi. question_src: Ikiwa mengi ya kile tunacho ladha imedhamiriwa na harufu, kwa nini mambo kadhaa ambayo yana harufu nzuri (cologne, manukato, sabuni, nk) ladha mbaya? .
all_claims: Ingawa ladha ya mwisho huundwa na ubongo kwa kuchanganya ishara kutoka kwa harufu na ladha, michanganyiko hii hukutana nyuma ya koo baada ya kumeza chakula, si wakati wa kunusa tu [4].
Unapopuliza manukato au cologne, molekuli zake tete hupenya kiraka kidogo cha neuroni za hisia kwenye paa la pua na kutoa harufu nzuri bila kugusa ulimi au kuamsha vipokezi vya ladha [3].

Ikiwa kioevu hicho kingeingia mdomoni, seli za ladha zilizo kwenye buds tano maalum (tamu, chumvi, chachu, uchungu, umami) huchambua kemikali na mara nyingi kugundua uchungu au kuwasha badala ya utamu [4].

Hili hutokea kwa sababu manukato yanategemea alkoholi kali na vimumunyisho vingine vya kemikali vinavyohifadhi bidhaa, ambavyo ni sumu na husababisha hisia kali za uchungu au kuchoma, hata kwa kiasi kidogo kuliko mililita 30 [1].

Viungo hivyo vimebuniwa kuenea hewani ili kunukia vizuri, si kuendana na vipokezi vya ladha; hivyo, vinapokosekana harufu inayoingia njia ya nyuma ya pua wakati wa kumeza, na kuachwa na ishara za kuona uchungu pekee, ladha yake hubaki mbaya licha ya harufu kuvutia [2].

Document ID: 2
Title: Taste and Smell (www.brainfacts.org)
Content: Taste and smell are separate senses with their own receptor organs, yet they are intimately entwined. Tastants, chemicals in foods, are detected by taste buds, which consist of special sensory cells. When stimulated, these cells send signals to specific areas of the brain, which make us conscious of the perception of taste. Similarly, specialized cells in the nose pick up odorants, airborne odor molecules. Odorants stimulate receptor proteins found on hairlike cilia at the tips of the sensory cells, a process that initiates a neural response. Ultimately, messages about taste and smell converge, allowing us to detect the flavors of food.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Taste and Smell (www.brainfacts.org)
Content: Airborne odor molecules, called odorants, are detected by specialized sensory neurons located in a small patch of mucus membrane lining the roof of the nose. Axons of these sensory cells pass through perforations in the overlying bone and enter two elongated olfactory bulbs lying against the underside of the frontal lobe of the brain.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Taste and Smell | Boundless Biology (courses.lumenlearning.com)
Content: The senses of smell and taste combine at the back of the throat. When you taste something before you smell it, the smell lingers internally up to the nose causing you to smell it. Both smell and taste use chemoreceptors, which essentially means they are both sensing the chemical environment. This chemoreception in regards to taste, occurs via the presence of specialized taste receptors within the mouth that are referred to as taste cells and are bundled together to form taste buds. These taste buds, located in papillae which are found across the tongue, are specific for the five modalities: salt, sweet, sour, bitter and umami. These receptors are activated when their specific stimulus (i.e. sweet or salt molecules) is present and signals to the brain.

claim: Wakati wa sumaku (magnetic moment) ni kipimo cha nguvu na mwelekeo wa sumaku wa mwili au kitanzi cha sasa ambacho huonyesha jinsi kitu hicho kitakavyooanisha na au kutengeneza uwanja wa sumaku, na ni wingi wa vekta
question_src: ni nini 'wakati wa sumaku'
all_claims: Wakati wa sumaku (magnetic moment) ni kipimo cha nguvu na mwelekeo wa sumaku wa mwili au kitanzi cha sasa ambacho huonyesha jinsi kitu hicho kitakavyooanisha na au kutengeneza uwanja wa sumaku, na ni wingi wa vekta [1].
Kwa koili ya umeme, mwelekeo wake hupatana na mhimili wa kitanzi kulingana na sheria ya mkono wa kulia [3].
Katika ngazi ya atomu, elektroni nyingi zenye misokoto ya juu na chini hufuta michango yao, lakini elektroni chache zisizofutwa huacha chembe ikiwa na wakati wa sumaku unaoweza kupimika [4].

claim: Deni la kitaifa la Marekani linaendelea kupanda kwa sababu msingi kwamba serikali ya shirikisho hutumia zaidi kuliko inavyokusanya katika mapato ya kodi mwaka baada ya mwaka, hivyo kuunda nakisi ambazo huongezwa moja kwa moja kwenye deni lililopo ; hali hii imeendelea hata wakati uchumi unaboreka na hakuna vita kubwa, kwa kuwa matumizi yasiyoweza kuepukika kama malipo ya Social Security, Medicare na riba kwenye deni yamekuwa yakikua haraka zaidi kuliko mapato ya kodi.
question_src: Inakuaje ingawa uchumi wa Amerika unafanya vizuri kama ilivyokuwa tangu 2007 na hatuko vitani deni yetu ya kitaifa inaendelea kuongezeka?
all_claims: Deni la kitaifa la Marekani linaendelea kupanda kwa sababu msingi kwamba serikali ya shirikisho hutumia zaidi kuliko inavyokusanya katika mapato ya kodi mwaka baada ya mwaka, hivyo kuunda nakisi ambazo huongezwa moja kwa moja kwenye deni lililopo [1]; hali hii imeendelea hata wakati uchumi unaboreka na hakuna vita kubwa, kwa kuwa matumizi yasiyoweza kuepukika kama malipo ya Social Security, Medicare na riba kwenye deni yamekuwa yakikua haraka zaidi kuliko mapato ya kodi.
Aidha, kipindi cha viwango vya chini vya riba kimeifanya serikali kuona gharama ya kukopa kuwa ndogo, hivyo kuahirisha maamuzi magumu ya kupunguza matumizi au kuongeza mapato.
Ingawa ukuaji wa Pato la Taifa (GDP) huongeza uwezo wa serikali kulipia madeni yake, athari ya deni inategemea uwiano wa deni kwa GDP; endapo deni linakua kasi kuliko uchumi, mzigo hubaki mkubwa [2].

Vilevile, misukumo ya kisiasa ya kupunguza kodi bila kupunguza matumizi, pamoja na programu za kichocheo cha uchumi (stimulus) katika nyakati za misukosuko, huchangia kuendeleza nakisi hata katika miaka ya ukuaji.
Kwa mkusanyiko wa sababu hizi—nakisi sugu, upanuzi wa matumizi ya kijamii na mazingira rafiki ya ukopaji—deni la taifa linaongezeka licha ya uchumi kufanya vizuri na kutokuwepo kwa vita vikubwa.

Ingawa ukuaji wa Pato la Taifa (GDP) huongeza uwezo wa serikali kulipia madeni yake, athari ya deni inategemea uwiano wa deni kwa GDP; endapo deni linakua kasi kuliko uchumi, mzigo hubaki mkubwa [2].

Content: Kiwango cha deni la kitaifa la Merika ni kipimo cha ni kiasi gani serikali ya shirikisho inadaiwa wadai wake. Hasa, deni la kitaifa ni neno linalomaanisha kiwango cha deni la shirikisho lililoshikiliwa na umma, kinyume na deni lililoshikiliwa na serikali yenyewe. Kwa kuwa serikali ya Merika karibu kila wakati hutumia zaidi kuliko inavyochukua, deni la kitaifa linaendelea kuongezeka
---
Document ID: 2
Title: National Debt (www.investopedia.com)
Content: While the debt can be measured in trillions of dollars, it is usually measured as a percentage of gross domestic product (GDP), the debt-to-GDP ratio. That's because as a country's economy grows, the amount of revenue a government can use to pay its debts grows as well.

In addition, a larger economy generally means the country's capital markets will grow and the government can tap them to issue more debt. This means that a country's ability to pay off debt, and the effect that debt might have on the country's economy, is dependent on how large the debt is as a proportion of the overall economy, not the dollar amount
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: National Debt (www.investopedia.com)
Content: The national debt level of the United States is a measurement of how much the federal government owes its creditors. Specifically, the national debt is a term referring to the level of federal debt held by the public, as opposed to the debt held by the government itself. Since the U.S. government almost always spends more than it takes in, the national debt continues to rise
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Deni la kitaifa (www.investopedia.com)
Content: Wakati deni linaweza kupimwa kwa trilioni za dola, kawaida hupimwa kama asilimia ya jumla ya bidhaa za ndani (GDP), uwiano wa deni hadi GDP. Hiyo ni kwa sababu uchumi wa nchi unakua, kiasi cha mapato ambayo serikali inaweza kutumia kulipa deni lake inakua pia.

Kwa kuongezea, uchumi mkubwa kwa ujumla unamaanisha kuwa masoko ya mji mkuu wa nchi yatakua na serikali inaweza kuwachukua ili kutoa deni zaidi. Title: Will my skin soak up the calories in skin cream? (www.thenakedscientists.com)

Title: How to Make Soap from Scratch (www.healthline.com)
Content: Soap, by definition, is fat or oil mixed with an alkali. The oil is from an animal or plant, while the alkali is a chemical called lye. In bar soapmaking, the lye is sodium hydroxide. Liquid soap requires potassium hydroxide.


When oil and lye are combined and heated, the result is soap. This chemical reaction is called saponification. Without lye, saponification isn’t possible, so lye is necessary to create soap.

question_src: Je! Unafanya nini ikiwa utavutwa?
all_claims: Ukiona taa za polisi, punguza mwendo na vuta kando sehemu salama, kisha uzime injini [1].
Shusha dirisha kikamilifu, zima sigara au utupe gamu, weka mikono juu ya gurudumu na, ikiwa ni usiku, washa taa ya ndani ili uonekane vyema [1].
Kumbuka kuwa polisi hulichukulia kila zuio la trafiki kama uwezekano wa hatari, hivyo utulivu na mwonekano wa wazi wa mikono hupunguza wasiwasi wao [5].
Shirikiana na maagizo yote halali ya afisa [6].
Habari pekee unayopaswa kutoa ni leseni, usajili na kadi ya bima [2].
Ikiwa afisa anakuelekeza utoke ndani ya gari, huna haki ya kukataa, kwa hiyo fuata amri hiyo bila ubishi [3].
Afisa akiwa na sababu inayowezekana anaweza kulisaka gari lako bila idhini yako, na kujaribu kuzuia hakutazuia utafutaji [4].
Baada ya kuwasilisha nyaraka, ongea kidogo tu—maneno mafupi kama “naelewa” au “sawa” yanatosha [7].
Unaendelea kuwa na haki ya kukaa kimya kuhusu maswali ya ziada, hivyo unaweza kuikataa kwa heshima [2].

Response: Unaendelea kuwa na haki ya kukaa kimya kuhusu maswali ya ziada, hivyo unaweza kuikataa kwa heshima [

claim: Deni la Marekani hugawanyika kati ya “deni la umma” na “deni la ndani” ambalo idara za serikali zinadaiwa zenyewe kwa zenyewe
question_src: Kwa kuwa karibu trilioni 10 za deni la dola trilioni 14 huko Amerika linamilikiwa ndani. ELI5 jinsi tunavyodaiwa wenyewe dola trilioni 10.
all_claims: Deni la Marekani hugawanyika kati ya “deni la umma” na “deni la ndani” ambalo idara za serikali zinadaiwa zenyewe kwa zenyewe [5].

Deni hili la ndani hutokana na fedha za Usalama wa Jamii na mifuko ya pensheni: kodi za wafanyakazi huingia Hazina, na mifuko yao hupokea hati za Hazina zinazoahidi kulipwa baadaye, hivyo serikali inajiandikia ahadi kwa niaba ya wastaafu hao [1].
Kwa mfano, raia analipa FICA leo, pesa inaingia matumizi ya serikali, naye hupata karatasi inayoahidi malipo yake ya uzeeni—ndiyo kusema, tunadai sisi wenyewe [1].

Zaidi ya hapo, benki, kampuni za bima, Hifadhi ya Shirikisho, serikali za majimbo na wananchi wenyewe hushikilia takriban 40 % ya deni lote kupitia dhamana walizonunua kama uwekezaji au akiba salama [2].

Kwa sababu serikali za nje zinashikilia karibu theluthi moja tu ya deni la umma, sehemu kubwa iliyobaki—takriban dola trilioni 10 katika mfano wa trilioni 14—inamilikiwa na taasisi na watu wa Marekani wenyewe, ni kama kuhamisha pesa mfukoni mwa kulia kwenda wa kushoto [3].

Siku deni hilo likilipwa, serikali hutumia mapato mapya ya kodi au hukopa tena, hivyo “deni kwa sisi wenyewe” hubaki kuwa mpango wa ndani wa kugawanya na kusogeza akiba ya wananchi, si bili inayoenda ng’ambo [5].
claims_retained: Deni la Marekani hugawanyika kati ya “deni la umma” na “deni la ndani” ambalo idara za serikali zinadaiwa zenyewe kwa zenyewe [5].

Title: The Real Owner of the US Debt Will Surprise You (www.thebalance.com)
Content: Many people believe that much of U.S. debt is owed to foreign countries like China and Japan. The truth is, most of it is owed to Social Security and pension funds. This means U.S. citizens, through their retirement money, own most of the national debt.

U.S. national debt is the sum of these two federal debt categories:

 * Public debt, held by other countries, the Federal Reserve, mutual funds, and other entities and individuals * Intragovernmental holdings, held by Social Security, Military Retirement Fund, Medicare, and other retirement funds

Title: How Did Ancient Civilizations Get Buried? (parade.com)
Content: With certain notable exceptions, such as Pompeii, only abandoned fragments of past civilizations were buried by natural forces. People migrated and disseminated, leaving unwanted structures behind. Deserted buildings degraded from a lack of maintenance; plants overtook the space, died and decayed, building layers of soil over the centuries. Dust and debris from neighboring areas blew over the land, rains caused mudslides, storms toppled walls, earthquakes reshaped the local topography over time, and more.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How Did Ancient Civilizations Get Buried? (parade.com)
Content: With certain notable exceptions, such as Pompeii, only abandoned fragments of past civilizations were buried by natural forces. People migrated and disseminated, leaving unwanted structures behind. Deserted buildings degraded from a lack of maintenance; plants overtook the space, died and decayed, building layers of soil over the centuries. Dust and debris from neighboring areas blew over the land, rains caused mudslides, storms toppled walls, earthquakes reshaped the local topography over time, and more.
---

question_src: Ni nini husababisha sisi kufikiria kuhisi mchwa/wadudu wakitambaa juu yetu baada ya kuona moja?

Kilio cha kuona mdudu hufanya kazi kama “trigger” ya nje: ubongo unapoona ishara ya hatari kidogo, huongeza umakini kwa ngozi na huchakata kwa kasi msisimko mdogo (kama mguso wa nywele au upepo hafifu), kisha huutafsiri kimakosa kuwa kutambaa kwa wadudu [1].

Title: Uundaji: Wasiwasi, wanakuwa wamemaliza kuzaa, matibabu, sababu, usiku (www.healthline.com)
Content: Uundaji ni hisia za wadudu kutambaa au chini ya ngozi yako. Jina linatoka kwa neno la Kilatini "formica," ambayo inamaanisha ant.


Uundaji unajulikana kama aina ya paresthesia. Paresthesia hufanyika wakati unahisi hisia kwenye ngozi yako ambayo haina sababu ya mwili. Paresthesia inaweza kuchukua aina nyingi. Hizi zinaweza kujumuisha kuchoma, kuchoma, au kufa. Kwa uundaji, unaweza pia kuelezea hisia za "kutambaa" kama kuhisi kama "pini na sindano." Uundaji pia huitwa utapeli wa tactile. Hii inamaanisha kuwa unahisi hisia ambazo hazina sababu ya mwili.


Uundaji unaweza kuwa ishara ya hali kadhaa. Masharti haya ni pamoja na ugonjwa wa Fibromyalgia na Parkinson. Kujiondoa kutoka kwa pombe au matumizi ya dawa za kulevya pia kunaweza kusababisha uundaji.

Title: Formication (www.psychologytoday.com)
Content: Formication is a specific form of the general set of abnormal skin sensations known as paresthesias and tactile hallucinations. It is associated with several disorders: a physical or psychological side effect of substance abuse, diabetic neuropathy, diseases of the spinal cord and peripheral nerves, and extreme alcohol withdrawal with delirium tremens.


This illusion or hallucination that ants or other insects are creeping on or under the skin is a common side effect of large-scale use of cocaine, amphetamines ("amphetamites"), or crystal meth (also known by street names such as "ice," "glass," "chalk," "crank," "meth mites," or "coke bugs.")

Title: Formication: Anxiety, Menopause, Treatment, Causes, at Night (www.healthline.com)
Content: Formication is the feeling of insects crawling across or underneath your skin. The name comes from the Latin word “formica,”which means ant.


Formication is known as a type of paresthesia. Paresthesia happen when you feel sensations on your skin that don’t have a physical cause. Paresthesia can take many forms. These can include burning, tingling, or numbness. With formication, you might also describe the “crawling” sensation as feeling like “pins and needles.” Formication is also called a tactile hallucination. This means that you’re feeling a sensation that has no physical cause.


Formication can be a symptom of several conditions. These conditions include fibromyalgia and Parkinson’s disease. Withdrawal from alcohol or drug use can also trigger formication.

claim: Kifungo cha Sigma huundwa kwa kuingiliana kwa moja kwa moja (head-to-head) au axial kati ya orbitals za atomi mbili, hivyo msongamano wa elektroni uko kando ya mhimili unaounganisha viini vya atomi ; kwa kulinganisha, kifungo cha Pi hutokana na kuingiliana kwa sambamba (side-by-side) ambapo elektroni zinasambaa juu na chini ya mhimili huo
question_src: Kuna tofauti gani kati ya vifungo vya Sigma na vifungo vya PI?
all_claims: Kifungo cha Sigma huundwa kwa kuingiliana kwa moja kwa moja (head-to-head) au axial kati ya orbitals za atomi mbili, hivyo msongamano wa elektroni uko kando ya mhimili unaounganisha viini vya atomi [1]; kwa kulinganisha, kifungo cha Pi hutokana na kuingiliana kwa sambamba (side-by-side) ambapo elektroni zinasambaa juu na chini ya mhimili huo [1].
Kiutendaji, vifungo vya Sigma ni thabiti zaidi na vina nguvu kubwa kuliko vile vya Pi [2].
Vifungo vya Sigma vinaweza kuundwa na karibu aina zote za orbitals (mfano s, p), ilhali vifungo vya Pi vinaundwa hasa kati ya orbitals za p au d [2].
Zaidi ya hayo, kuwepo kwa kifungo cha Sigma huruhusu atomi kuzunguka kwa uhuru kuzunguka mhimili wa kiungo, lakini kifungo cha Pi huzuia mzunguko huo na hivyo kupunguza urahisi wa kuzunguka [2].

claim: Mitaji ya ubia hufanya kazi kwa kukusanya fedha kutoka kwa wawekezaji wenye uwezo, benki za uwekezaji na taasisi zingine, kisha kuziwekeza kama usawa katika kampuni changa zenye uwezo mkubwa wa kukua, badala ya kupokea riba ya mkopo
question_src: Je! Mitaji ya ubia inafanyaje kazi?
all_claims: Mitaji ya ubia hufanya kazi kwa kukusanya fedha kutoka kwa wawekezaji wenye uwezo, benki za uwekezaji na taasisi zingine, kisha kuziwekeza kama usawa katika kampuni changa zenye uwezo mkubwa wa kukua, badala ya kupokea riba ya mkopo [1].
Kampuni zinazolengwa mara nyingi ni ndogo au zipo tu kama mpango, hivyo zinahitaji mtaji ili kutengeneza bidhaa, kupanua soko au kuongeza wafanyakazi [2].

Wawekezaji wa VC hupata hisa na hutegemea ongezeko la thamani ya kampuni ili kupata faida kubwa baadaye kupitia mauzo ya hisa, IPO au upatikanaji mwingine, jambo linalowafanya wakubali hatari kubwa, ukosefu wa ukwasi na upeo wa muda mrefu wa uwekezaji [3].
Kando na pesa, VC wanaweza kutoa utaalam wa kiufundi au usimamizi, na mara nyingi wanachukua viti vya bodi ili kushiriki katika maamuzi muhimu ya kimkakati na kuhakikisha ukuaji unaotarajiwa [1].

Mchakato kawaida unahusisha uchunguzi wa kina wa mpango wa biashara, majadiliano ya thamani na makubaliano ya usawa, utoaji wa fedha kwa awamu kulingana na hatua za utendaji, ufuatiliaji wa karibu wa maendeleo na hatimaye hatua ya kutoka (exit) ili kuvuna faida za mtaji [3].

Content: The stock market is a constellation of exchanges where securities like stocks and bonds are bought and sold. In the United States, “the stock market” and “Wall Street” can refer to the entire world of securities trading—including stock exchanges where the shares of public companies are listed for sale and markets where other securities are traded.


The stock market helps companies raise money to fund operations by selling shares of stock, and it creates and sustains wealth for individual investors.

Title: A Breakdown on How the Stock Market Works (www.investopedia.com)
Content: * Stocks, or shares of a company, represent ownership equity in the firm, which give shareholders voting rights as well as a residual claim on corporate earnings in the form of capital gains and dividends.
* Stock markets are where individual and institutional investors come together to buy and sell shares in a public venue. Nowadays these exchanges exist as electronic marketplaces.
* Share prices are set by supply and demand in the market as buyers and sellers place orders. Order flow and bid-ask spreads are often maintained by specialists or market makers to ensure an orderly and fair market.

Title: What Is the Stock Market and How Does It Work? - NerdWallet (www.nerdwallet.com)
Content: The stock market works through a network of exchanges — you may have heard of the New York Stock Exchange or the Nasdaq. Investors can then buy and sell these stocks among themselves, and the exchange tracks the supply and demand of each listed stock.

question_src: Je! Nafasi katika mpira wa kikapu zilipataje majina yao?
all_claims: Majina ya nafasi za mpira wa kikapu yalitokana moja kwa moja na majukumu ya kimkakati ambayo wachezaji walitekeleza uwanjani: mwanzoni kulikuwepo tu makundi matatu—walinzi (guards) waliolinda na kusukuma mpira mbele, mbele (forwards) waliotangulia mashambulizi, na kituo (center) aliyesimama katikati kwa ulinzi na kurudisha mipira—na timu ya kawaida ilikuwa na walinzi wawili, mbele mbili na kituo kimoja [1].

Kadiri mchezo ulivyoendelea na majukumu maalumu yakajitokeza, kila aina ya mlinzi na mbele iligawanywa zaidi; hivyo walinzi wakapokea majina ya “walinzi wa uhakika” (point guards) na “walinzi wa risasi” (shooting guards), ilhali mbele zikawa “ndogo mbele” (small forwards) na “nguvu mbele” (power forwards), huku kituo kikiendelea kuitwa “center” [1].

Title: Sharp increase in central Oklahoma seismicity since 2008 induced by massive wastewater injection (www.sciencemag.org)
Content: The number of earthquakes is increasing in regions with active unconventional oil and gas wells, where water pumped at high pressure breaks open rock containing natural gas, leaving behind wastewater in need of disposing. prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why Is Oil And Gas Activity Causing Earthquakes? And Can We Reduce The Risk? (www.iflscience.com)
Content: Studies including two reports issued in April, indicate that human activities, including activities related to oil and gas extraction, are beginning to play a significant role in triggering earthquakes in the central US.


Extracting oil and gas from shale rock involves cracking, or fracturing, a layer of underground rock with a high-pressure mix of water, sand, and chemicals. As the oil and gas are released, those injection fluids and briny water also come up. That wastewater is later disposed of in what are called injection wells, or sometimes disposal wells.


It is important to note that it is not the fracking process itself that usually causes these earthquakes; it is the rapid injection of fluid during wastewater disposal that sometimes pumps hundreds of millions of gallons of brine deep into the earth each year.

Title: Innocent Until Proven Guilty, But Only If You Can Pay – Reason.com (reason.com)

Document ID: 3
Title: Innocent Until Proven Guilty, But Only If You Can Pay – Reason.com (reason.com)
Content: When defendants are stuck in jail while awaiting trial, data indicate they're more likely to plead guilty or be found guilty of crimes. They're also likely to be given longer prison sentences. This is partly a result of their not being in a position to bargain with prosecutors, because they're stuck behind bars and desperate to move things along.

For low-level crimes, all that time spent in pretrial detention can be equivalent to the length of the sentence they'll get if they're found guilty anyway. A poor defendant who can't afford bail may spend days, even weeks, in jail waiting to see a judge for a crime where prison time might not even be required. At that point, it's hard to justify spending time or money fighting the charge, even if backing down leaves an innocent person with a criminal record.

"Everybody who works in the system knows that the assembly-line cash bail system coerces guilty pleas," says Civil Rights Corps founder and executive director Alec Karakatsanis. Because American courts don't have the manpower to prosecute and try every person who gets arrested, he argues, "the system needs a way to coerce them into pleading guilty. The most effective way is to keep them in jail."
---

Content: Mizizi ya upendeleo wa vyombo vya habari hurudi katika karne ya kumi na tisa, na malalamiko juu ya upendeleo kwa sehemu yanaonyesha wazo linaloweza kutiliwa shaka juu ya jukumu na kusudi la vyombo vya habari: kwamba magazeti na watawanyaji wengine wa habari za umma zipo kusambaza malengo, habari halisi zilizopatikana na kuwasilishwa na wataalamu walio na sifa.


Kwa kweli, maoni kwamba waandishi wa habari wanapaswa kuwa na usawa wa Olimpiki ni hivi karibuni. Katika karne ya kumi na tisa, magazeti mengi yaliunganishwa wazi na chama fulani cha siasa na masilahi ya kiuchumi ya mchapishaji.

Title: A Brief History of Media Bias (www.hoover.org)
Content: The tradition of lurid sensationalism, scandal-mongering, and exaggeration put in service to profits and a political agenda continued in the “yellow journalism” famously on display in the circulation war between the Hearst and Pulitzer newspapers in the late nineteenth century. Document ID: 3
Title: What is Media Bias and Where does It Come from? (with pictures) (www.infobloom.com)
Content: It is almost impossible for any network or journalistic publication not to be accused of some bias. Subtle things like word choice, time limits on programming, and sponsors may all suggest that the organization isn't neutral. Each individual who reports or writes the news also has to work hard to guard against revealing his or her own opinions. These opinions can reveal bias simply through word choice or inflections and tone of voice when delivering news.


[Image: The media is often described as biased.] The media is often described as biased.


One form of media bias is the failure to include varied points of view on a story. Often, this may be viewed as failing to include the opposite viewpoint, but it would be virtually impossible to include all viewpoints on a particular issue, since people approach issues from more than two directions. For example, those belonging to fringe political parties like the Libertarians or Green Party, often feel their viewpoint is not adequately represented in journalism.


[Image: One form of media bias is the failure to include varied points of view on a story.] One form of media bias is the failure to include varied points of view on a story.


This failure to represent all sides of the story may not be intentional bias, however. News stories may simply not have the time to cover all points of view, and may stick to classic “sides,” such as left and right, in an attempt to curb media bias. The media can still technically be biased since it cannot represent all points of view.

Title: Kuelewa Tatizo la Ukumbi wa Monty - BetterExplained (BetterExplained.com)
Content: Shida ya Ukumbi wa Monty ni puzzle ya takwimu-za kawaida:


* Kuna milango 3, nyuma ambayo ni mbuzi wawili na gari.
* Unachagua mlango (iite mlango a). Unatarajia gari bila shaka.
* Monty Hall, mwenyeji wa mchezo wa kuonyesha, anachunguza milango mingine (B&C) na kufungua moja na mbuzi. (Ikiwa milango yote miwili ina mbuzi, yeye huchukua nasibu.)


Hapa kuna mchezo: Je! Unashikamana na mlango A (nadhani ya asili) au ubadilishe kwa mlango ambao haujapangwa? Inajali?


Kwa kushangaza, tabia mbaya sio 50-50. Ukibadilisha milango utashinda 2/3 ya wakati!


Leo wacha tupate maoni kwa nini mchezo rahisi unaweza kuwa ngumu sana. Mchezo ni kweli juu ya kutathmini tena maamuzi yako wakati habari mpya inaibuka.


## Cheza mchezo


Labda unatetemeka kwamba milango miwili inamaanisha ni nafasi 50-50. Sawa, wacha tucheze mchezo:


Jaribu kucheza mchezo mara 50, ukitumia mkakati wa "chagua na kushikilia". Chagua mlango 1 (au 2, au 3) na endelea kubonyeza. Bonyeza bonyeza. Angalia kiwango chako cha kushinda asilimia. Utaona inakaa karibu 1/3.


Sasa weka upya na uicheze mara 20, ukitumia njia ya "chagua na ubadili". Chagua mlango, Monty anafunua mbuzi (mlango wa kijivu), na unabadilisha kwa mwingine. Angalia kiwango chako cha kushinda. Je! Ni zaidi ya 50% ni karibu na 60%? Hadi 66%?


Kuna nafasi mkakati wa kukaa na kushikilia hufanya kwa heshima juu ya idadi ndogo ya majaribio (chini ya miaka 20 au zaidi). Ikiwa ulikuwa na sarafu, ungehitaji kujishawishi ni sawa? Unaweza kupata vichwa 2 mfululizo na ufikirie ilikuwa ngumu. Cheza tu mchezo mara kadhaa ili hata nje na kupunguza kelele.


## Kuelewa kwa nini kubadili hufanya kazi


Hiyo ndiyo njia ngumu (lakini yenye kushawishi) ya kutambua kazi za kubadili. Hapa kuna njia rahisi:


Ikiwa nitachagua mlango na kushikilia, nina nafasi 1/3 ya kushinda.

Title: Understanding the Monty Hall Problem – BetterExplained (betterexplained.com)
Content: If I pick a door and hold, I have a 1/3 chance of winning.


My first guess is 1 in 3 — there are 3 random options, right?


If I rigidly stick with my first choice no matter what, I can’t improve my chances. Monty could add 50 doors, blow the other ones up, do a voodoo rain dance — it doesn’t matter. The best I can do with my original choice is 1 in 3. The other door must have the rest of the chances, or 2/3.


The explanation may make sense, but doesn’t explain why the odds “get better” on the other side. (Several readers have left their own explanations in the comments — try them out if the 1/3 stay vs 2/3 switch doesn’t click).

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Understanding the Monty Hall Problem – BetterExplained (betterexplained.com)
Content: The Monty Hall problem is a counter-intuitive statistics puzzle:


* There are 3 doors, behind which are two goats and a car.
* You pick a door (call it door A). You’re hoping for the car of course.
* Monty Hall, the game show host, examines the other doors (B & C) and opens one with a goat. (If both doors have goats, he picks randomly.)


Here’s the game: Do you stick with door A (original guess) or switch to the unopened door? Does it matter?


Surprisingly, the odds aren’t 50-50. If you switch doors you’ll win 2/3 of the time!


Today let’s get an intuition for why a simple game could be so baffling. The game is really about re-evaluating your decisions as new information emerges.


## Play the game


You’re probably muttering that two doors mean it’s a 50-50 chance. Ok bub, let’s play the game:


Try playing the game 50 times, using a “pick and hold” strategy. Just pick door 1 (or 2, or 3) and keep clicking. Click click click. Look at your percent win rate. You’ll see it settle around 1/3.


Now reset and play it 20 times, using a “pick and switch” approach. Pick a door, Monty reveals a goat (grey door), and you switch to the other. Look at your win rate. Is it above 50% Is it closer to 60%? To 66%?


There’s a chance the stay-and-hold strategy does decent on a small number of trials (under 20 or so). If you had a coin, how many flips would you need to convince yourself it was fair? You might get 2 heads in a row and think it was rigged. Just play the game a few dozen times to even it out and reduce the noise.


## Understanding Why Switching Works


That’s the hard (but convincing) way of realizing switching works. Here’s an easier way:


If I pick a door and hold, I have a 1/3 chance of winning.
---

* Kuna milango 3, nyuma ambayo ni mbuzi wawili na gari.
* Unachagua mlango (iite mlango a). Unatarajia gari bila shaka.
* Monty Hall, mwenyeji wa mchezo wa kuonyesha, anachunguza milango mingine (B&C) na kufungua moja na mbuzi. (Ikiwa milango yote miwili ina mbuzi, yeye huchukua nasibu.)


Hapa kuna mchezo: Je! Unashikamana na mlango A (nadhani ya asili) au ubadilishe kwa mlango ambao haujapangwa? Inajali?

## Cheza mchezo


Labda unatetemeka kwamba milango miwili inamaanisha ni nafasi 50-50. Sawa, wacha tucheze mchezo:


Jaribu kucheza mchezo mara 50, ukitumia mkakati wa "chagua na kushikilia". Chagua mlango 1 (au 2, au 3) na endelea kubonyeza. Bonyeza bonyeza. Angalia kiwango chako cha kushinda asilimia. Utaona inakaa karibu 1/3.

Kuna nafasi mkakati wa kukaa na kushikilia hufanya kwa heshima juu ya idadi ndogo ya majaribio (chini ya miaka 20 au zaidi). Ikiwa ulikuwa na sarafu, ungehitaji kujishawishi ni sawa? Unaweza kupata vichwa 2 mfululizo na ufikirie ilikuwa ngumu. Cheza tu mchezo mara kadhaa ili hata nje na kupunguza kelele.


## Kuelewa kwa nini kubadili hufanya kazi


Hiyo ndiyo njia ngumu (lakini yenye kushawishi) ya kutambua kazi za kubadili. Hapa kuna njia rahisi:


Ikiwa nitachagua mlango na kushikilia, nina nafasi 1/3 ya kushinda.

Title: Understanding the Monty Hall Problem – BetterExplained (betterexplained.com)
Content: If I pick a door and hold, I have a 1/3 chance of winning.


My first guess is 1 in 3 — there are 3 random options, right?


If I rigidly stick with my first choice no matter what, I can’t improve my chances. Monty could add 50 doors, blow the other ones up, do a voodoo rain dance — it doesn’t matter. The best I can do with my original choice is 1 in 3. The other door must have the rest of the chances, or 2/3.

question_src: Je! Cadence ya habari ilikujaje?
all_claims: Cadence ya sasa ya taarifa za habari ilitengenezwa kupitisha matamshi ya “Standard Broadcast English,” lahaja isiyoonyesha ukabila wala eneo lolote ili mtangazaji asikike “kutoka mahali popote” [2].
Tangu mapema, vyuo na programu za utangazaji hutoa kozi maalumu zinazofundisha watangazaji watarajiwa namna ya kuzungumza katika mtindo huu unaotambulika mara moja [2].

Shinikizo linatokana na ukweli kwamba soko lao la ajira ni la kuhama‐hama; ili mwandishi aliyezaliwa Texas apate kazi katika soko la Kaskazini lazima “azime droo” yake ya asili na asikike sawasawa na wenyeji wa huko [1].
Mafunzo hayo yanasisitiza usemi polepole na sahihi—k.m.
kusema “uvuvi” badala ya “samakiʹ”—ili kuwezesha uelewa kwa hadhira pana na kuondoa makosa ya lafudhi [2].
Watangazaji wapya pia huiga sauti za mifano waliowakua wakisikiliza, hivyo muundo wa hotuba hurudiwa na kuimarishwa kizazi baada ya kizazi [2].
Zaidi ya hayo, uangalifu wa kiufundi kama kuepuka mlipuko wa konsonanti “P” huchangia upangaji sawa wa silabi na mpigo unaoitwa “cadence ya habari” [3].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why Do Newscasters All Talk the Same? - Washington City Paper (washingtoncitypaper.com)
Content: We can expect to hear General American for a while. Mass communication may be slowing what would otherwise be natural evolutions in the way people speak; nobody in the U.S. lives in geographical isolation anymore if they’ve got a TV or computer, which helps GA in its hegemony. Among newscasters, GA conformity is rigidly enforced on the regional level; local anchors tend to be a highly mobile bunch, so there’s incentive for a Texas-born reporter looking for work in a northern market, for example, to ditch the drawl.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Kwa nini habari za nanga zote zinazungumza sawa? (www.nbcnews.com)
Content: Programu nyingi za mafunzo ya utangazaji hutoa kozi zilizojitolea kufundisha watangazaji wa siku zijazo jinsi ya kuongea katika mtindo huo unaotambulika mara moja.


Ubora kuu wa "Sauti" ni kwamba haifai kuwa na athari za ukabila, alisema Amy Caples, nanga wa zamani wa habari ambaye hufundisha madarasa ya sauti katika mpango wa utangazaji katika Chuo Kikuu cha Temple huko Philadelphia.


"Jambo juu ya kufanya kazi kwenye Runinga katika habari, michezo au burudani ni mtindo wa maisha wa Vagabond, na ikiwa utafanikiwa kwake, utakuwa unasonga mahali pote. Ili kupata kazi mahali pengine lazima usikie kama wewe ni kutoka mahali popote," Caples aliwaambia Siri ya Maisha. "Hawatakuajiri huko Yuma, Arizona, ikiwa unazungumza kama unatoka Bronx."


Sababu nyingine ambayo habari za nanga zinashiriki mifumo ya hotuba ni kwamba wote wanafundishwa kutumia kiwango cha utangazaji cha Kiingereza, aina ya matamshi ambayo hakuna herufi yoyote iliyoshuka. Kwa mfano, lazima kila wakati waseme "uvuvi," sio "samaki '." Pia wanazungumza polepole zaidi kuliko watu hufanya katika maisha ya kila siku ili kueleweka kwa urahisi, Caples alisema.


Kuna ukweli ulioongezwa kuwa watangazaji wengi wanatoa sauti za mifano yao, na kwa hivyo mifumo ya hotuba hupitishwa. "Nadhani kuna mengi ya patterning," alisema. "Ikiwa umekua ukisikiliza nanga fulani, au kumpongeza mtu kwenye Runinga, basi kuna juhudi ndogo ya kuonyesha hiyo. Wanawake wengi wanataka kusikika kama Oprah, kwa mfano; ana sauti kubwa."
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Why Do So Many News Anchors Sound Alike? (www.mentalfloss.com)
Content: Some anchors have also reported being more careful with their speech because broadcast microphones are often unforgiving. Words beginning with P tend to pop, for example. Broadcasting school drills out the kind of casual and conversational voice that doesn’t translate well to a newscast.


Of course, some linguists believe there’s no such thing as being totally free of an accent. A Southerner trying to remove any trace of a drawl is going to sound different than someone from New England attempting to do the same. We may not notice simply because humans aren’t that great at recognizing more subtle accents, especially our own. Broadcasters may sound alike in large part because they all enunciate and attempt to achieve articulatory precision. Few anchors will say “dubya.” They will say “double-you.” But that occasional “dubya” is what makes speech patterns sound different.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Kwa nini watangazaji wote wanazungumza sawa? - Karatasi ya Jiji la Washington (Washingtoncitypaper.com)
Content: Tunaweza kutarajia kusikia Mkuu wa Amerika kwa muda. Mawasiliano ya watu wengi inaweza kuwa kupunguza kile ambacho kingekuwa mabadiliko ya asili kwa njia ambayo watu huzungumza; Hakuna mtu huko Merika anayeishi katika kutengwa kwa kijiografia tena ikiwa wanayo TV au kompyuta, ambayo husaidia GA katika uzushi wake. Miongoni mwa watangazaji, kufuata kwa GA kunatekelezwa kwa ukali kwenye ngazi ya mkoa; Anchors za mitaa huwa rundo la rununu sana, kwa hivyo kuna motisha kwa mwandishi wa kuzaliwa wa Texas anayetafuta kazi katika soko la kaskazini, kwa mfano, kuzima droo.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Do News Anchors All Talk the Same? (www.nbcnews.com)
Content: Most broadcaster training programs offer courses devoted to teaching future announcers how to speak in that instantly recognizable style.


The main quality of "the voice" is that it must contain no traces of regionalism, said Amy Caples, a former news anchor who teaches voice classes in the broadcasting program at Temple University in Philadelphia.


"The thing about working on TV in news, sports or entertainment is it's a very vagabond lifestyle, and if you're going to be successful at it, you'll be moving all over the place. To get a job somewhere you have to sound literally like you're from nowhere," Caples told Life's Little Mysteries. "They're not going to hire you in Yuma, Arizona, if you talk like you're from the Bronx."


Another reason why news anchors share speech patterns is that they are all taught to use standard broadcasting English, a form of pronunciation in which no letters are dropped. For example, they must always say "fishing," not "fishin'." They also speak more slowly than people do in daily life in order to be easily understandable, Caples said.


There's the added fact that most broadcasters are emulating the voices of their role models, and so speech patterns get passed down. "I think there's a lot of patterning," she said. "If you've grown up listening to a certain anchor, or admire someone on TV, then there's a subconscious effort to mirror that. A lot of women want to sound like Oprah, for example; she has a great voice."
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Why Do So Many News Anchors Sound Alike? (www.mentalfloss.com)
Content: Some anchors have also reported being more careful with their speech because broadcast microphones are often unforgiving. Words beginning with P tend to pop, for example. Broadcasting school drills out the kind of casual and conversational voice that doesn’t translate well to a newscast.


Of course, some linguists believe there’s no such thing as being totally free of an accent. A Southerner trying to remove any trace of a drawl is going to sound different than someone from New England attempting to do the same. We may not notice simply because humans aren’t that great at recognizing more subtle accents, especially our own. Broadcasters may sound alike in large part because they all enunciate and attempt to achieve articulatory precision. Few anchors will say “dubya.” They will say “double-you.” But that occasional “dubya” is what makes speech patterns sound different.
---

prompt:

Title: Why Do Newscasters All Talk the Same? - Washington City Paper (washingtoncitypaper.com)
Content: We can expect to hear General American for a while. Mass communication may be slowing what would otherwise be natural evolutions in the way people speak; nobody in the U.S. lives in geographical isolation anymore if they’ve got a TV or computer, which helps GA in its hegemony. Among newscasters, GA conformity is rigidly enforced on the regional level; local anchors tend to be a highly mobile bunch, so there’s incentive for a Texas-born reporter looking for work in a northern market, for example, to ditch the drawl.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Kwa nini habari za nanga zote zinazungumza sawa? (www.nbcnews.com)
Content: Programu nyingi za mafunzo ya utangazaji hutoa kozi zilizojitolea kufundisha watangazaji wa siku zijazo jinsi ya kuongea katika mtindo huo unaotambulika mara moja.


Ubora kuu wa "Sauti" ni kwamba haifai kuwa na athari za ukabila, alisema Amy Caples, nanga wa zamani wa habari ambaye hufundisha madarasa ya sauti katika mpango wa utangazaji katika Chuo Kikuu cha Temple huko Philadelphia.


"Jambo juu ya kufanya kazi kwenye Runinga katika habari, michezo au burudani ni mtindo wa maisha wa Vagabond, na ikiwa utafanikiwa kwake, utakuwa unasonga mahali pote. Ili kupata kazi mahali pengine lazima usikie kama wewe ni kutoka mahali popote," Caples aliwaambia Siri ya Maisha. "Hawatakuajiri huko Yuma, Arizona, ikiwa unazungumza kama unatoka Bronx."


Sababu nyingine ambayo habari za nanga zinashiriki mifumo ya hotuba ni kwamba wote wanafundishwa kutumia kiwango cha utangazaji cha Kiingereza, aina ya matamshi ambayo hakuna herufi yoyote iliyoshuka. Kwa mfano, lazima kila wakati waseme "uvuvi," sio "samaki '." Pia wanazungumza polepole zaidi kuliko watu hufanya katika maisha ya kila siku ili kueleweka kwa urahisi, Caples alisema.


Kuna ukweli ulioongezwa kuwa watangazaji wengi wanatoa sauti za mifano yao, na kwa hivyo mifumo ya hotuba hupitishwa. "Nadhani kuna mengi ya patterning," alisema. "Ikiwa umekua ukisikiliza nanga fulani, au kumpongeza mtu kwenye Runinga, basi kuna juhudi ndogo ya kuonyesha hiyo. Wanawake wengi wanataka kusikika kama Oprah, kwa mfano; ana sauti kubwa."
---

Response: Watangazaji wapya pia huiga sauti za mifano waliowakua wakisikiliza, hivyo muundo wa hotuba hurudiwa na kuimarishwa kizazi baada ya kizazi [

claim: TV za Plasma hutumia mifuko ya gesi ambayo inapogeuzwa plasma na voltage, huchochea fosforasi nyekundu, kijani na bluu ndani ya kila pikseli kutoa mwanga wake moja kwa moja, hivyo hazihitaji taa ya nyuma na zinapata weusi bora kwa kuwa kila pikseli inaweza kuzimika kabisa
question_src: Je! Ni tofauti gani kati ya LED, LCD, plasma na TV za LCD za LCD?
all_claims: TV za Plasma hutumia mifuko ya gesi ambayo inapogeuzwa plasma na voltage, huchochea fosforasi nyekundu, kijani na bluu ndani ya kila pikseli kutoa mwanga wake moja kwa moja, hivyo hazihitaji taa ya nyuma na zinapata weusi bora kwa kuwa kila pikseli inaweza kuzimika kabisa [1].

TV za LCD za jadi hutumia paneli ya kioo kiwanja kinachozungusha fuwele kuruhusu au kuzuia mwanga kutoka kwa taa za nyuma za baridi-cathode fluorescent (CCFL); pikseli haziwezi kujitoa mwanga, hivyo weusi hutegemea kuziba mwanga badala ya kuuzima [2].

LED TV kimsingi ni LCD ile ile lakini badala ya CCFL hutumia taa ndogo nyingi za LED kando ya kingo au nyuma ya jopo, jambo linaloongeza ufanisi wa nishati, mwangaza na udhibiti wa maeneo meusi kwa sababu safu ya LED inaweza kudhibitiwa kwa sehemu (local dimming) [3].

Tofauti kuu kati ya LED na LCD za CCFL basi ni aina ya chanzo cha mwanga: LED ni ndogo, yenye ufanisi na inayowezesha miundo nyembamba zaidi ikilinganishwa na zilizopo ndefu za CCFL katika LCD za jadi [4].
Kwa muhtasari, Plasma ni “self-emissive”, LCD na LED ni “backlit”, huku LED ikiwa toleo lililoboreshwa la LCD kutokana na matumizi ya LED badala ya CCFL.
claims_retained: TV za Plasma hutumia mifuko ya gesi ambayo inapogeuzwa plasma na voltage, huchochea fosforasi nyekundu, kijani na bluu ndani ya kila pikseli kutoa mwanga wake moja kwa moja, hivyo hazihitaji taa ya nyuma na zinapata weusi bora kwa kuwa kila pikseli inaweza kuzimika kabisa [1].

TV za LCD za jadi hutumia paneli ya kioo kiwanja kinachozungusha fuwele kuruhusu au kuzuia mwanga kutoka kwa taa za nyuma za baridi-cathode fluorescent (CCFL); pikseli haziwezi kujitoa mwanga, hivyo weusi hutegemea kuziba mwanga badala ya kuuzima [2].

Tofauti kuu kati ya LED na LCD za CCFL basi ni aina ya chanzo cha mwanga: LED ni ndogo, yenye ufanisi na inayowezesha miundo nyembamba zaidi ikilinganishwa na zilizopo ndefu za CCFL katika LCD za jadi [4].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Plasma vs LED vs LCD TVS (www.rtings.com)
Content: Televisheni za Plasma zina mifuko midogo ya gesi, na wakati voltage inapotumika kwao, zinageuka kuwa hali ya plasma. Voltage basi hupiga zebaki ndani ya plasma kutoa mionzi ya ultraviolet (UV), ambayo hupita kupitia seli za phosphor kutoa picha. Kila pixel kwenye TV ina seli tatu za fosforasi: nyekundu, kijani, na bluu, na rangi hizi tatu huchanganyika ili kutoa rangi. Kwa kweli, Televisheni za plasma haziitaji taa ya nyuma, na kila pixel inajishughulisha kwani inazalisha nuru yake mwenyewe.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Plasma vs LED vs LCD TVs (www.rtings.com)
Content: Unlike plasma TVs, LCD TVs use a backlight. Initially, LCD TVs used Cold-Cathode Fluorescent Lamp (CCFL) as their backlight. These are long tubes that are placed horizontally across the screen behind the LCD panel. When the light is turned on, it applies a voltage to the pixels, which makes them rotate a certain way to allow light through and produce an image. When it wants to display black, the pixels are rotated to create an opaque screen so that light doesn't get through. This is what makes them different from plasma TVs because each pixel isn't self-emitting.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Plasma vs LED vs LCD TVs (www.rtings.com)
Content: Light-Emitting Diode (LED) TVs are the same as traditional LCD TVs, but instead of using CCFL backlights, they use many smaller LED lights. It produces an image the same way as a regular LCD TV because it still uses an LCD panel, but it has more control over the backlighting. The LEDs can be placed along the edges, which is called edge-lit LED, or all over the back panel, which is either called direct LED or full-array backlighting. You can see the differences between LCD and LED TVs below.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: LED vs. LCD TVs Explained | What's the Difference? | Digital Trends (www.digitaltrends.com)
Content: Older LCD TVs used cold cathode fluorescent lamps (CCFLs) to provide lighting, whereas LED LCD TVs used an array of smaller, more efficient light-emitting diodes (LEDs) to illuminate the screen.

all_claims: TV za Plasma hutumia mifuko ya gesi ambayo inapogeuzwa plasma na voltage, huchochea fosforasi nyekundu, kijani na bluu ndani ya kila pikseli kutoa mwanga wake moja kwa moja, hivyo hazihitaji taa ya nyuma na zinapata weusi bora kwa kuwa kila pikseli inaweza kuzimika kabisa [1].

TV za LCD za jadi hutumia paneli ya kioo kiwanja kinachozungusha fuwele kuruhusu au kuzuia mwanga kutoka kwa taa za nyuma za baridi-cathode fluorescent (CCFL); pikseli haziwezi kujitoa mwanga, hivyo weusi hutegemea kuziba mwanga badala ya kuuzima [2].

LED TV kimsingi ni LCD ile ile lakini badala ya CCFL hutumia taa ndogo nyingi za LED kando ya kingo au nyuma ya jopo, jambo linaloongeza ufanisi wa nishati, mwangaza na udhibiti wa maeneo meusi kwa sababu safu ya LED inaweza kudhibitiwa kwa sehemu (local dimming) [3].

Tofauti kuu kati ya LED na LCD za CCFL basi ni aina ya chanzo cha mwanga: LED ni ndogo, yenye ufanisi na inayowezesha miundo nyembamba zaidi ikilinganishwa na zilizopo ndefu za CCFL katika LCD za jadi [4].
Kwa muhtasari, Plasma ni “self-emissive”, LCD na LED ni “backlit”, huku LED ikiwa toleo lililoboreshwa la LCD kutokana na matumizi ya LED badala ya CCFL.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Plasma vs LED vs LCD TVs (www.rtings.com)
Content: Plasma TVs contain tiny pockets of gas, and when a voltage is applied to them, they turn into a plasma state. The voltage then strikes the mercury within the plasma to emit ultraviolet (UV) rays, which pass through phosphor cells to produce an image. Each pixel in the TV contains three phosphor cells: red, green, and blue, and these three colors combine to produce a color. Essentially, plasma TVs don't require a backlight, and each pixel is self-emissive as it produces its own light.

Title: Plasma vs LED vs LCD TVs (www.rtings.com)
Content: Unlike plasma TVs, LCD TVs use a backlight. Initially, LCD TVs used Cold-Cathode Fluorescent Lamp (CCFL) as their backlight. These are long tubes that are placed horizontally across the screen behind the LCD panel. When the light is turned on, it applies a voltage to the pixels, which makes them rotate a certain way to allow light through and produce an image. When it wants to display black, the pixels are rotated to create an opaque screen so that light doesn't get through. This is what makes them different from plasma TVs because each pixel isn't self-emitting.

question_src: Nywele za mkono wa muda mrefu
all_claims: Nywele moja au chache zinazokua ndefu zaidi kwenye mkono hutokana na mchanganyiko wa vinasaba na homoni unaobadilisha mzunguko wa nywele: kielelezo chake ni kwamba kiwambo husika kinaingia kwenye awamu ya anagen iliyorefushwa, hivyo nywele huendelea kukua kwa muda mrefu kabla haijang’oka [1].
Androjeni kama testosterone zinazozunguka mwilini zinaweza “kugonga” seli za shina za nywele na kuchochea ukuaji wa nywele ngumu na nene badala ya zile fupi na nyembamba (vellus) zilizokuwapo [2].
Watafiti wengine wanaamini androjeni huamsha vishina vya nywele vilivyokuwa vikitengeneza nywele za vellus na kuvibadilisha viwe terminal hair, yaani nywele kamili, nene na nyeusi zaidi [4].

Umri na mabadiliko ya viwango vya testosterone pia huongeza uwezekano wa nywele hizi za muda mrefu kujitokeza—kwa wanaume kadiri miaka inavyoongezeka, na kwa wanawake wakati wa ujauzito au baada ya kukoma hedhi ambapo viwango vya homoni hubadilika sana [3].
Mara chache, kiwewe cha ngozi au mfiduo wa mazingira unaweza kusababisha follicle moja “kuamka” na kutoa nywele refu isiyo kawaida [5].

Response: Mara chache, kiwewe cha ngozi au mfiduo wa mazingira unaweza kusababisha follicle moja “kuamka” na kutoa nywele refu isiyo kawaida [

claim: Mnamo 1952, Stanley Miller alionyesha kuwa mazingira ya Dunia ya awali yenye maji ya kuchemsha, hidrojeni, amonia, methani na umeme yangeweza kutengeneza molekuli hai kutoka kemikali rahisi [1]; baada ya wiki alipata asidi amino glycine na alanine, vizuizi vya protini msingi wa uhai
question_src: Je! Mageuzi hufanyikaje na viumbe vya kwanza vya kuishi vilitokeaje
all_claims: Mnamo 1952, Stanley Miller alionyesha kuwa mazingira ya Dunia ya awali yenye maji ya kuchemsha, hidrojeni, amonia, methani na umeme yangeweza kutengeneza molekuli hai kutoka kemikali rahisi [1]; baada ya wiki alipata asidi amino glycine na alanine, vizuizi vya protini msingi wa uhai [2].

Molekuli kama hizi ziliungana na kuunda protocell zilizoweza kujirudia, na mageuzi yakaanza kupitia mabadiliko ya kinasaba na uteuzi asilia—viumbe waliokuwa na sifa zinazoongeza uhai na uzazi walibakia.
Takribani miaka bilioni 2.4 iliyopita, cyanobacteria zilibuni fotosintesi na kuachilia oksijeni nyingi, kubadilisha anga na kuruhusu viumbe vinavyohitaji oksijeni kustawi [3].
Baadaye, baadhi ya vijidudu waliingia na kuishi ndani ya wengine, wakawa mitochondria, huku DNA ikifungashwa kwenye kiini na kuanzisha seli za eukaryoti zenye viungo maalum vya ndani [4].

Seli hizi tata zilianza kuishi pamoja, kugawana kazi, na hatimaye, takriban miaka milioni 800 iliyopita, vikundi hivi vya seli maalumu viligeuka kuwa wanyama wa kwanza, wakionyesha hatua muhimu ya mageuzi kuelekea viumbe changamano [4].
Hivyo, mageuzi hutokea kama mlolongo wa mabadiliko madogo yanayokusanywa kwa muda mrefu, kutoka molekuli hadi viumbe wenye miili tata.
claims_retained: Mnamo 1952, Stanley Miller alionyesha kuwa mazingira ya Dunia ya awali yenye maji ya kuchemsha, hidrojeni, amonia, methani na umeme yangeweza kutengeneza molekuli hai kutoka kemikali rahisi [1]; baada ya wiki alipata asidi amino glycine na alanine, vizuizi vya protini msingi wa uhai [2].

Mnamo 1952, Stanley Miller alionyesha kuwa mazingira ya Dunia ya awali yenye maji ya kuchemsha, hidrojeni, amonia, methani na umeme yangeweza kutengeneza molekuli hai kutoka kemikali rahisi [1]; baada ya wiki alipata asidi amino glycine na alanine, vizuizi vya protini msingi wa uhai [2].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The secret of how life on Earth began (www.bbc.com)
Content: in 1952, Miller began the most famous experiment on the origin of life ever attempted.

The set-up was simple. Miller connected a series of glass flasks and circulated four chemicals that he suspected were present on the early Earth: boiling water, hydrogen gas, ammonia and methane. He subjected the gases to repeated electric shocks, to simulate the lightning strikes that would have been a common occurrence on Earth so long ago
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Siri ya Jinsi Maisha Duniani Alianza (www.bbc.com)
Content: Miller aligundua kuwa "maji kwenye chupa yakawa ya rangi ya waridi baada ya siku ya kwanza, na mwisho wa juma suluhisho lilikuwa nyekundu na turbid". Kwa wazi, mchanganyiko wa kemikali ulikuwa umeunda.

Wakati Miller alichambua mchanganyiko huo aligundua kuwa ilikuwa na asidi mbili za amino: glycine na alanine. Asidi za Amino mara nyingi huelezewa kama vizuizi vya maisha. Zinatumika kuunda protini ambazo zinadhibiti michakato mingi ya biochemical katika miili yetu. Miller alikuwa ametengeneza vitu viwili muhimu zaidi maishani, kutoka mwanzo
---
Document ID: 3
Title: History of Life on Earth (naturalhistory.si.edu)
Content: When cyanobacteria evolved at least 2.4 billion years ago, they set the stage for a remarkable transformation. They became Earth’s first photo-synthesizers, making food using water and the Sun’s energy, and releasing oxygen as a result. This catalyzed a sudden, dramatic rise in oxygen, making the environment less hospitable for other microbes that could not tolerate oxygen
---
Document ID: 4
Title: History of Life on Earth (naturalhistory.si.edu)
Content: While they can process lots of chemicals, microbes did not have the specialized cells that are needed for complex bodies. Animal bodies have various cells –skin, blood, bone – which contain organelles, each doing a distinct job. Microbes are just single cells with no organelles and no nuclei to package their DNA.

Something revolutionary happened as microbes began living inside other microbes, functioning as organelles for them. Mitochondria, the organelles that process food into energy, evolved from these mutually beneficial relationships. Also, for the first time, DNA became packaged in nuclei. The new complex cells (“eukaryotic cells”) boasted specialized parts playing specialized roles that supported the whole cell.

Cells also began living together, probably because certain benefits could be obtained. Groups of cells might be able to feed more efficiently or gain protection from simply being bigger. Living collectively, cells began to support the needs of the group by each cell doing a specific job. Some cells were tasked with making junctions to hold the group together, while other cells made digestive enzymes that could break down food.

## The First Animals

These clusters of specialized, cooperating cells eventually became the first animals, which DNA evidence suggests evolved around 800 million years ago

question_src: Sekunde ni ya muda gani? Gramu ni nzito kiasi gani? Je! Mita iko umbali gani? Ni nani aliyekuja na ufafanuzi huu, na ni nini kinaongoza kwao kuwa sanifu?
all_claims: Sekunde ya SI ni muda sahihi wa vipindi 9 192 631 770 vya mionzi inayotokana na mpito wa viwango viwili vya hyperfine katika hali ya msingi ya atomi ya sesiamu-133 [1].

Gramu, kizio cha mfumo metriki, ni elfu moja (1 × 10⁻³) ya kilogramu; kilogramu hufafanuliwa kwa kuweka thamani ya mara kwa mara ya Planck kuwa 6.626 070 071 × 10⁻³⁴ J s, hivyo gramu huzidi takriban 0.001 kg [3].

Document ID: 2
Title: The Standard Meter (surveyhistory.org)
Content: The French originated the meter in the 1790s as one/ten-millionth of the distance from the equator to the north pole along a meridian through Paris. It is realistically represented by the distance between two marks on an iron bar kept in Paris. The International Bureau of Weights and Measures, created in 1875, upgraded the bar to one made of 90 percent platinum/10 percent iridium alloy.

In 1960 the meter was redefined as 1,650,763.73 wavelengths of orange-red light, in a vacuum, produced by burning the element krypton (Kr-86). More recently (1984), the Geneva Conference on Weights and Measures has defined the meter as the distance light travels, in a vacuum, in 1/299,792,458 seconds with time measured by a cesium-133 atomic clock which emits pulses of radiation at very rapid, regular intervals
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Gram (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The gram (alternative spelling: gramme;[1] SI unit symbol: g) is a metric system unit of mass.

Originally defined as "the absolute weight of a volume of pure water equal to the cube of the hundredth part of a metre [1 cm^3], and at the temperature of melting ice"[2] (later at 4 °C, the temperature of maximum density of water). However, in a reversal of reference and defined units, a gram is now defined as one thousandth of the SI base unit, the kilogram, or 1×10−3 kg, which itself is defined by the International Bureau of Weights and Measures, not in terms of grams, but by taking the fixed numerical value of the Planck constant h to be 6.626 070 15×10−34 kg⋅m^2⋅s−1

Unapogusa ngozi yao, unachochea mishipa iliyoko chini ya ngozi ambayo inaunganishwa moja kwa moja na uti wa mgongo, na ujumbe husafirishwa haraka kwa misuli ya mguu ili kujaribu kuondoa kisumbufu hicho, ndiyo maana mguu huruka bila hiari ya mbwa [1].

Title: How come sometimes when you yawn, a spray of water comes from the back of your mouth? (www.answerbag.com)
Content: I t actually comes from under the tongue. Gleeking is the projection of saliva from the submandibular gland on compression by the tongue. In general, gleeking occurs when an accumulation of saliva in the submandibular gland is propelled out in a stream when the gland is compressed by the tongue. The stream of saliva is released in the general direction of the front of the mouth. If the mouth is open the jet may project several feet. Gleeking is more likely when the salivary gland has been recently stimulated, but even a residual amount of saliva in the gland may be released by gleeking. Gleeking may occur spontaneously due to accidental tongue pressure on the sublingual gland while talking, eating, yawning, or cleaning the teeth.

Title: History of Germany (1945–1990) (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Prime Minister Hans Modrow headed a caretaker government which shared power with the new, democratically oriented parties. On 7 December 1989, an agreement was reached to hold free elections in May 1990 and rewrite the East German constitution. On 28 January, all the parties agreed to advance the elections to 18 March, primarily because of an erosion of state authority and because the East German exodus was continuing apace; more than 117,000 left in January and February 1990.


In early February 1990, the Modrow government's proposal for a unified, neutral German state was rejected by Chancellor Kohl, who affirmed that a unified Germany must be a member of NATO. Finally, on 18 March, the first free elections were held in East Germany, and a government led by Lothar de Maizière (CDU) was formed under a policy of expeditious unification with West Germany. The freely elected representatives of the Volkskammer held their first session on 5 April, and East Germany peacefully evolved from a communist to a democratically elected government.

Title: History of Germany (1945–1990) (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The conclusion of the final settlement cleared the way for the unification of East and West Germany. Formal political union occurred on 3 October 1990, preceded by the GDR declaring its accession to the Federal Republic through Article 23 of West Germany's Basic Law (meaning that constitutionally, East Germany was subsumed into West Germany); but affected in strict legality through the subsequent Unification Treaty of 30 August 1990, which was voted into their constitutions by both the West German Bundestag and the East German Volkskammer on 20 September 1990.[62] These votes simultaneously extinguished the GDR and affected fundamental amendments to the West German Basic Law (including the repeal of the very Article 23 under which the GDR had recently declared its post-dated accession).

Title: Why gold smuggling is on the rise in India (www.bbc.com)
Content: Triggered by a rise in duty on imports of gold jewellery introduced in June last year, smuggled gold worth 2,500m rupees ($41.18m; £24.75m) was confiscated at various ports and airports between March and December last year, up from 500m rupees during the same period in the previous fiscal year.

question_src: Je! Ni nini hatua ya karanga?
all_claims: Hatua kuu ya “Karanga” (Peanuts) ni kutumia visa vidogo vya kila siku vya watoto ili kuangazia hali halisi ya utu—mchanganyiko wa furaha, upole na kukatishwa tamaa—na hivyo kuwafanya wasomaji wajiulize maswali makubwa ya kimaadili na kifalsafa kuhusu jinsi ya kuishi na kubaki wanadamu wema katika ulimwengu mgumu [1].

Kupitia ucheshi unaoonekana mwepesi, Charles Schulz aliwasilisha “ukweli usiofurahi juu ya upweke wa uwepo wa kijamii,” akionyesha kwamba hata kivuli cha kitoto kinaweza kubeba uzito mkubwa wa kihisia na kiakili [3].

Schulz mwenyewe hakujiita msanii mkuu, lakini aliamini sanaa ya kweli huishi muda mrefu na kuendelea kuibua tafakari baada ya kifo cha msanii; hivyo, kwa “matukio yake madogo,” aliwapa watoto na watu wazima nafasi ya kutafakari masuala makubwa ya maisha bila woga [2].
Kwa kifupi, “Karanga” ni kioo cha utu kinachochanganya ucheshi na huzuni ili kuhamasisha huruma, uelewa na fikra za kina juu ya upweke, urafiki na maadili.

question_src: Je! Ni nini juu ya gesi chafu zinazowafanya gesi chafu?
all_claims: Gesi chafu hutofautiana na nitrojeni na oksijeni kwa sababu molekuli zao zina uwezo wa kunyonya mionzi ya infrared (IR) inayorudishwa na uso wa Dunia, badala ya kuiacha ipite moja kwa moja angani [2].
Uwezo huu unatokana na muundo wa molekuli unaoruhusu vifungo kuinama na kutetemeka wanapoguswa na IR, hivyo kufyonza nishati na kuihifadhi kama joto [4].
Baada ya kunyonya, molekuli hupata nishati ya kinetic na kuihamishia kwa gesi zingine, na kuongeza halijoto ya jumla ya anga [4].
Dioksidi kaboni, kwa mfano, hufyonza sana katika wimbo wa 15 μm na hudumu kwa muda mrefu hewani, hivyo kuwa mchango mkubwa wa athari ya chafu [1].
Mvuke wa maji na CO₂ hufyonza wigo mpana wa 4–80 μm (isipokuwa dirisha la 8–12 μm), ilhali ozoni hufyonza zaidi katika 9–10 μm, na zote hupunguza upitishaji huru wa mionzi ya joto kurudi angani [3].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Climate Science Investigations South Florida (www.ces.fau.edu)
Content: Carbon dioxide (CO2) is also an important greenhouse gas. It has a long lifetime in Earth's atmosphere. Carbon dioxide strongly absorbs energy with a wavelength of 15 μm (micrometers). This makes carbon dioxide a good absorber of wavelengths falling in the infrared radiation region of the spectrum.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Uchunguzi wa Sayansi ya Hali ya Hewa Florida Kusini (www.ces.fau.edu)
Content: Tayari umejifunza kuwa mazingira ya Dunia yanaundwa kimsingi ya nitrojeni na oksijeni. Gesi hizi ni wazi kwa mionzi ya jua inayoingia. Pia ni wazi kwa mionzi ya infrared inayotoka, ambayo inamaanisha kuwa haitoi au kutoa mionzi ya jua au infrared. Walakini, kuna gesi zingine katika mazingira ya Dunia ambayo huchukua mionzi ya infrared. Gesi hizi zinajulikana kama gesi chafu. Chini ni gesi muhimu zaidi za chafu zinazoshawishi mfumo wa hali ya hewa wa Dunia.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Climate Science Investigations South Florida (www.ces.fau.edu)
Content: An effective absorber of infrared radiation has a broader absorption profile, which means that it can absorb a wider spectrum of wavelengths. Water vapor and carbon dioxide can absorb radiation wavelengths in the range of 4 μm to 80 μm, except those between 8 μm and 12 μm. Ozone can absorb wavelengths between 9 μm and 10 μm, but as you have learned, it is found in low concentrations. The sun's ultraviolet wavelengths are strongly absorbed by ozone in the stratosphere.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Greenhouse Gases (chemistry.elmhurst.edu)
Content: Certain gases in the atmosphere have the property of absorbing infrared radiation. Oxygen and nitrogen the major gases in the atmosphere do not have this property. The infrared radiation strikes a molecule such as carbon dioxide and causes the bonds to bend and vibrate - this is called the absorption of IR energy. The molecule gains kinetic energy by this absorption of IR radiation. This extra kinetic energy may then be transmitted to other molecules such as oxygen and nitrogen and causes a general heating of the atmosphere. Analogy: Think of a partially stretched "toy slinky" - if you bump the slinky, the energy of the bump is absorbed by the vibrations in the slinky.

claim: Aina za jibini hutofautiana kwa sababu ya chanzo cha maziwa, viumbe hai (ukungu au bakteria) wanaoongezwa na muda wa kukomaa
question_src: Je! Aina tofauti za jibini hufanywaje?
all_claims: Aina za jibini hutofautiana kwa sababu ya chanzo cha maziwa, viumbe hai (ukungu au bakteria) wanaoongezwa na muda wa kukomaa [1].
Maziwa ya ng’ombe hutumika zaidi, lakini maziwa ya mbuzi au kondoo—ambayo huathiriwa na aina ya mnyama, msimu na lishe—hutoa ladha na muundo tofauti wa jibini [2].

Kwa jibini laini linaloiva juu kama Brie na Camembert, ukungu hupakwa kwenye uso na hutoa vimeng’enya vinavyovunja protini za curd wakati wa kukomaa, hivyo kulainisha kiini na kutoa ladha ya kipekee [3].
Jibini ngumu, kinyume chake, hupitia kukata curd ndogo, kupasha moto na kubanwa ili kuondoa unyevu mwingi na kulifanya liwe na muundo thabiti na maisha marefu ya rafu [4].
Kundi la jibini ngumu la “Uswizi” hutumia starter za bakteria za thermophilic zinazostahimili joto, ambazo baadaye huzalisha gesi na kutengeneza mashimo maarufu pamoja na ladha tamu kali [4].

Baada ya kutengenezwa, jibini hukomaa kwenye mazingira yaliyodhibitiwa; kadiri kukomaa kunavyoongezeka—kuanzia siku chache hadi zaidi ya miaka miwili—vijidudu na vimeng’enya huvunja casein, kupunguza unyevu, kutia ukali wa ladha na kuimarisha umbile [5].
