prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Kuunda sifa tofauti za jibini (www.sciencelearn.org.nz)
Content: Hakuna njia moja ya kuainisha jibini, na vigezo kadhaa vinaweza kutumika kama urefu wa kuzeeka, muundo na mkoa wa asili. Walakini, tofauti kuu katika sifa za jibini kwa ujumla zinaweza kuhusishwa na:

 * Asili ya maziwa * * ukungu maalum na bakteria ziliongezea * urefu tofauti wa kuzeeka
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Creating different cheese characteristics (www.sciencelearn.org.nz)
Content: While all milk is made up of the same basic elements, its composition varies according to:

 * the type and breed of animal * the season and geographic location * the health and nutrition of the animal.

While most cheese is made using cows’ milk, milk from other animals, especially goats and sheep, is also used
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Creating different cheese characteristics (www.sciencelearn.org.nz)
Content: Soft, ripened cheeses such as Camembert and Brie have a mould added to the surface, which produces a protein-digesting enzyme. The enzyme breaks down the curd during ripening, creating a runny texture and developing the characteristic flavour
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Creating different cheese characteristics (www.sciencelearn.org.nz)
Content: Harder cheeses undergo more complex processing, and there are two main groups:

 * Those with a simple microbiota made using mesophilic starters. * Swiss cheese varieties made using thermophilic starter bacteria, which can withstand higher processing temperatures. Subsequent growth of propionic acid-producing bacteria during ripening contributes to the flavour of these cheeses and also creates characteristic gas holes or ‘eyes’.

Processing steps that help remove moisture include:

 * cutting and stirring the curds – a finer cut releases more moisture * heating helps shrink the curds and remove more whey * pressing the final cheese – varying pressure and time affect the amount of whey released
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Creating different cheese characteristics (www.sciencelearn.org.nz)
Content: Freshly made cheese usually tastes salty and quite bland, as it is the ageing or ripening period that helps develop flavour. As cheese ages, microbes and enzymes break down the casein proteins, changing the texture and intensifying the flavour of the cheese.

Ripening conditions are carefully controlled with different temperatures and humidity levels affecting the rate of ripening, loss of moisture and rind formation.

The ripening period can be anything from several days to 2 or more years. As the ripening period increases, the cheese loses more moisture, develops a stronger flavour and becomes harder and more crumbly in texture

question_src: Je! Aina tofauti za jibini hufanywaje?
all_claims: Aina za jibini hutofautiana kwa sababu ya chanzo cha maziwa, viumbe hai (ukungu au bakteria) wanaoongezwa na muda wa kukomaa [1].

Kwa jibini laini linaloiva juu kama Brie na Camembert, ukungu hupakwa kwenye uso na hutoa vimeng’enya vinavyovunja protini za curd wakati wa kukomaa, hivyo kulainisha kiini na kutoa ladha ya kipekee [3].
Jibini ngumu, kinyume chake, hupitia kukata curd ndogo, kupasha moto na kubanwa ili kuondoa unyevu mwingi na kulifanya liwe na muundo thabiti na maisha marefu ya rafu [4].
Kundi la jibini ngumu la “Uswizi” hutumia starter za bakteria za thermophilic zinazostahimili joto, ambazo baadaye huzalisha gesi na kutengeneza mashimo maarufu pamoja na ladha tamu kali [4].

Baada ya kutengenezwa, jibini hukomaa kwenye mazingira yaliyodhibitiwa; kadiri kukomaa kunavyoongezeka—kuanzia siku chache hadi zaidi ya miaka miwili—vijidudu na vimeng’enya huvunja casein, kupunguza unyevu, kutia ukali wa ladha na kuimarisha umbile [5].

 * the origin of the milk * * specific moulds and bacteria added * varying lengths of ageing

Document ID: 2
Title: Kuunda sifa tofauti za jibini (www.sciencelearn.org.nz)
Content: Wakati maziwa yote yameundwa na vitu sawa vya msingi, muundo wake unatofautiana kulingana na:

 * Aina na kuzaliana kwa wanyama * Msimu na eneo la jiografia * Afya na lishe ya mnyama.

---
Document ID: 3
Title: Creating different cheese characteristics (www.sciencelearn.org.nz)
Content: Soft, ripened cheeses such as Camembert and Brie have a mould added to the surface, which produces a protein-digesting enzyme. The enzyme breaks down the curd during ripening, creating a runny texture and developing the characteristic flavour
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Creating different cheese characteristics (www.sciencelearn.org.nz)
Content: Harder cheeses undergo more complex processing, and there are two main groups:

 * Those with a simple microbiota made using mesophilic starters. * Swiss cheese varieties made using thermophilic starter bacteria, which can withstand higher processing temperatures. Subsequent growth of propionic acid-producing bacteria during ripening contributes to the flavour of these cheeses and also creates characteristic gas holes or ‘eyes’.

Processing steps that help remove moisture include:

 * cutting and stirring the curds – a finer cut releases more moisture * heating helps shrink the curds and remove more whey * pressing the final cheese – varying pressure and time affect the amount of whey released
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Creating different cheese characteristics (www.sciencelearn.org.nz)
Content: Freshly made cheese usually tastes salty and quite bland, as it is the ageing or ripening period that helps develop flavour. As cheese ages, microbes and enzymes break down the casein proteins, changing the texture and intensifying the flavour of the cheese.

Ripening conditions are carefully controlled with different temperatures and humidity levels affecting the rate of ripening, loss of moisture and rind formation.

The ripening period can be anything from several days to 2 or more years. As the ripening period increases, the cheese loses more moisture, develops a stronger flavour and becomes harder and more crumbly in texture
---

claim: Mfano maarufu ni Public Service Loan Forgiveness, ambapo mkopaji aliyeajiriwa kwa muda wote katika shirika la utumishi wa umma au anayehudumu kwa muda wote kupitia AmeriCorps au Peace Corps anaweza kufutiwa mkopo wa moja kwa moja baada ya kufanya malipo 120 yanayostahili chini ya mpango sahihi wa ulipaji
question_src: Fafanua: "Msamaha wa Mikopo ya Shirikisho" kwa Mikopo ya Wanafunzi
all_claims: “Msamaha wa Mikopo ya Shirikisho” kwa mikopo ya wanafunzi ni utaratibu wa kisheria unaoruhusu deni la mkopo wa wanafunzi lililodhaminiwa na serikali kufutwa kabisa au kwa sehemu pale mkopaji anapotimiza vigezo maalum vinavyowekwa na Idara ya Elimu ya Marekani.

Mfano maarufu ni Public Service Loan Forgiveness, ambapo mkopaji aliyeajiriwa kwa muda wote katika shirika la utumishi wa umma au anayehudumu kwa muda wote kupitia AmeriCorps au Peace Corps anaweza kufutiwa mkopo wa moja kwa moja baada ya kufanya malipo 120 yanayostahili chini ya mpango sahihi wa ulipaji [1].

question_src: Je! Harakati ya hippy ilikuwa nini, ilianzaje, na kwa nini?
all_claims: Harakati ya hippy ilikuwa mwamko wa kitamaduni ulioongozwa na vijana weupe wa tabaka la kati, wengi wao wanafunzi wa vyuo vikuu, waliokataa maadili ya matumizi na vikwazo vya kijamii vya wazazi wao, wakipigania maisha rahisi yanayotegemea rasilimali za Dunia, upendo na uhuru [1].
Ilianza katikati ya miaka ya 1960 huku mvutano na uchoyo uliochochewa na Vita ya Vietnam ukiongezeka, jambo lililowasukuma vijana hawa kuongoza juhudi za kuibadilisha Marekani [1].
Kiini cha harakati kilikuwa hasira dhidi ya serikali, waliyoiona kama mzizi wa vita, chuki na uchoyo uliotawala barabarani, hivyo wakakataa wazo kwamba vita ni suluhisho la matatizo ya taifa [1].

Ili kufikisha ujumbe, hippies waliandaa maandamano, kukaa-ins, migomo na mabango ya amani na umoja katika miji mbalimbali, wakidai serikali iwarejeshe askari wa Marekani kutoka Vietnam na ibadilishe sera zake za kivita [2].
Kwa jumla, harakati hii ililenga kujitambua, kukuza amani na kupinga utamaduni wa uchoyo na vurugu uliokuwa umetanda nchini.
claims_retained: Kiini cha harakati kilikuwa hasira dhidi ya serikali, waliyoiona kama mzizi wa vita, chuki na uchoyo uliotawala barabarani, hivyo wakakataa wazo kwamba vita ni suluhisho la matatizo ya taifa [1].

Ili kufikisha ujumbe, hippies waliandaa maandamano, kukaa-ins, migomo na mabango ya amani na umoja katika miji mbalimbali, wakidai serikali iwarejeshe askari wa Marekani kutoka Vietnam na ibadilishe sera zake za kivita [2].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Harakati ya Hippie - Mafunzo ya Mjini 101 (KuelewaTheurban.qwriting.qc.cuny.edu)
Content: Hippies walikuwa wazungu, kawaida vijana wa kiwango cha kati na wanafunzi wa vyuo vikuu vya kizazi cha watoto. Walikuwa wamechoka na ukungu walilazimishwa kutoshea na vizuizi vilivyowekwa juu yao na wazazi wao. Hippies walijulikana kukataa kutumia aina yoyote ya pesa au kupata chochote. Waliamini katika kuishi bora na kufanya kile walichoweza na kile Dunia kinapaswa kutoa.

Harakati kubwa ya hippie ilitokea kama matokeo ya Vita vya Vietnam. Watu wa Merika walikuwa wakijishughulisha kila wakati na wakaendeleza aina ya uchoyo ambayo ilikuja na hasira ya vita hii. Mvutano kati ya Wamarekani kujengwa, na vijana hawa weupe, wa kiwango cha kati huongoza njia ya kuibadilisha. Harakati ya hippie ilikuwa juu ya kujikuta na kukataa hitaji la kuendana na kile jamii inatarajia sisi sote. Ilikuwa pia juu ya kupigania amani dhidi ya vita na vurugu. Hippies aliamini kuwa serikali ndio mzizi wa shida zote za nchi na uchoyo na chuki ambayo ilienea barabarani. Kusudi lilikuwa kuifanya nchi kuona kwamba vita sio jibu la shida zake, lakini badala ya amani, upendo, na uhuru

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The Hippie Movement – Urban Studies 101 (understandingtheurban.qwriting.qc.cuny.edu)
Content: Hippies were the white, typically middle-class teenagers and college students of the baby boom generation. They were tired of the molds they were forced to fit and the restrictions placed upon them by their parents. Hippies were known to refuse spending any sort of money or earning anything. They believed in more wholesome living and doing what they could with what Earth has to offer.

Much of the hippie movement came about as a result of the Vietnam War. The people of the U.S. were constantly paranoid and developed a sort of greed that came along with the anger of this war. Tensions among Americans built, and these white, middle-class youngsters lead the way to change it. The hippie movement was all about finding oneself and rejecting the need to conform to what society expects of us all. It was also about fighting peacefully against war and violence. Hippies believed that the government was the root of all the country’s problems as well as greed and hatred that ran rampant in the streets. The goal was to get the country to see that war is not the answer to its problems, but rather peace, love, and freedom

question_src: Je! Kwa nini wahamiaji wasio na kumbukumbu wanarudi Mexico huendesha mshahara huko, lakini watetezi wa uhamiaji waliopumzika wanasema hawafanyi vivyo hivyo hapa?
all_claims: Hoja kwamba wahamiaji wasiorasmi wanaorudi Mexico “huongeza” mishahara huko hutegemea tafiti za ndani zinazoangalia mabadiliko makubwa ya idadi ya wafanyakazi katika masoko madogo ya kazi, ilhali watetezi wa uhamiaji nchini Marekani hutumia mbinu tofauti ambazo huonyesha athari ndogo sana kwa mishahara ya wazawa.

Uchunguzi wa Marekani mara nyingi hutumia “mbinu ya kitaifa ya ustadi,” inayolinganishwa na seli za elimu-uzoefu kote nchi nzima, na matokeo yake huonyesha mabadiliko madogo ya ujira kwa sababu wahamiaji husambazwa kwenye sekta na majimbo mengi [1].

Ripoti ya Academies ya Taifa pia haikupata ushahidi thabiti wa athari mbaya kwa viwango vya jumla vya ajira au mishahara ya wafanyakazi wa asili, ikihakikisha msimamo wa watetezi wa uhamiaji mwepesi [3].

Kinyume chake, tafiti za Mexico huelekea kutumia mbinu ya “anga safi” — kuchunguza majimbo maalum yanayopokea au kupoteza wahamiaji — ambapo mshtuko wa ghafla wa nguvu kazi unaweza kupandisha bei ya ajira kwa urahisi kwa sababu soko ni dogo na halina uingizaji mkubwa wa wafanyakazi mbadala [1].

Hivyo, tofauti kati ya masoko ya kazi (kubwa dhidi ya ndogo) na mbinu ya uchambuzi, si kutokuelewana kuhusu nadharia, ndicho chanzo cha mitazamo kinzani juu ya kama uhamiaji “hubana” au “hupandisha” mishahara.
claims_retained: Uchunguzi wa Marekani mara nyingi hutumia “mbinu ya kitaifa ya ustadi,” inayolinganishwa na seli za elimu-uzoefu kote nchi nzima, na matokeo yake huonyesha mabadiliko madogo ya ujira kwa sababu wahamiaji husambazwa kwenye sekta na majimbo mengi [1].

Title: Je! Uhamiaji unapunguza mshahara? (www.cato.org)
Content: Sababu moja ya kutokubaliana sana juu ya athari za uhamiaji juu ya mshahara ni kwamba kuna njia kadhaa tofauti za nguvu ambazo wachumi hutumia kusoma uhusiano wa mshahara hata kuna nadharia sawa (Altonji na kadi 1991). Kila njia ya nguvu hutumia njia tofauti ya kupima tofauti kwa idadi ya wahamiaji kutoa makadirio ya mshahara. Dustmann, Schonberg, na Stuhler (2016) muhtasari wa njia kuu tatu kama (1) mbinu ya kitaifa ya ustadi, (2) njia safi ya anga, na (3) mbinu iliyochanganywa. Njia ya kitaifa ya ustadi wa kitaifa hutumia tofauti katika kuingia kwa wahamiaji kwa vikundi tofauti vya uzoefu wa elimu ndani ya idadi ya watu wa kitaifa. Njia safi ya anga hutumia tofauti katika mtiririko wa wahamiaji katika miji au mikoa. Njia iliyochanganywa hutumia tofauti katika uhamiaji huingia katika vikundi vyote vya elimu na mikoa.

Document ID: 2
Title: Why Unskilled Immigrants Hurt America | Manhattan Institute (www.manhattan-institute.org)
Content: Of the 15 industries employing the greatest percentage of foreign-born workers, half are low-wage service industries, including gardening, domestic household work, car washes, shoe repair and janitorial work.

Title: FACT CHECK: Have Immigrants Lowered Wages For Blue-Collar American Workers? (www.npr.org)
Content: A recent analysis commissioned and published by the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine found "the literature on employment impacts finds little evidence that immigration significantly affects the overall employment levels of native-born workers."

Title: Do Immigrants Drive Down Wages? (www.newsweek.com)
Content: First, many immigrants send portions of their income out of the domestic economy in the form of remittances, but it is hard to know if this is materially different from domestic purchase of imports, and besides, ultimately those cash flows circulate back to demand for U.S. goods in the form of exports.

Title: Do Immigrants Drive Down Wages? (www.newsweek.com)

question_src: Kwa nini wanadamu walianza kunyoa?
all_claims: Binadamu wanaaminika kuanza kuondoa nywele takriban miaka 100,000 KK, wakiwa wanang’oa nywele moja-moja au kutumia vipande vya mwamba mkali kabla ya kugundua kwamba mawe ya flint yaliyokolea yanaweza kukata nywele haraka zaidi karibu miaka 70,000 baadaye [1].

Sababu kuu zilikuwa za kiafya na kimazingira: nywele nyingi za mwili ziliunda “makazi” bora kwa chawa na wadudu wengine, na hata kuongeza hatari ya maambukizo ya kuvu katika maeneo ya moto na yenye unyevunyevu, hivyo kunyoa kulisaidia kupunguza vimelea na magonjwa [1].
Nywele pia zilinasua jasho na bakteria, na hivyo kuongeza harufu mbaya ya mwili ambayo ilichukuliwa kuwa ishara ya uchafu katika jamii kama ya Wamisri [1].

Kwa Wamisri kunyoa kulibeba pia maana ya kijamii; kadiri desturi ilivyoimarika, kutokuwa na nywele kichwani na mwilini kulionekana kama alama ya usafi na hadhi, kiasi kwamba matajiri waliwaajiri “waendeshaji wa muda wote” kudumisha muonekano huo unaostarehesha katika joto kali la jangwani [2].
Hivyo, msukumo wa awali wa kunyoa ulikuwa afya na mazingira, kisha ukapanuka kuwa ishara ya ustaarabu na tabaka.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Historia ya kunyoa: Je! Wanaume na wanawake walianza kunyoa lini? (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: Ingawa ratiba halisi ya kunyoa haiko wazi, wataalam wengi na waligundua mabaki yanaonyesha kuwa kunyoa kumekuwa karibu tangu takriban 100,000 KK, wakati watu wa Cavemen wangeondoa nywele kutoka kwa miili yao kwa kuvuta moja kwa wakati, hata kutumia miamba au ganda kama tweezers ili kuharakisha mchakato. Kusonga mbele kwa miaka 70,000 na mtu wa mapema ametambua thamani ya flint iliyoinuliwa, sio nzuri tu kwa moto, lakini pia kwa kukata nywele kutoka kwa mwili!

[Picha: Sio tu mimi kuweka uso wangu laini lakini pia nimeunda meme hii ya kompyuta]

Historia halisi ya kunyoa, hata hivyo, haianza hadi tufikie ustaarabu wa Wamisri, ambapo kitendo cha kunyoa kilifanya kwanza kwenye hatua ya ulimwengu. Wamisri walikuwa na imani ya nguvu kwamba nywele za mwili zilikuwa ishara ya uchafu, kwa hivyo wanaume na wanawake walihusika katika kuondolewa kabisa kwa nywele kutoka kwa mwili - kichwa hadi! Katika hali nyingine, viungo vya caustic kama QuickLime na arseniki vilitumiwa katika mafuta haya ya kwanza ya kupendeza na kunyoa. Razila za mapema pia zilionekana karibu wakati huo, na kuongezeka kwa utengenezaji wa madini na madini katika maeneo mengi ya ulimwengu. Urafiki wa Wamisri kwa usafi na nywele za mwili zilizopakana na macho, na madarasa ya juu mara nyingi huoga mara kadhaa kwa siku. Wangenyoa vichwa vyao kabisa, na kisha kubuni wigs za baridi ili kuvaa hadharani.

Hofu ya uchafu ilikuwa wasiwasi wa kweli, na inaweza kuwa sababu ya mapema ya mtu wa kwanza kunyoa pia. Nywele za mwili hutoa mazingira bora kwa chawa na wakosoaji wengine wasiohitajika, na pia inaweza kuwa eneo la kuzaliana kwa maambukizo ya kuvu, haswa katika hali ya hewa ya moto au yenye unyevu. Wamisri walijaribu kuondoa hatari ya wadudu au vimelea kwa kuondoa mazingira yoyote ambapo wanaweza kustawi! Kwa kuongezea, katika hali ya hewa ya moto na yenye unyevu wa Misri, kuwa na nywele nyingi za mwili zilisababisha ukuaji wa haraka wa harufu ya mwili, ishara nyingine ya uchafu ndani ya jamii ngumu ya Wamisri.
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: History of shaving: When did men and women start shaving? (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: Although the exact timeline of shaving isn’t clear, most experts and found artifacts suggest that shaving has been around since approximately 100,000 BC, when cavemen would eliminate hair from their body by pulling them out one at a time, even using rocks or shells like tweezers to speed the process. Fast-forward another 70,000 years and early man has recognized the value of sharpened flint, not only good for striking fire, but also for delicately slicing off hair from the body!

[Image: not only do i keep my face smooth but i also built this computer meme]

The real history of shaving, however, doesn’t begin until we reach the Egyptian civilization, where the act of shaving made its real debut on the world stage. Egyptians had a powerful belief that body hair was a sign of uncleanliness, so both men and women engaged in the complete removal of hair from the body—head to toe! In some cases, caustic ingredients like quicklime and arsenic were used in these primitive depilatory creams and shaving lotions. Early razors also appeared around the time, with the rise in metalworking and mining in many areas of the world. The Egyptian relationship to cleanliness and body hair bordered on the obsessive, and the upper classes often bathed multiple times per day. They would shave their heads completely bald, and then design cooling wigs to wear out in public.

The fear of uncleanliness was a real concern, and may have been the early reason for prehistoric man to shave as well. Body hair provides an ideal environment for lice and other unwanted critters, and can also be a breeding ground for fungal infections, particularly in hot or humid weather. Egyptians attempted to eliminate the risk of pests or pathogens by removing any environment where they could thrive! Furthermore, in the hot and humid weather of Egypt, having an excess of body hair led to the much faster development of body odor, another sign of uncleanliness within the rigid Egyptian society.

Kuandika kwa mkono kila nafasi itakayotokea hujenga misuli na uthabiti unaofanya herufi ziwe laini na sawia [3].
Kufundisha watoto mlolongo sahihi wa mistari na maumbo kabla ya herufi huweka msingi thabiti wa uandishi mwororo baadaye [4].
Michezo inayoboreshwa uratibu kati ya macho na mkono, kama kutupa begi la maharagwe, inaimarisha uwezo muhimu wa kuona-motor unaosaidia kudhibiti kalamu [5].
Mazoezi haya ya mapema yanaonyeshwa kuongeza ujuzi mzuri wa gari na utendaji wa kuona-motor [6].
Hata kwa watu wazima, kujaza safu za alfabeti na kurekebisha kielekeo au umbo la kila herufi ni njia bora ya kusawazisha mwandiko [7].
tofauti za mwandiko ni zao la mafunzo, mazoezi na maendeleo ya kimuundo, si bahati nasibu.

Document ID: 2
Title: What is a Visa? | US Visa Help (visahelp.us.com)
Content: The visa is issued by the immigration authorities of the country you are planning to visit, usually, a consulate or embassy in your country. In cases when your destination country does not have a consulate or embassy in your home country, you will have to obtain a travel visa at the embassy of another country which is authorized to issue visas for the country you will visit.


Each country has its own visa policy, but the application process for a visa is generally similar. There are many types of travel visas depending on your nationality, destination country, the purpose of travel and even the number of times you wish to visit that country.


There are also a number of requirements that you will have to fulfill which vary from country to country. Although there are not a lot of differences since most of the immigration authorities ask for approximately the same documents, depending on your purpose of travel, you might have to submit some extra or fewer documents.


However, a visa does not guarantee you will enter that country since the border guard has the final decision to make.

Document ID: 2
Title: What is a Visa? | US Visa Help (visahelp.us.com)
Content: The visa is issued by the immigration authorities of the country you are planning to visit, usually, a consulate or embassy in your country. In cases when your destination country does not have a consulate or embassy in your home country, you will have to obtain a travel visa at the embassy of another country which is authorized to issue visas for the country you will visit.


Each country has its own visa policy, but the application process for a visa is generally similar. There are many types of travel visas depending on your nationality, destination country, the purpose of travel and even the number of times you wish to visit that country.


There are also a number of requirements that you will have to fulfill which vary from country to country. Although there are not a lot of differences since most of the immigration authorities ask for approximately the same documents, depending on your purpose of travel, you might have to submit some extra or fewer documents.


However, a visa does not guarantee you will enter that country since the border guard has the final decision to make.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Is Ocean Desalination the Answer to the World's Water Shortage? (www.thoughtco.com)
Content: Desalination -- a process whereby highly pressurized ocean water is pushed through tiny membrane filters and distilled into drinking water -- is being held forth by some as one of the most promising solutions to the problem. But critics point out it doesn't come without its economic and environmental costs.

## Costs and Environmental Impact of Desalination

According to the non-profit Food & Water Watch, desalinated ocean water is the most expensive form of fresh water out there, given the infrastructure costs of collecting, distilling and distributing it. The group reports that, in the U.S., desalinated water costs at least five times as much to harvest as other sources of fresh water. Similar high costs are a big hurdle to desalination efforts in poor countries as well, where limited funds are already stretched too thin.

On the environmental front, widespread desalination could take a heavy toll on ocean biodiversity. "Ocean water is filled with living creatures, and most of them are lost in the process of desalination," says Sylvia Earle, one of the world's foremost marine biologists and a National Geographic Explorer-in-Residence. “Most are microbial, but intake pipes to desalination plants also take up the larvae of a cross-section of life in the sea, as well as some fairly large organisms…part of the hidden cost of doing business,” she says.

Plants have been set across the world in Australia, U.S, Saudi Arabia and more where each day tens of thousands of gallons of freshwater are produced from an endless supply of the sea.

Kwa maneno mengine, moyo wa mkimbiaji hupata “output” ile ile ya damu kwa mapigo machache, jambo linaloonyesha tu ufanisi ulioimarishwa, si udhaifu wa moyo [2].

Hatimaye, mageuzi hayo ya miundombinu—misuli ya moyo nene na pigo lenye nguvu—yanamaanisha kwamba kiwango cha mapigo kinachoonekana kuwa cha chini au cha kutisha kwa mtu asiye na mazoezi ni cha kawaida kabisa kwa mwanariadha aliyezoezwa vizuri [3].

Title: Why Do Athletes Have a Lower Resting Heart Rate? (www.healthline.com)
Content: Athletes often have a lower resting heart rate than others. If you exercise frequently and are reasonably fit, your heart rate may be lower than other people.

Title: Why Do Athletes Have a Lower Heart Rate? | Livestrong.com (www.livestrong.com)
Content: Increased cardiovascular fitness causes real physical changes in the structure of the heart. The muscles in the heart wall thicken, and the heart pumps more blood with each beat. That increased efficiency means an athlete's resting heart rate falls to a level that could indicate trouble in a nonathlete. prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Photograph manipulation (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: hoto manipulation dates back to some of the earliest photographs captured on glass and tin plates during the 19th century. The practice began not long after the creation of the first photograph (1825) by Joseph Nicéphore Niépce who developed heliography and made the first photographic print from a photoengraved printing plate.[3][4] Traditional photographic prints can be altered using various methods and techniques that involve manipulation directly to the print, such as retouching with ink, paint, airbrushing, or scratching Polaroids during developing (Polaroid art).[5] Negatives can be manipulated while still in the camera using double-exposure techniques, or in the darkroom by piecing photos or negatives together. Some darkroom manipulations involved techniques such as bleaching to artfully lighten or totally wash-out parts of the photograph, or hand coloring for aesthetic purposes or to mimic a fine art painting.[6]
---
Document ID: 2
Title: A Short History of Photo Manipulation (Before Photoshop) (www.creativelive.com)
Content: In a 2013 blog post for Fstoppers, professional retoucher Pratik Naik described the painstaking process as such:


“Need to zoom into a photo? Be sure to bust out the magnifying glass and a bottle of patience along with that steady hand of yours. No sorry, there’s no history states or layers. You can also forget about that wonderful healing brush! Here’s a paint brush instead”


Art directors, graphic designers, and publishers labored long hours over images, attempting to perfect skin, materials, and other issues which, today, would be easily whisked away with the click of a mouse. Tools like paint, erasers, airbrushes, and other art supplies were necessary in any studio — as was a steady hand and a keen eye for color and shadow. You can even see some of the hard work that went into perfecting photos in this annotation of a famous Dennis Stock image, which has been marked up by Pablo Inirio.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Tulifanya nini kabla ya Photoshop? (www.pbs.org)
Content: MIA FINEMAN: Picha nyingi za mapema zilizodanganywa zilikuwa majaribio ya kulipia mapungufu ya kiufundi ya kati - haswa, kutokuwa na uwezo wa kuonyesha ulimwengu kama inavyoonekana kwa jicho uchi.


Wakati upigaji picha ulianzishwa kwa mara ya kwanza mnamo 1839, watu walijiuliza ni vipi kati ambayo inaweza kutoa fomu na maandishi kwa maelezo kama haya ya kupendeza yanaweza kushindwa kusajili kipengee cha rangi. Kutamani kupendeza wateja wanaowezekana, wapiga picha mara moja waliamua kuingilia mwongozo, wakiongeza picha zao na rangi ya unga, rangi ya maji na rangi ya mafuta.


Upigaji picha za mapema zilikuwa za upofu wa rangi kwa njia zingine pia. Katika karne ya 19, emulsions za picha zilikuwa nyeti zaidi kwa mwanga wa bluu na rangi ya rangi ya rangi ya rangi ya rangi ya rangi ya hudhurungi na rangi nyingine kuliko rangi zingine kwenye wigo, ambayo ilimaanisha kuwa anga za bluu karibu kila wakati zilionekana wazi na zilizo wazi. Ili kuondokana na shida, wapiga picha wengi wa mazingira wangefanya hasi mbili tofauti - moja wazi kwa ardhi, nyingine kwa anga - na kuyachapisha pamoja kwenye karatasi moja. Mpiga picha wa Ufaransa Gustave Le Grey alitumia mbinu hii katika bahari yake kubwa ya miaka ya 1850. Maonyesho hayo yanaonyesha bahari tatu na Le Grey, zote kwa kutumia wingu moja hasi. question_src: Kwa nini milango ya bafuni haitoi faragha sahihi?
all_claims: Milango ya bafuni za umma hutoa faragha isiyokamilika kwa makusudi kwa sababu kadhaa: kwanza, pengo chini na juu huruhusu watu kuona na kugundua haraka iwapo mtumiaji amepoteza fahamu, hivyo wasaidizi wanaweza kumvuta au kutambaa chini ya mlango bila kuuvunja, jambo linaloweza kuokoa maisha [1].
Pili, mwonekano huu kidogo ni kizuizi cha tabia isiyofaa kama kufanya ngono, kutumia dawa za kulevya au kuchora graffiti kwani mtu yeyote anaweza kuonekana kirahisi [1].
Tatu, milango mifupi inahitaji mbao/karatasi chache na haibidi kupimwa kulingana na urefu wa chumba, hivyo inagharimu kidogo kutengeneza na kusakinisha kuliko milango inayogusa sakafu hadi dari [1].
Nne, mapungufu hurahisisha kusafisha kwa kuwa maji au power-wash yana mahali pa kukimbia na mfagiaji hahitaji kufungua kila duka [2].
Tano, mzunguko wa hewa ni bora zaidi, kupunguza unyevunyevu na harufu kali zinazoweza kujikusanya kwenye duka lililofungwa kabisa [2].
Hatimaye, nafasi hiyo pia hutoa “toe space” muhimu kwa watumiaji wa viti vya magurudumu kulingana na matakwa ya ADA [2].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Sababu za bafuni za umma zina mapungufu (www.msn.com)
Content: Kwa kweli kuna sababu kadhaa halali ni vizuri kuongeza mwonekano ndani ya duka. Ikiwa mlango ulikwenda sakafuni, wakaazi wengine wanaweza kukosa kugundua ikiwa mtu katika duka alikuwa na shida na alipoteza fahamu. Pengo hutoa mwonekano ikiwa mtu wa ndani yuko katika aina fulani ya shida. Pia husaidia wahojiwa wa kwanza, ambao wangeweza kumvuta mtu huyo bila kulazimika kuvunja mlango.


Pengo pia hutoa dent ya kutosha katika faragha kufanya aina yoyote ya tabia mbaya ya umma -kama shughuli za ngono au matumizi ya dawa za kulevya - vitendo visivyo.


Kuna maanani ya kiuchumi na ya vifaa, pia. Milango ambayo inakuja sehemu tu ya njia ya chini ni ya ulimwengu wote, ikimaanisha kuwa wauzaji na wasanidi hawahitaji kupima. Hii inaokoa kwa gharama. Milango ndogo pia hufanya sakafu ya kusafisha ndani na karibu na maduka iwe rahisi. Huo ndio ulikuwa motisha nyuma ya mbuni wa mbunifu aliyejulikana Frank Lloyd Wright iliyoundwa kwa jengo lenye ushawishi la Larkin ambalo lilisimama Buffalo, New York, kutoka 1903 hadi 1950. Mawazo yake mengi, kama milango ndogo ya bafuni, ikawa kiwango cha ujenzi wa biashara.


Ikiwa bado haujashawishika mapungufu ni ushindi wa muundo, fikiria kuwa duka lililofungwa litakuwa na mzunguko mdogo wa hewa. Jambo la mwisho unataka au unahitaji katika bafuni ya umma ni kuvuta harufu. Pia husaidia kuweka laini kwa kiwango cha chini. (Halafu tena, ndivyo pia harufu.)
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Do Bathroom Stalls Not To The Floor - Bathroom Stall Gap (onepointpartitions.com)
Content: Easier to Clean: By having a gap at the bottom, bathroom partitions are much easier to clean, as is the whole restroom. You can hose down or even powerwash a restroom that has partitions with gaps at the bottom because the water has somewhere to run even if there’s not a drain in a given stall.
* Emergency Access: If someone loses consciousness in a fully enclosed bathroom, it may take hours for someone to notice. If this happens in a stall with a gap at the bottom, the odds are good someone will notice much quicker, which is important in instances where every second can mean the difference between life and death. Instead of having to break down the door, a first responder can crawl through the gap at the bottom of the partition and unlock the door to render help.
* Deterrent to Undesirable Behavior: Because people can partially see into a bathroom stall that has a gap at the bottom, this type of partition is a natural deterrent to undesirable behavior, such as someone spray painting the stall with graffiti.
* More Affordable: Partitions that don’t extend from the floor to the ceiling don’t have to be custom made to fit a room’s exact measurements and they don’t require as many materials to construct. This makes them considerably more affordable.
* Better Air Circulation: Better air circulation is one of the top reasons why there are gaps under toilet stalls. While restrooms with this kind of partition may still get a bit stinky from time to time, things would be even more overwhelming in a fully enclosed stall.
* Keeps the Line Moving: Having a gap at the base of a partition allows people waiting in line to see if a stall is occupied or vacant. This visibility keeps the line moving and prevents wait times from being any longer than they have to be. When a stall isn’t fully enclosed, people often feel like they have to take care of their business even faster, which also helps keep the line moving.
* ADA Compliance: Space is needed to allow for easier maneuverability for patrons in a wheelchair. The gap allows toe space for wheelchair
---

* Keeps the Line Moving: Having a gap at the base of a partition allows people waiting in line to see if a stall is occupied or vacant. This visibility keeps the line moving and prevents wait times from being any longer than they have to be. When a stall isn’t fully enclosed, people often feel like they have to take care of their business even faster, which also helps keep the line moving.
* ADA Compliance: Space is needed to allow for easier maneuverability for patrons in a wheelchair. The gap allows toe space for wheelchair

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The Reason Public Bathroom Stalls Have Gaps (www.msn.com)
Content: There are actually a number of valid reasons it’s good to increase visibility inside of a stall. If the door went all the way to the floor, other occupants might not be able to notice if someone in a stall was having a problem and lost consciousness. The gap provides visibility in case a person inside is in some kind of distress. It also helps first responders, who could pull the occupant out without having to break down the door.


A gap also provides just enough of a dent in privacy to make any kind of undesirable public behavior—like sexual activity or drug use—less practical.


There are economical and logistical considerations, too. Doors that come only part of the way down are universal, meaning that suppliers and installers don’t need to custom-measure them. This saves on costs. Small doors also make cleaning floors in and around the stalls easier. This was the motivation behind the partitions famed architect Frank Lloyd Wright designed for the influential Larkin Building that stood in Buffalo, New York, from 1903 to 1950. Many of his ideas, like small bathroom doors, became a standard of business construction.


If you’re still not convinced gaps are a design win, consider that an enclosed stall is going to have only limited air circulation. The last thing you want or need in a public bathroom is to trap odors. It also helps keep loitering to a minimum. (Then again, so would the stench.)
---

Content: Rahisi kusafisha: Kwa kuwa na pengo chini, sehemu za bafuni ni rahisi kusafisha, kama ilivyo choo chote. Ikiwa hii itatokea katika duka na pengo chini, tabia mbaya ni nzuri mtu atagundua haraka, ambayo ni muhimu katika hali ambapo kila sekunde inaweza kumaanisha tofauti kati ya maisha na kifo. Badala ya kuvunja mlango, mhojiwa wa kwanza anaweza kutambaa kupitia pengo chini ya kizigeu na kufungua mlango ili kutoa msaada. * Kuzuia tabia isiyofaa: Kwa sababu watu wanaweza kuona sehemu ya bafuni ambayo ina pengo chini, aina hii ya kizigeu ni kizuizi cha asili kwa tabia isiyofaa, kama vile mtu ananyunyiza kuchora duka na graffiti. * Nafuu zaidi: Sehemu ambazo haziongei kutoka sakafu hadi dari sio lazima zifanyike ili kutoshea vipimo halisi vya chumba na hazihitaji vifaa vingi kuunda. Hii inawafanya wawe na bei nafuu zaidi. * Mzunguko bora wa hewa: Mzunguko bora wa hewa ni moja ya sababu za juu kwa nini kuna mapungufu chini ya maduka ya choo. Wakati vyoo na aina hii ya kizigeu bado vinaweza kunuka mara kwa mara, mambo yangekuwa mengi zaidi katika duka lililofungwa kabisa. . Mwonekano huu huweka mstari kusonga na kuzuia nyakati za kungojea kuwa tena kuliko vile inavyopaswa kuwa. Wakati duka halijafungwa kabisa, mara nyingi watu huhisi kama wanapaswa kutunza biashara zao hata haraka, ambayo pia husaidia kuweka mstari kusonga. * Utaratibu wa ADA: Nafasi inahitajika ili kuruhusu ujanja rahisi kwa walinzi kwenye kiti cha magurudumu. Pengo linaruhusu nafasi ya toe kwa kiti cha magurudumu

claim: Lugha mbalimbali za Ulaya hutumia majina tofautitofauti kwa Ujerumani kwa sababu kila jamii ilikutana na makabila au chimbuko tofauti kabla taifa la kisasa kuundwa mwaka 1871, hivyo ikaunda neno lake kulingana na uzoefu huo na miundo ya lugha zao
question_src: Je! Kwa nini lugha tofauti za Ulaya zina majina tofauti kwa Ujerumani?
all_claims: Lugha mbalimbali za Ulaya hutumia majina tofautitofauti kwa Ujerumani kwa sababu kila jamii ilikutana na makabila au chimbuko tofauti kabla taifa la kisasa kuundwa mwaka 1871, hivyo ikaunda neno lake kulingana na uzoefu huo na miundo ya lugha zao [1].

Warumi waliita eneo hilo Germania, na Kiingereza kiliendelea na umbo “Germany” karibia miaka ya 1500 baada ya kutumia “Almain/Alman” kwa kabila la Alemanni—ndio maana Kifaransa husema “Allemagne” [2].
Lugha za Kijerumani kama Kijerumani (Deutschland), Kidenmaki (Tyskland) na Kiholanzi (Duitsland) zinatokana na proto-Germanic *þeudō/*þeudiskaz, “taifa” au “ya watu” [3].
Lugha za Slavic, mfano Kipolishi Niemcy na Kicheki Německo, zimetokana na proto-Slavic němьcь, “bubu,” neno lililotumika kuwataja wageni wasiozungumza lugha yao—mara nyingi Wajerumani [3].
Majina ya Kibaltiki kama Vācija (Kilatvia) na Vokietija (Kilithuania) hayana uhakika; dhana mojawapo yazihusisha na mzizi wa proto-Indo-European *wek “kuongea” au na majina ya Waviking [3].
Kwa jumla, historia ya mgawanyo wa kisiasa, makabila tofauti na mitazamo ya majirani ndiyo chanzo cha wingi huu wa majina kwa Ujerumani barani Ulaya.
claims_retained: Lugha mbalimbali za Ulaya hutumia majina tofautitofauti kwa Ujerumani kwa sababu kila jamii ilikutana na makabila au chimbuko tofauti kabla taifa la kisasa kuundwa mwaka 1871, hivyo ikaunda neno lake kulingana na uzoefu huo na miundo ya lugha zao [1].

Title: Kwa nini Ujerumani ina majina mengi? | SuperText-Magazin (blog.supertext.ch)
Content: Ujerumani iligawanywa kati ya Mashariki na Magharibi wakati wa Vita baridi, lakini hiyo ilikuwa mbali na mara ya kwanza taifa hilo kugawanywa katika maeneo. Ujerumani kama tunavyoijua leo haikuunda hadi karne ya 19, wakati Otto von Bismarck aliunganisha mikoa huru ya kisiasa na mila tofauti, majina na lahaja kwenye ufalme mnamo 1871.


Hii inamaanisha kuwa maneno mengi ya 'Ujerumani' yanatoka wakati Ujerumani haikuwepo kabisa. Badala yake, kulikuwa na kabila la 'Alemanni' katika sehemu inayozungumza Kijerumani ya Alsace na mkoa wa Baden-Württemberg uliopakana na Ufaransa, ambapo wanasema 'Allemagne'. Wakati huo huo, huko Estonia na Ufini, ambapo Ujerumani leo inajulikana kama Saksamaa na Saksa mtawaliwa, watu kwa ujumla walifikiria Saxons wakati wa kushughulika na Wajerumani.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why does Germany have so many names? | Supertext-Magazin (blog.supertext.ch)
Content: When the Roman Empire was taking over Europe, Germania was the Latin term used to describe the area inhabited by Germanic tribes. However, ‘German’ and ‘Germany’ only began to be used in English around the 1500s; before that, ‘Almain’, ‘Alman’ and ‘Dutch’ were used – which brings us to the next category.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Why does Germany have so many names? | Supertext-Magazin (blog.supertext.ch)
Content: Tyskland (Scandinavian languages like Danish and Swedish), Duitsland (Dutch) and, of course, Deutschland (German) were terms that likely developed from the Proto-Germanic þeudō or Þeudiskaz, which respectively mean ‘nation’ and ‘of the people’. Indeed, these are the variations used (or that used to be used) in Germanic languages themselves.


## Not our people


Slavic terms for Germany, like Niemcy (Polish) or Německo (Czech), have an altogether different origin. They come from the Proto-Slavic němьcь, which means ‘mute’. The word went on to be used to describe foreigners (i.e. people who couldn’t speak the local languages), who frequently turned out to be Germanic people.


## Who knows?


There’s no definitive answer for where the Baltic terms like Vācija (Latvian) and Vokietija (Lithuanian) come from. Some think they stem from the Proto-Indo-European word *wek (which means ‘to speak’), while others suggest that they could have developed from terms used for the Vikings.
---

Warumi waliita eneo hilo Germania, na Kiingereza kiliendelea na umbo “Germany” karibia miaka ya 1500 baada ya kutumia “Almain/Alman” kwa kabila la Alemanni—ndio maana Kifaransa husema “Allemagne” [2].
Lugha za Kijerumani kama Kijerumani (Deutschland), Kidenmaki (Tyskland) na Kiholanzi (Duitsland) zinatokana na proto-Germanic *þeudō/*þeudiskaz, “taifa” au “ya watu” [3].
Lugha za Slavic, mfano Kipolishi Niemcy na Kicheki Německo, zimetokana na proto-Slavic němьcь, “bubu,” neno lililotumika kuwataja wageni wasiozungumza lugha yao—mara nyingi Wajerumani [3].
Majina ya Kibaltiki kama Vācija (Kilatvia) na Vokietija (Kilithuania) hayana uhakika; dhana mojawapo yazihusisha na mzizi wa proto-Indo-European *wek “kuongea” au na majina ya Waviking [3].

Title: Why does Germany have so many names? | Supertext-Magazin (blog.supertext.ch)
Content: Germany was split between East and West during the Cold War, but that was far from the first time the nation was divided into territories. Germany as we know it today didn’t actually form until the 19th century, when Otto von Bismarck united politically independent regions with different customs, names and dialects into an empire in 1871.


This means that most terms for ‘Germany’ stem from a time when Germany didn’t really exist. Instead, there was the ‘Alemanni’ tribe in the German-speaking part of the Alsace and the Baden-Württemberg region bordering France, where they say ‘Allemagne’. Meanwhile, in Estonia and Finland, where Germany today is known as Saksamaa and Saksa respectively, people generally thought of Saxons when dealing with Germans.

Hakika, hizi ni tofauti zinazotumiwa (au ambazo zilitumika) katika lugha za Kijerumani zenyewe.


## Sio watu wetu


Masharti ya Slavic kwa Ujerumani, kama Niemcy (Kipolishi) au Německo (Czech), yana asili tofauti kabisa. Wanatoka kwa proto-slavic němьcь, ambayo inamaanisha 'bubu'. Neno hilo liliendelea kutumiwa kuelezea wageni (i.e. watu ambao hawakuweza kuzungumza lugha za kawaida), ambao mara nyingi waligeuka kuwa watu wa Kijerumani.


## Nani anajua?


Hakuna jibu dhahiri la wapi maneno ya Baltic kama Vācija (Latvian) na Vokietija (Kilithuania) yanatoka. Wengine wanafikiria wanatokana na neno la proto-indo-European *wek (ambayo inamaanisha 'kuongea'), wakati wengine wanapendekeza kwamba wangeweza kutoka kwa masharti yaliyotumiwa kwa Waviking.

question_src: Je! Chakula na vinywaji ambavyo vinatangazwa kama kalori 0 bado vinaweza kutekelezwa na kutumiwa kama nishati na mwili wako?
all_claims: Kalori ni kipimo cha nishati; bila kalori hata kidogo hakuna kinachoweza kuchangia moja kwa moja nishati ya mwili, lakini sheria huruhusu bidhaa zenye hadi kalori 5 kwa posho kutangazwa kama “kalori 0,” hivyo mara nyingi bado kuna kalori chache zinazoweza kutumika kama nishati [4].
Dhana kwamba mboga kama celery huunguza kalori zaidi kuliko zinavyotoa ni hadithi—hazibadilishi sana matumizi yako ya jumla ya nishati, wala haziwezi “kuudanganya” mwili kupunguza uzito [1].

Zaidi ya hapo, vinywaji na vyakula vya bandia visivyo na kalori, kama soda ya lishe, vinaweza kuvuruga udhibiti wa njaa, kuongeza uchochezi wa mfumo wa mmeng’enyo na hatimaye kuchochea ulaji mwingi au kuhifadhi mafuta, licha ya kuwa na kalori sifuri au chache sana wenyewe [3].

Kwa hiyo, “kalori 0” si sawa na kutokuwa na athari mwilini: vinaweza kutoa nishati kidogo inayoonekana kama sifuri kwenye lebo au kuathiri kimetaboliki na tabia ya kula, na hivyo vinaendelea “kutekelezwa” na mwili kwa njia moja au nyingine.

Title: The Truth About Zero-Calorie Drinks and Foods (www.yahoo.com)
Content: In fact, zero calorie foods cause us to gain weight in several ways, according to our crack researchers at Eat This, Not That! (who will continue to report out the story on EatThis.com):


* They dampen your natural fat burners. The body burns a lot of calories trying to turn a pat of butter into a pat of you. But highly processed foods—which is what most zero calorie foods are—come so highly processed that they’re basically digested for you, so they don’t keep the body’s natural fat-burners firing.


* They cause inflammation—and that causes weight gain. Introduce a bunch of chemicals into your digestive tract and you’re basically introducing an irritant. That can interfere with the body’s ability to absorb nutrients in food, and it calls the digestive system’s natural defenses into play, creating inflammation. Inflammation causes our fat genes to “turn on,” increasing belly fat. (Speaking of: To melt away your belly, check out the essential Daily Habits That Blast Belly Fat)


* They mess up our ability to regulate what we eat. Here’s why: When you swallow that diet soda, the sweet taste makes your body anticipate the arrival of calories. And when the calories don’t show up, your body gets confused, and triggers your hunger response, sending you looking high and low for those missing calories—and often finding them in a snack bowl.

Title: Jinsi ninavyolala katika nyumba ya kelele ya jiji | Kulala.Guide (kulala.Guide)

Document ID: 2
Title: How I Sleep in a Noisy City Apartment | Sleeping.Guide (sleeping.guide)
Content: White noise can help this. Let’s say that the car horn is a 70 decibel sound. If you’re lying in almost complete silence, maybe with a little wind outside, that’s around 20 decibels. That sudden 50 decibel jump is HUGE, and will totally spring you awake. Instead, if you have a white noise generator or are playing white noise from your speakers/laptop, this could be a nice, continuous sound at around 50 decibels (just about the level of normal conversation). Suddenly, that same 70 decibel car noise is only a 20 decibel jump. It’s much less noticeable, and so much less likely to shock you into being jolted awake.

Title: Best tips if you’re having trouble sleeping due to noise (www.ressleep.com.au)
Content: Reactions to sounds during sleep can be influenced by meaning and significance. Sounds indicating possible danger—even very quiet sounds, like the opening of a door—often will easily wake a sleeping person. Hearing their children cry usually causes parents to wake almost instantly. These responses to noise are highly individual, and a sign of how deeply engaged the brain remains to external stimuli during sleep.

Zaidi ya hayo, kuruka kutoka takriban desibeli 20 ya utulivu hadi mlio wa desibeli 70, kikiwa ni ongezeko la 50 dB, ni kubwa vya kutosha kutushtua, ilhali kuweka kelele endelevu ya karibu 50 dB (kelele nyeupe) hupunguza kuruka hilo na kufanya kulala kuwa rahisi zaidi [2].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How I Sleep in a Noisy City Apartment | Sleeping.Guide (sleeping.guide)
Content: Sleep is extremely important to our well-being. A good sleep means good health, ability to focus, and better happiness overall. However, it’s so easy for sleepiness to be ruined by a sudden high-pitched police alarm or the cheers of drunken revelers. The reason this is such an issue is that, unlike a constant noise, or brains just can’t get used to sudden volume spikes. Every sudden noise could be a danger, which leaves us permanently on alert and unable to relax. After all, sleep is when we’re most defenseless, so our brain really doesn’t want to ‘switch off’ when there’s what seems like potential danger.

Title: Jinsi ninavyolala katika nyumba ya kelele ya jiji | Kulala.Guide (kulala.Guide)
Content: Kelele nyeupe inaweza kusaidia hii. Acha tuseme kwamba pembe ya gari ni sauti ya decibel 70. Ikiwa umelala karibu ukimya kamili, labda na upepo mdogo nje, hiyo ni karibu decibels 20. Kuruka kwa ghafla kwa decibel 50 ni kubwa, na itakuamka kabisa. Badala yake, ikiwa una jenereta ya kelele nyeupe au unacheza kelele nyeupe kutoka kwa wasemaji/kompyuta yako, hii inaweza kuwa sauti nzuri, inayoendelea karibu na decibels 50 (karibu kiwango cha mazungumzo ya kawaida). Ghafla, kelele hiyo hiyo ya gari 70 ya Decibel ni kuruka tu 20. Haionekani sana, na ina uwezekano mdogo wa kukushtua kuwa macho.

Title: Best tips if you’re having trouble sleeping due to noise (www.ressleep.com.au)
Content: Reactions to sounds during sleep can be influenced by meaning and significance. Sounds indicating possible danger—even very quiet sounds, like the opening of a door—often will easily wake a sleeping person. Hearing their children cry usually causes parents to wake almost instantly. These responses to noise are highly individual, and a sign of how deeply engaged the brain remains to external stimuli during sleep.

all_claims: Katika sehemu ya kubadilishana ya hisa (futures) kwenye sinema “Trading Places”, ndugu wa Duke huingia kwenye sakafu ya New York Commodities Exchange wakinunua kwa fujo mikataba ya juisi ya machungwa kwa bei kubwa (“going long”) wakiamini, kutokana na ripoti bandia ya mazao waliyopokea, kwamba kutatokea uhaba na bei itapanda sana [1].

Wakati huo huo Louis Winthorpe na Billy Ray Valentine, wakijua kuwa mavuno ni ya kawaida na hakutakuwa na upungufu, wanauza mikataba hiyo hiyo waliyokopa (“short selling”) kwa bei hizo zilizochongoka, wakiahidi kusambaza juisi ambayo bado hawana [1].

Ripoti halisi inapochapishwa hadharani bei inaporomoka ghafla; wafanyabiashara wengine wanauza kwa hofu, na Winthorpe na Valentine hununua tena mikataba kwa senti chache ili kufunga nafasi zao, hivyo kutimiza ahadi zao za usafirishaji na kutengeneza faida ya “mamia ya mamilioni” ndani ya saa moja, huku Duke & Duke wakifilisika kwa kulazimika kulipa mikataba yao ya bei ya juu [2].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: What The Film Trading Places Can Teach Us About the Stock Market (www.canstar.com.au)
Content: The Duke brothers are attempting to go long on orange juice futures, while Louis and Billy Ray are implementing a short selling strategy. A long strategy is the traditional way of making money on the stock markets; buying low and selling high. A short strategy is the reverse, selling high and buying low.


The Dukes believe because of the fake crop report that there will be a shortage of orange juice, and the price will therefore skyrocket. So, by buying all the juice available now, when the shortage is revealed, everyone will have to buy it off of them at inflated prices. Louis and Billy Ray, on the other hand, know that there is plenty of juice available, and begin selling contracts at the high price the Dukes have created. Importantly, they are promising to deliver orange juice that they don’t actually own yet, but are planning to buy up the juice they need to deliver after the crop report is released.


Once the official report is made public, all the other traders are desperate to sell, in order to minimise their losses. In fact, they have already made a loss, but if they can sell the juice that they have bought, then they might be able to make back a little of their money. Because the other traders are frantically selling, Louis and Billy Ray can buy very cheaply all the orange juice they need in order to fulfil the contracts they have already made. If they weren’t able to buy the juice they needed, they would default on their promised deliveries, leaving them owing potentially millions of dollars. Short selling can be a profitable strategy, but it is also a risky one.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Kuuza kwa muda mfupi (uchunguzi wa kesi: sinema "maeneo ya biashara") (im-an-economist.blogspot.com)
Content: Kurudi kwenye sinema, swali ni jinsi gani iliwezekana kwa Winthorpe na Valentine kufanya mamia ya mamilioni katika saa moja kwenye sakafu ya biashara, wakati huo huo kufilisika Duke na Duke (eneo la mwisho)?


Jibu: Kuuza kwa muda mfupi. Na kwa kweli: habari iliyoingiliana ya ndani. Hii ndio kipande muhimu zaidi cha puzzle. Kuuza kwa muda mfupi tu kunaweza kuwa na ufanisi tu ikiwa unajua bei itashuka. Basi unaweza kumkasirisha kila mtu mwingine kwa urahisi.


Habari ya ndani ninayorejelea ni Dept ya Ripoti ya Mazao ya Kilimo kwa machungwa (wanauza bidhaa - juisi ya machungwa waliohifadhiwa). Dukes waliajiri wakala wao wa siri Bw Beeks kupata ripoti hiyo kabla ya mtu mwingine yeyote kuiona. Kwa bahati mbaya kwao, Winthorpe na Valentine wanapata mikono yao kwenye ripoti hiyo kabla ya Dukes kufanya na kuwalisha habari za uwongo. Dukes zinaongozwa kuamini kuwa hali ya hewa ilikuwa mbaya na kwa hivyo mavuno yalikuwa chini ya kawaida. Kwa hivyo Dukes wanatarajia bei kubwa (usambazaji wa chini + mahitaji ya juu = bei kubwa). Walakini ripoti halisi inaashiria kinyume - mavuno hayakuathiriwa na hali mbaya ya hewa, na usambazaji utakuwa mwingi. Kwa hivyo wigo wa uuzaji mfupi, kama Winthorpe na Valentine wanajua kuwa bei inaweza kushuka.

question_src: Je! Kwa nini Rais wa Merika anahitaji kuzaliwa nchini Merika kustahiki kukimbia?
all_claims: Masharti ya Kifungu II, Sehemu ya 1 ya Katiba yanamtaka rais awe “raia wa asili” ili kulinda ofisi hiyo dhidi ya ushawishi wa mataifa ya kigeni [1].

Wazo hilo liliongezwa nguvu na barua ya 25 Julai 1787 ambako Jaji Mkuu wa kwanza John Jay alimwomba George Washington kuweka “cheki kali kwa idhini ya wageni” na kuhakikisha amri ya jeshi haikabidhiwi mtu asiyezaliwa Marekani, akisisitiza hatari ya uaminifu wa nje [1].

Waandalizi pia waliogopa uwezekano wa mwana-nasaba wa Ulaya kutumia pesa na umaarufu wake kununua kura za Chuo cha Wapiga Kura na kuigeuza Marekani kijicho cha kifalme, hofu iliyoonekana hai kutokana na umaarufu wa mashujaa kama Marquis de Lafayette [2].
Walikumbuka mfano wa Poland ambako madola jirani yalimtumia mfalme “rafiki” kuigawa nchi, wakiona jinsi kiongozi asiye na mizizi ya ndani anavyoweza kudhoofisha taifa [2].
George Mason alionya pia kwamba taifa tajiri la kigeni lingeweza “kutoa rushwa kwa njia yao” katika ofisi za shirikisho ikiwa wageni wangeachiwa mlango wazi [3].

Content: Hapa kuna nyenzo za msingi za msingi zinazothibitisha mjadala wa katiba 1787 juu ya Kifungu cha II, Sehemu ya 1, ambayo ina "asili ya kuzaliwa". Na katika barua ya tarehe 25 Julai, 1787, John Jay, Jaji Mkuu wa Kwanza wa Mahakama Kuu, alimwandikia George Washington:


> Niruhusu nionyeshe, ikiwa haitakuwa busara na msimu wa kutoa cheki kali kwa idhini ya wageni katika usimamizi wa serikali yetu ya kitaifa; na kutangaza wazi kuwa amri kuu ya Jeshi la Amerika haitapewa, wala kujitolea, yeyote isipokuwa raia wa asili.

Document ID: 2
Title: Why must presidents be native-born? (slate.com)
Content: Though their concerns may now seem archaic, the framers were genuinely afraid of foreign subversion. Among their nightmare scenarios was the prospect of a European noble using his money and influence to sway the Electoral College, take command of the American army, and return the nascent nation to the royalist fold. At the time, several European figures—such as France’s Marquis de Lafayette, a hero of the Revolutionary War—were quite popular in the New World, so the idea wasn’t completely far-fetched.


The framers also took a lesson from Europe, where dynasties constantly schemed against one another. The men who drafted the Constitution were certainly familiar with the tragic example of Poland, where agents from Russia, Prussia, and Austria conspired to install a friendly monarch, Stanislaus II, and subsequently seized upon his weakness and partitioned the country among themselves. Keep in mind, too, that dynasties occasionally shuffled around Europe regardless of national origin; England’s King George I, for example, was a Hanoverian who spoke zero English.
---

Document ID: 2
Title: Why must presidents be native-born? (slate.com)
Content: Though their concerns may now seem archaic, the framers were genuinely afraid of foreign subversion. Among their nightmare scenarios was the prospect of a European noble using his money and influence to sway the Electoral College, take command of the American army, and return the nascent nation to the royalist fold. At the time, several European figures—such as France’s Marquis de Lafayette, a hero of the Revolutionary War—were quite popular in the New World, so the idea wasn’t completely far-fetched.


The framers also took a lesson from Europe, where dynasties constantly schemed against one another. The men who drafted the Constitution were certainly familiar with the tragic example of Poland, where agents from Russia, Prussia, and Austria conspired to install a friendly monarch, Stanislaus II, and subsequently seized upon his weakness and partitioned the country among themselves. Keep in mind, too, that dynasties occasionally shuffled around Europe regardless of national origin; England’s King George I, for example, was a Hanoverian who spoke zero English.

all_claims: Ugonjwa wa gari huonekana kuongezeka unapoinamisha kichwa kutazama kitabu au simu kwa sababu macho yako yanajikita kwenye kitu kisichosogea na kuona tu sehemu ya ndani ya gari, jambo linalomwambia ubongo kuwa mwili uko tuli [1].
Wakati huohuo masikio yako ya ndani, pamoja na misuli na viungo, yanahisi mitetemo, mabadiliko ya kasi na zamu za gari na kutuma ishara kuwa mwili unasogea [2].
Migongano hii ya taarifa—macho yakidai umetulia huku mfumo wa usawa ukidai unasafiri—husababisha ubongo “kuchanganyikiwa” na kuanzisha dalili kama kichefuchefu, kutapika na kizunguzungu [3].

Document ID: 2
Title: Motion Sickness: Symptoms & Treatment (my.clevelandclinic.org)
Content: What causes motion sickness?


Your brain receives signals from motion-sensing parts of your body: your eyes, inner ears, muscles and joints. When these parts send conflicting information, your brain doesn’t know whether you’re stationary or moving. Your brain’s confused reaction makes you feel sick.


For example, when riding in a car, your:


* Eyes see trees passing by and register movement.
* Inner ears sense movement.
* Muscles and joints sense that your body is sitting still.
* Brain senses a disconnect among these messages.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How to Avoid Nausea when Reading in the Car (www.wikihow.com)
Content: Sometimes it’s really hard to put down a good book, even in the car. The problem is that when you are reading, your eyes are signaling to your brain that you are stationary. This conflicts with the signals from your inner ears, muscles, and joints which feel the vibrations of the car.[1] This results in carsickness which can involve nausea, vomiting, dizziness, sweating, salivation, shallow breathing, headaches, and sleepiness.

Title: Should You Not Drink Ice Cold Water After Exercise? | Livestrong.com (www.livestrong.com)
Content: What about water temperature? In a May 2018 analysis published by the Gatorade Sports Science Institute, the researchers affirmed that drinking cold drinks before exercise, as opposed to during exercise, is more effective at lowering body temperature.


That might help you work out for longer without overheating, especially in hot or humid conditions. But the effect is limited. Drinking too many cold fluids will cause your body to reflexively shiver, which warms you back up again.


The same authors also note that drinking cold water during exercise may help lower your core temperature and reduce fluid lost through sweating. They speculate that drinking cold water after you work out may be particularly effective for helping to lower body temperature. What little clinical research there is on this topic seems to bear that conclusion out, but further study is needed.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Should You Not Drink Ice Cold Water After Exercise? | Livestrong.com (www.livestrong.com)
Content: What about water temperature? In a May 2018 analysis published by the Gatorade Sports Science Institute, the researchers affirmed that drinking cold drinks before exercise, as opposed to during exercise, is more effective at lowering body temperature.


That might help you work out for longer without overheating, especially in hot or humid conditions. But the effect is limited. Drinking too many cold fluids will cause your body to reflexively shiver, which warms you back up again.


The same authors also note that drinking cold water during exercise may help lower your core temperature and reduce fluid lost through sweating. They speculate that drinking cold water after you work out may be particularly effective for helping to lower body temperature. What little clinical research there is on this topic seems to bear that conclusion out, but further study is needed.

Title: The Science of Leftovers: Why Don't They Taste As Good? (gizmodo.com)
Content: But the chemicals work some delicious magic, too. The flavor called umami, which you may know if you've watched enough Top Chef, is used to describe a food's savory flavor. And sometimes when food ages, this umami flavor will appear. It happens because, over time, proteins in food break down into amino acid chunks, and those chunks taste good. "We're hardwired to associate their presence with healthfulness," says Loss.

Document ID: 4
Title: Is it safe to reheat leftover rice? (www.veg-world.com)
Content: Raw rice contains traces of a bacterium known as Bacillus cereus. Unfortunately, this bacterium survives cooking, especially if the rice is cooked at or below 212°F (100°C) - as is the case if the rice is boiled in water. If the rice is then slowly cooled and stored at room temperature, the bacterium germinates, and might produce enterotoxins which in turn cause food poisoning. These remain in the rice, even after it's been reheated.

Content: When fries are cooked at a very high temperature, the starches in them are hydrated (moisture goes in), puffing them up and helping the outer skin get nice and crisp. When these same fries cool, the starches secrete moisture, which makes its way to the fries’ crust, leaving them soggy and limp.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: The Science of Leftovers: Why Don't They Taste As Good? (gizmodo.com)
Content: But the chemicals work some delicious magic, too. The flavor called umami, which you may know if you've watched enough Top Chef, is used to describe a food's savory flavor. And sometimes when food ages, this umami flavor will appear. It happens because, over time, proteins in food break down into amino acid chunks, and those chunks taste good. "We're hardwired to associate their presence with healthfulness," says Loss.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Is it safe to reheat leftover rice? (www.veg-world.com)
Content: Raw rice contains traces of a bacterium known as Bacillus cereus. Unfortunately, this bacterium survives cooking, especially if the rice is cooked at or below 212°F (100°C) - as is the case if the rice is boiled in water. If the rice is then slowly cooled and stored at room temperature, the bacterium germinates, and might produce enterotoxins which in turn cause food poisoning. These remain in the rice, even after it's been reheated.

Title: What does it mean when cats eat their poop? – joewongcomedy.com (www.joewongcomedy.com)
Content: Coprophagia is the eating and ingesting of feces. Also, their butts are fairly clean anyway, because of the way they expel feces, there isn’t normally any dirt remaining a the exit hole. Cats lick their own – and their buddies’ – butts.

Document ID: 4
Title: Why Dogs Eat Poop and How to Stop It – American Kennel Club (www.akc.org)
Content: For some species, such as rabbits, eating fecal droppings is a totally normal way of obtaining key nutrients. In fact, if you prevent rabbits from doing this, they will develop health problems, and young ones will fail to thrive. Fortunately, dogs do not need to get nutrition this way. It is, however, a normal, natural behavior at some canine life stages. Mother dogs will lick their puppies to urge them to eliminate, and clean up their feces by eating it, for about the first three weeks after birth. Puppies will also naturally engage in this behavior, eating both their own poop (autocoprophagia), poop from other dogs (allocoprophagia), as well as poop from cats and other animals. Some dogs find horse manure and goose droppings particularly appealing. Eating their own poop is harmless, but consuming poop from other animals may cause health problems if the stool is contaminated with parasites, viruses, or toxins. In most cases, this behavior will fade before the puppy is about nine months old.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: What happens if you eat poop? Effects, in children, and more (www.medicalnewstoday.com)
Content: A person who ingests human or animal feces may be at risk of contracting a number of viruses, bacteria, or parasites.


Parasites are tiny organisms that can live in the intestines of humans and animals. If a person ingests feces from someone who has a parasite, they themselves can contract the infection. Parasites such as Cryptosporidium and Giardia can cause symptoms including diarrhea and dehydration.


A doctor may prescribe medication to get rid of parasites.


Hepatitis A is a liver disease that can transmit to a person if they ingest contaminated feces.

claim: Acetaminophen (Tylenol) hupunguza maumivu na homa lakini haiathiri uvimbe, na ina uwezekano mdogo wa kusababisha matatizo ya tumbo kuliko dawa nyingi nyingine za OTC
question_src: Ikiwa ninahitaji unafuu wa maumivu, nije kujua kama kuchagua kati ya aspirini, Tylenol, Advil, nk? Zote zinaitwa kama kupunguza maumivu.
all_claims: Chaguo lako la dawa ya maumivu linategemea aina ya dalili na hatari zako.
Acetaminophen (Tylenol) hupunguza maumivu na homa lakini haiathiri uvimbe, na ina uwezekano mdogo wa kusababisha matatizo ya tumbo kuliko dawa nyingi nyingine za OTC [1].
Ibuprofen (Advil) ni NSAID inayopunguza homa, maumivu na uvimbe, na ni bora kwa maumivu ya hedhi, kichwa, meno, mgongo, misuli na gout [2].
Naproxen (Aleve) pia ni NSAID na hutoa unafuu sawa na ibuprofen kwa maumivu ya hedhi, mgongo, homa, kichwa, meno na arthritis [3].
Aspirini ni NSAID ya muda mrefu inayotumika kwa maumivu ya kichwa, meno na homa [4].
Kwa hivyo, ikiwa maumivu yako yanahusisha uvimbe (k.v.
arthritis, maumivu ya misuli), chagua ibuprofen, naproxen au aspirini; ikiwa hutaki athari nyingi za tumbo au unahitaji tu kupunguza homa/maumivu yasiyo na uvimbe, acetaminophen ni salama zaidi.

Kila dawa ina hatari zake (kama vidonda vya tumbo, shinikizo la damu au uharibifu wa ini), kwa hivyo fuata kipimo sahihi na wasiliana na mtoa huduma wako wa afya ikiwa una magonjwa sugu au unatumia dawa nyingine za damu.

Content: ## Acetaminophen


Aina hii ya dawa inafanya kazi kwenye sehemu za ubongo wako ambazo hupokea ujumbe wa maumivu na kudhibiti joto la mwili wako. Inaweza kupunguza maumivu na kupunguza homa, lakini haitapunguza uvimbe wowote na uchochezi.


Inaweza kuwa chaguo nzuri kutibu maumivu ya kichwa, maumivu ya arthritis, au homa.


Bonasi: Acetaminophen ina uwezekano mdogo wa kusababisha maswala ya tumbo kuliko unywaji mwingine wa maumivu ya OTC.

Document ID: 2
Title: Which OTC Pain Reliever Is the Right Choice for You? (www.webmd.com)
Content: ## Ibuprofen


This medication is a type of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that reduces fevers, pain, and inflammation. NSAIDs work by lowering the amount of hormone-like substances called prostaglandins. Those cause the feeling of pain by irritating your nerve endings. So if you have less, you'll feel better.


Ibuprofen may be a good choice for treating menstrual cramps, headaches, toothaches, backaches, arthritis, muscle strains, and gout.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Which OTC Pain Reliever Is the Right Choice for You? (www.webmd.com)
Content: ## Naproxen


This is another NSAID that helps with pain. It works similarly to ibuprofen, and it relieves inflammation and fevers as well.


It may be a good choice for treating menstrual cramps, backaches, colds, headaches, toothaches, and arthritis.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Which OTC Pain Reliever Is the Right Choice for You? (www.webmd.com)
Content: ## Aspirin


Its pain-relieving origins go back over 2,000 years. But the aspirin you might have in your medicine cabinet today has come a long way. It belongs in the NSAID class of meds.


It may be a good choice for treating headaches, toothaches, colds, and fever.

question_src: Ikiwa ninahitaji unafuu wa maumivu, nije kujua kama kuchagua kati ya aspirini, Tylenol, Advil, nk? Zote zinaitwa kama kupunguza maumivu.
all_claims: Chaguo lako la dawa ya maumivu linategemea aina ya dalili na hatari zako.
Acetaminophen (Tylenol) hupunguza maumivu na homa lakini haiathiri uvimbe, na ina uwezekano mdogo wa kusababisha matatizo ya tumbo kuliko dawa nyingi nyingine za OTC [1].
Ibuprofen (Advil) ni NSAID inayopunguza homa, maumivu na uvimbe, na ni bora kwa maumivu ya hedhi, kichwa, meno, mgongo, misuli na gout [2].
Naproxen (Aleve) pia ni NSAID na hutoa unafuu sawa na ibuprofen kwa maumivu ya hedhi, mgongo, homa, kichwa, meno na arthritis [3].
Aspirini ni NSAID ya muda mrefu inayotumika kwa maumivu ya kichwa, meno na homa [4].
Kwa hivyo, ikiwa maumivu yako yanahusisha uvimbe (k.v.
arthritis, maumivu ya misuli), chagua ibuprofen, naproxen au aspirini; ikiwa hutaki athari nyingi za tumbo au unahitaji tu kupunguza homa/maumivu yasiyo na uvimbe, acetaminophen ni salama zaidi.

Kila dawa ina hatari zake (kama vidonda vya tumbo, shinikizo la damu au uharibifu wa ini), kwa hivyo fuata kipimo sahihi na wasiliana na mtoa huduma wako wa afya ikiwa una magonjwa sugu au unatumia dawa nyingine za damu.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Which OTC Pain Reliever Is the Right Choice for You? (www.webmd.com)
Content: ## Acetaminophen


This type of medication works on the parts of your brain that receive pain messages and control your body temperature. It can ease pain and lower a fever, but it won’t reduce any swelling and inflammation.


It may be a good choice to treat a headache, arthritis pain, or a fever.


Bonus:Acetaminophen is less likely to cause stomach issues than other OTC pain-relievers.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Which OTC Pain Reliever Is the Right Choice for You? (www.webmd.com)
Content: ## Ibuprofen


This medication is a type of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that reduces fevers, pain, and inflammation. NSAIDs work by lowering the amount of hormone-like substances called prostaglandins. Those cause the feeling of pain by irritating your nerve endings. So if you have less, you'll feel better.


Ibuprofen may be a good choice for treating menstrual cramps, headaches, toothaches, backaches, arthritis, muscle strains, and gout.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Je! Ni chaguo gani cha maumivu ya OTC ndio chaguo sahihi kwako? (www.webmd.com)
Content: ## Naproxen


Hii ni NSAID nyingine ambayo husaidia na maumivu. Inafanya kazi vivyo hivyo kwa Ibuprofen, na inapunguza uchochezi na fevers pia.


Inaweza kuwa chaguo nzuri kwa kutibu tumbo la hedhi, maumivu ya nyuma, homa, maumivu ya kichwa, maumivu ya meno, na ugonjwa wa arthritis.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Which OTC Pain Reliever Is the Right Choice for You? (www.webmd.com)
Content: ## Aspirin


Its pain-relieving origins go back over 2,000 years. But the aspirin you might have in your medicine cabinet today has come a long way. It belongs in the NSAID class of meds.


It may be a good choice for treating headaches, toothaches, colds, and fever.

Response: Aspirini ni NSAID ya muda mrefu inayotumika kwa maumivu ya kichwa, meno na homa [

claim: Sayari zilianza kama makundi ya vumbi na gesi ambayo yalipokua yalipata kizio chao cha mvuto wenyewe
question_src: Kwa nini kuna sayari za mviringo tu? Kwa nini hakuwezi kuwa na mraba au mstatili?
all_claims: Sayari zilianza kama makundi ya vumbi na gesi ambayo yalipokua yalipata kizio chao cha mvuto wenyewe [1].

Mvuto huo huvuta nyenzo kwa usawa kutoka kila upande kuelekea kitovu, na kwa sababu sayari changa zilikuwa zimeyeyuka kama vimiminika, muundo pekee unaoruhusu kila chembe kuwa karibu zaidi na kituo ni duara kamili—mchakato uitwao “marekebisho ya isostatic” [1].

Ili sayari idumu kama mstatili au mraba, nguvu ya kimuundo ya miamba ingebidi ishinde mvuto katika pembe na kingo zake, jambo lisilowezekana kwa miili mikubwa ambako mvuto hushinda uimara wa kimaunzi [4].

Miili midogo kama asteroidi yenye kipenyo cha takriban kilomita 20 haina mvuto wa kutosha kuvunja miamba yake, hivyo hubaki na maumbo yasiyo ya duara—lakini ikifikia ukubwa wa sayari, hali hii haitoshi tena [4].
Hata hivyo, sayari si nyanja timilifu; mzunguko wao huwasukuma kidogo kwenye ikweta na kuwafanya kuwa “spheroid” iliyopanuka, kadiri kasi ya mzunguko inavyoongezeka [2].
Ndiyo maana tunaona sayari zilizojongeka kidogo lakini hakuna “sayari za mraba.”.

Hata hivyo, sayari si nyanja timilifu; mzunguko wao huwasukuma kidogo kwenye ikweta na kuwafanya kuwa “spheroid” iliyopanuka, kadiri kasi ya mzunguko inavyoongezeka [2].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Kwa nini nyanja zote za sayari ni? (www.wonderopolis.org)
Content: Sura ya spherical ya sayari zote zinaweza kuelezewa na nguvu moja ambayo sisi sote tunajua: mvuto. Wakati sayari katika mfumo wetu wa jua zilipoanza kuunda, nafasi ilijazwa na mabilioni na mabilioni ya vipande vya vumbi na gesi.


Wakati vipande hivi vilipoingia kila mmoja, walianza kuunda clumps ambazo polepole zilikua kubwa na kubwa. Mwishowe clumps hizi za nyenzo zilikua kubwa ya kutosha kukuza uwanja wao wa mvuto.


Wakati sayari za kutengeneza zikiendelea kukua, nguvu ya mgongano na jambo la ziada ilisababisha kuwa moto na kuyeyushwa, ikifanya kama kioevu. Nguvu ya mvuto ya kila sayari imejikita katika msingi wake. Inavuta kwa usawa katika kila mwelekeo kutoka kwa msingi, na hivyo kuvuta nyenzo zote kuyeyuka kuwa sura ya spherical. Wanasayansi huita mchakato huu "marekebisho ya isostatic."
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Are Planets Almost Spherical? (science.howstuffworks.com)
Content: "But gravity is not the whole story," says Carpenter. While gravity conspires to render the planets spherical, the speed of their rotations is simultaneously trying to flatten them. The faster a celestial body spins, the more disproportionate its equatorial bulge gets. "This is why there are no perfect spheres in our solar system ... only oblate spheroids," Carpenter tells us. "The sun is almost a perfect sphere, due to its immense gravity and relatively slow rotation rate of 25 days. A significant percentage of stars in the sky rotate much faster and bulge noticeably at their equators."
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Why are planets always shown as spheres? Why can't they be cubes or prisms? | Notes and Queries (www.theguardian.com)
Content: * Planets aren't perfect spheres - because they are spinning they get pulled out slightly around their equator making them a bit "fatter" so they are in fact oval.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Why are planets round? (www.scientificamerican.com)
Content: Derek Sears, professor of cosmochemistry at the University of Arkansas, explains.


Planets are round because their gravitational field acts as though it originates from the center of the body and pulls everything toward it. With its large body and internal heating from radioactive elements, a planet behaves like a fluid, and over long periods of time succumbs to the gravitational pull from its center of gravity. The only way to get all the mass as close to planet's center of gravity as possible is to form a sphere. The technical name for this process is "isostatic adjustment."


With much smaller bodies, such as the 20-kilometer asteroids we have seen in recent spacecraft images, the gravitational pull is too weak to overcome the asteroid's mechanical strength. As a result, these bodies do not form spheres. Rather they maintain irregular, fragmentary shapes.

Document ID: 4
Title: Why are planets round? (www.scientificamerican.com)
Content: Derek Sears, professor of cosmochemistry at the University of Arkansas, explains.


Planets are round because their gravitational field acts as though it originates from the center of the body and pulls everything toward it. With its large body and internal heating from radioactive elements, a planet behaves like a fluid, and over long periods of time succumbs to the gravitational pull from its center of gravity. The only way to get all the mass as close to planet's center of gravity as possible is to form a sphere. The technical name for this process is "isostatic adjustment."


With much smaller bodies, such as the 20-kilometer asteroids we have seen in recent spacecraft images, the gravitational pull is too weak to overcome the asteroid's mechanical strength. As a result, these bodies do not form spheres. Rather they maintain irregular, fragmentary shapes.

Title: An estimated 90% of adults in the US have fillings — here's why we can't just regrow our teeth (www.businessinsider.com)
Content: Only a handful of mammals can regrow teeth multiple times, compared to the 50,000 species of reptiles and fish. Take geckos, for example, who will replace all 100 teeth, or so, every 3 to 4 months. And since geckos can live for 6 to 10 years, they'll grow anywhere from 1,800 to 4,000 teeth in a lifetime! It's all thanks to a special type of cell in their gums, called stem cells.


Stem cells are handy because they can morph into different cells when needed. Like tooth stem cells to build new teeth. Humans have these stem cells when we're younger. But after our adult teeth grow in, the stem cells die and disappear.

Title: What Are The 4 Types of Teeth and Why Do We Have Them? (www.tandaradental.com.au)
Content: As humans, we have 2 sets of teeth. We develop a set of baby teeth from as early as a tiny embryo inside the womb. Baby teeth help shape the way our jaw grows, chew food properly and help us learn to speak our first words.


Most children will start with 20 primary baby teeth, 10 on the top and 10 on the bottom. These teeth are eventually replaced with 32 permanent adult teeth, 16 on each upper and lower jaw, as we grow older and our jaws start to develop.
