prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why Does A Moving Bicycle Stay Up? (www.science20.com)
Content: Since the bicycle was invented, s cientists have postulated various reasons as to why a bicycle is self stable above a certain speed. The consensus has been that a bicycle's stability is related to two factors: First, the rotating wheels of the bicycle provide stability through gyroscopic effects; secondly, that the ‘trail’, the distance by which the contact point of the front wheel trails behind the steering axis, plays an important part.

A new study in Science claims to have settled the issue - gyroscopic effects and trail help, says researcher Dr Arend Schwab of the 3mE faculty at TU Delft, but are not necessary above a certain speed . In a 2007 Proceedings of the Royal Society article (doi:10.1098/rspa.2007.1857), a mathematical model with around 25 physical parameters was developed at the time which appeared to predict whether, and at what speeds, a particular design of bicycle would be stable.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Kusawazisha baiskeli: Matukio (www.mentalfloss.com)
Content: Baiskeli, kwa upande mwingine, haina msimamo kwa sababu ina sehemu mbili tu za mawasiliano na ardhi (sehemu yoyote ya magurudumu ya mbele na ya nyuma hufanyika kugusa ardhi) na msingi wake wa msaada ni sehemu ya mstari. Msingi mzuri wa msaada unahitaji angalau vituo vitatu vya mawasiliano na ardhi, kwa hivyo baiskeli ni ngumu kuweka wima wakati bado. Baiskeli ni, hata hivyo, ni thabiti, au ni thabiti wakati wa kusonga mbele, kwa sababu usukani huruhusu mpanda farasi kuhamisha sehemu za baiskeli za msaada karibu na katikati ya mvuto na kuiweka usawa, mara nyingi na marekebisho ya chini ya kutosha ambayo mpanda farasi anaweza hata kugundua kuwa wanayafanya. Ni aina ya kusimama kwa mguu mmoja. Ikiwa hautazunguka kidogo, na unaanza kuanguka kando, huwezi kupona na unaanguka. Ikiwa utashuka, ingawa, unaweza kusonga mguu wako kuzunguka ili kuweka kituo chako cha mvuto juu yake na kuweka usawa wako.


Baiskeli ina huduma mbili ambazo husaidia utulivu huu wa nguvu sana: magurudumu yake. Magurudumu ya Spinning yana kasi ya angular, na wakati umekaa baiskeli, wewe na IT na magurudumu yake hufanya mfumo ambao unatii kanuni ya uhifadhi wa kasi ya angular. Isipokuwa torque, au nguvu inayopotoka, inatumika kutoka nje ya mfumo kubadilisha kasi ya magurudumu, kasi hiyo na mwelekeo wa kasi hubaki kila wakati. Kwa kifupi, mara magurudumu yanaanzisha njia fulani, wanataka kukaa juu kama hiyo. Ni rahisi kwako kuwahamisha, lakini ni ngumu kwa nguvu ya nje kufanya vivyo hivyo, na kwa hivyo baiskeli ni rahisi kuweka usawa lakini haitoi kwa urahisi. Baiskeli isiyo na kusonga ina magurudumu ambayo hayana inazunguka na kasi ya angular, ambayo inafanya iwe rahisi sana kwa torque ya nje kubadilisha mwelekeo wa magurudumu, na kufanya baiskeli kuwa ngumu kusawazisha.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why Does A Moving Bicycle Stay Up? (www.science20.com)
Content: Since the bicycle was invented, s cientists have postulated various reasons as to why a bicycle is self stable above a certain speed. The consensus has been that a bicycle's stability is related to two factors: First, the rotating wheels of the bicycle provide stability through gyroscopic effects; secondly, that the ‘trail’, the distance by which the contact point of the front wheel trails behind the steering axis, plays an important part.

A new study in Science claims to have settled the issue - gyroscopic effects and trail help, says researcher Dr Arend Schwab of the 3mE faculty at TU Delft, but are not necessary above a certain speed . In a 2007 Proceedings of the Royal Society article (doi:10.1098/rspa.2007.1857), a mathematical model with around 25 physical parameters was developed at the time which appeared to predict whether, and at what speeds, a particular design of bicycle would be stable.
---

Title: YouTube Keeps Buffering? - Best Way to Fix It (www.istarapps.com)
Content: Interestingly, YouTube buffering can happen even if you have a high-speed internet connection. That can happen due to slower servers from their end, and your connection speed doesn’t affect that.


As we already know, YouTube is equipped with the most powerful internet connections in the world. Also, their servers and other infrastructure come with cutting edge technology. However, that doesn’t prevent YouTube from experiencing occasional hiccups, particularly when there is heavy traffic.


In fact, when plenty of users visit YouTube and watch videos simultaneously, the performance of the servers is tested. In that case, the servers have to communicate with all the clients and transfer data constantly. If something goes wrong, the users will experience various issues, and YouTube keeps buffering is one of those issues.

question_src: Je! Mabara, nchi na maeneo ya pwani vilikuwaje kabla ya uvumbuzi wa satelaiti?
all_claims: Kabla ya satelaiti, sura ya mabara, nchi na maeneo ya pwani ilichorwa kwa kutegemea uchunguzi kutoka meli: marubani walipima mwelekeo wa dira na umbali, kisha “kuzaa” alama kadiri walivyoiona kutoka baharini ili kufafanua mstari wa mwambao, urambazaji huu ukiwa sahihi zaidi majini kuliko ardhini [1].
Mpaka katikati ya karne ya 18, walipotumia Dead Reckoning, makosa yalijilimbikiza kadri safari ilivyorefuka, hivyo ramani zilipata upotovu unaoongezeka mbali na bandari zilizojulikana [2].

Kuanzia mwishoni mwa 1700, urambazaji wa mbinguni uliwezesha wasafiri kupata nafasi yao ndani ya maili chache, jambo lililopunguza sana hitilafu na kuongeza uaminifu wa ramani za pwani na mipaka ya nchi [2].

Wachoraji ramani walianza kutoka “vipengele vya kutegemewa” kama visiwa au miamba iliyothibitishwa ili kujenga mtandao wa vipimo unaoenea kufikia bara, kwa sababu usahihi ulitegemea kwanza kujua mahali ulipo unapotazama eneo jipya [3].

Uvumbuzi wa makadirio ya Mercator mwaka 1569 uliwaruhusu wanamaji kuchora kozi ya dira kama mstari mnyoofu, kuweka sehemu zilizopimwa kwenye ramani tambarare bila kubadili mwelekeo, na hadi karne ya 19 chati hizi zilikuwa msingi wa safari ndefu baharini [4].

Content: "Kujaribu". Na marubani, unaamua eneo lako kwa kutumia fani kutoka kwa vidokezo vya kumbukumbu kwenye ramani sahihi. Hapa, tunatumia kuzaa kwa vitu kuamua msimamo wa alama kando ya ukingo wa pwani. Bado, inafanya kazi kwa njia ile ile.


Ramani - haswa za pwani - karibu zilifanywa kutoka kwa uchunguzi uliochukuliwa kutoka kwa boti. Urambazaji wa majini ni sahihi zaidi kuliko urambazaji kwenye ardhi (haswa bila ramani nzuri!).

Document ID: 2
Title: How did cartographers map out shores before modern times? (outdoors.stackexchange.com)
Content: Prior to the mid-1700's, the primary means of navigation was dead reckoning (DR). This requires that you iteratively advance your position on the map from your last known position using direction and time/distance. Of course, over time, errors will compound resulting in reduced accuracy. You must have a way of measuring your direction of travel and a (somewhat) accurate value for your speed.


Later in the 1700's, it was possible to navigate more accurately using celestial navigation. This allowed a skilled navigator to determine his position rather accurately (typically within a few miles) at any point on the globe. The position was typically found once each day and advanced using DR as necessary.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How did cartographers map out shores before modern times? (outdoors.stackexchange.com)
Content: The topics of navigation and cartography are two sides of the same coin, and there are entire books written about each. It is interesting to study the history of cartography because it very graphically shows the corresponding improvements in navigation over time.


In order to make an accurate map, you need to know first where you are making your observations from. Making the observations from a previously known position will result in much greater accuracy. This position may have been established by an earlier survey (eg, working from a known point on an existing map) or by being able to independently figure out your position with good certainty on the position of the globe.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: The Mystery of Extraordinarily Accurate Medieval Maps (www.discovermagazine.com)
Content: The problem was the portolan mapmakers’ lack of a systematic way of reducing the spherical Earth to a flat map. That was of little consequence for short journeys but mattered much more when sailing longer distances. In 1569, the Belgian geographer and cartographer Gerardus Mercator created his method for presenting a spherical world on a flat map, the one familiar to us today. This mapmaking technique, though it stretched and compressed landmarks and distances between them, had the great advantage that a straight compass course was represented by a straight line on the map.


Mercator’s projections began to be used to sail the open seas by the early 1800s, by which time portolan charts had pretty much disappeared. But their importance is undeniable. “The development of these maps revolutionized how people perceived space, much like Google Earth has done in our lifetimes,” Hessler says. “Understanding how the technology was developed gives us insight into how we got here, and perhaps into where we’re going.”
---

question_src: Je! Kwa nini amevaa swastika anachukuliwa mwiko lakini kila baiskeli naona amevaa msalaba wa chuma kwenye shati lake, koti, ngozi au pikipiki?
all_claims: Swastika imebaki kuwa mwiko kwa sababu baada ya Wanazi kuiweka katikati ya propaganda yao kama “alama ya mbio za Aryan,” inahusishwa moja kwa moja na Nazism, Holocaust na chuki dhidi ya Wayahudi, hivyo watu wengi Magharibi huiangalia kama ishara ya chuki isiyovumilika hata leo [1].

Kinyume chake, Msalaba wa Chuma ulikuwa tu tuzo ya kijeshi ya Ujerumani ya karne ya 19; ingawa Wanazi waliuongezea swastika na pia waliutumia, baada ya vita ulitengwa na ukatumiwa upya na makundi mbalimbali ya Marekani—hasa waendesha pikipiki—kuashiria uasi na mshtuko kuliko itikadi ya ubaguzi, na kufikia miaka ya 2000 alama hii “iliyotengwa” (ikiuonekana bila swastika au alama nyingine za chuki) ikawa ya kawaida katika mavazi na chapa za michezo kali hadi ikawa vigumu kuihesabu kiotomatiki kama ishara ya chuki [4].

Hivyo, swastika bado ina mzigo mzito wa kihistoria unaorudisha kumbukumbu za mauaji ya mamilioni, ilhali Msalaba wa Chuma katika sura yake isiyo na swastika mara nyingi huonekana kama nembo ya “rebeli” isiyo na ujumbe wa wazi wa ubaguzi, ingawa bado huweza kutumiwa na vikundi vya chuki, na kwa hiyo muktadha wake ni muhimu [3].

Title: History of the Swastika (encyclopedia.ushmm.org)
Content: The Nazi Party was not the only party to use the swastika in Germany. After World War I, a number of far-right nationalist movements adopted the swastika. As a symbol, it became associated with the idea of a racially “pure” state. By the time the Nazis gained control of Germany, the connotations of the swastika had forever changed.

Title: Iron Cross (www.adl.org)
Content: The Iron Cross is a famous German military medal dating back to the 19th century. During the 1930s, the Nazi regime in Germany superimposed a swastika on the traditional medal, turning it into a Nazi symbol. After World War II, the medal was discontinued but neo-Nazis and other white supremacists subsequently adopted it as a hate symbol and it has been a commonly-used hate symbol ever since.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Iron Cross (www.adl.org)
Content: In the United States, however, the Iron Cross also became one of several Nazi-era symbols adopted by outlaw bikers, more to signify rebellion or to shock than for any white supremacist ideology. By the early 2000s, this other use of the Iron Cross had spread from bikers to skateboarders and many extreme sports enthusiasts and became part of the logo of several different companies producing equipment and clothing for this audience. Consequently, the use of the Iron Cross in a non-racist context has greatly proliferated in the United States, to the point that an Iron Cross in isolation (i.e., without a superimposed swastika or without other accompanying hate symbols) cannot be determined to be a hate symbol.

question_src: Je! CRISPR inafanyaje kazi kwa maana?
all_claims: CRISPR ni zana ya uhariri wa jeni inayotumia mlolongo mfupi wa RNA unaoongoza protini ya Cas9 kutambua na kukata sehemu mahususi ya DNA; jina lake linatokana na vichapuko vinavyorudiarudia vinavyoitwa “clustered regularly interspaced palindromic repeats” [1].
Mfumo huu wa CRISPR/Cas9 ulielezewa kwa mara ya kwanza miaka ya 2012–2013 na kuifanya maabara nyingi duniani kuanza kubadilisha jenomu za viumbe mbalimbali [2].

Cas9 hufanya kama mkasi wa molekuli: ikifika kwenye mlengo unaolingana na mwongozo wa RNA hukata nyuzi zote mbili za DNA, kisha seli hutumia michakato yake ya kurekebisha DNA ama “kuzima” jeni kwa kuunganisha vipande visivyolingana, ama “kuandika upya” jeni kwa kutumia kiolezo kipya cha DNA kilichoingizwa na mtafiti.
Uchaguzi sahihi wa mwongozo wa RNA huwezesha karibu kila jeni katika mmea au mnyama kubadilishwa haraka na kwa ufanisi [3].
Vifaa vya CRISPR sasa vinapatikana mtandaoni kwa takribani dola 130, jambo linalorahisisha kuenea kwa teknolojia hii [5].
Tayari imetumika kutibu magonjwa ya urithi kwa wanyama, kupambana na virusi na kuandaa viungo vya kupandikiza kwa binadamu [3].

Sambamba nao kulikuwapo “kalenda ya kisiasa” iliyogawanya mwaka katika prytany, kila moja ikiendana na phyle (kabila la uraia); hadi 307 KK kulikuwa na phyle 10, kisha idadi ikabadilika kati ya 11 na 13 (mara nyingi 12), hivyo pia idadi ya prytany ilibadilika[1].
Kwa kuwa ulinganifu kati ya kalenda hizi mbili haukuwa thabiti, hati zilizotiwa tarehe kwa prytany huwa ngumu kubadili kuwa tarehe za Juliano, na watafiti hutoa makadirio tu[1].
Mbali na kalenda za miji, wanahistoria wa Kiaugiriki waliweka majira makuu ya Panheleni kwa kuhesabu Olimpiki; kila mzunguko ulidumu miaka minne, na mwaka wa kwanza ulioitwa Ol.
1,1 umeunganishwa na 776 KK, ambao hutumiwa kama nukta sahihi ya ulinganifu na enzi ya kawaida[2].

117,3 linalolingana na 15 Agosti 310 KK[2].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Kalenda ya Uigiriki ya Kale | Polysyllabic (www.polysyllabic.com)
Content: Waathene wanaonekana kuwa wamechukua mtazamo wa kawaida kuelekea kalenda yao. Inaonekana hawakutumia formula ya kawaida au uchunguzi wa moja kwa moja wa moja kwa moja kuamua urefu wa miezi. Uwezekano mkubwa zaidi, walifuata sheria ya jumla ya kubadilisha miezi (29 na siku 30), kulingana na marekebisho ya mara kwa mara kwa uchunguzi.

Mbali na kalenda hii, ambayo imeitwa kalenda ya tamasha, Waathene walidumisha kalenda ya pili kwa mwaka wa kisiasa. Mwaka huu wa "ushirika" uligawanya mwaka katika "prytanies," moja kwa kila moja ya "phylai," mgawanyiko wa raia wa Athene. Idadi ya phylai, na kwa hivyo idadi ya prytanies, inatofautiana kwa wakati. Hadi 307 KWK, kulikuwa na phylai 10.

Baada ya hapo nambari inatofautiana kati ya 11 na 13 (kawaida 12). Hata ya kutatanisha zaidi, wakati miaka ya makubaliano na tamasha kimsingi ilikuwa sawa katika karne ya 4 KWK, hiyo haikuwa mara kwa mara kesi mapema au baadaye. Kwa hivyo hati zilizowekwa na Prytany mara nyingi ni ngumu sana kupeana sawa katika kalenda ya Julian, ingawa kawaida tuko salama katika kukabidhi tarehe inayokadiriwa
---
Document ID: 2
Title: The Ancient Greek Calendar | Polysyllabic (www.polysyllabic.com)
Content: Ancient historians date by Olympiad by giving both the number of the Olympiad and the year within the cycle, 1-4 (the Olympiad itself was held on year 1). Additionally, lists of Olympic winners were maintained, and the 3rd c. BCE writer Timaios compiled a synchronic list comparing Olympic winners, Athenian archons, Spartan kings, and the priests of Hera from Argos.

Olympiad 1,1 correlates to 776 BCE. We do not actually need to believe an actual festival was held on this date, but when Greek historians are writing in later times, they date their own events using this as the epoch. We can establish a precise correlation to the common era from a variety of different sources, but the most definitive comes from a passage in Diodorus, where he dates the year of a total solar eclipse to the reign of the Athenian archon Hieromnemon, which he also gives as Ol. 117,3. The only astronomically possible date for this event is August 15, 310 BCE, which fixes our epoch

Title: The Ancient Greek Calendar | Polysyllabic (www.polysyllabic.com)
Content: Ancient historians date by Olympiad by giving both the number of the Olympiad and the year within the cycle, 1-4 (the Olympiad itself was held on year 1). Additionally, lists of Olympic winners were maintained, and the 3rd c. BCE writer Timaios compiled a synchronic list comparing Olympic winners, Athenian archons, Spartan kings, and the priests of Hera from Argos.

Olympiad 1,1 correlates to 776 BCE. We do not actually need to believe an actual festival was held on this date, but when Greek historians are writing in later times, they date their own events using this as the epoch. We can establish a precise correlation to the common era from a variety of different sources, but the most definitive comes from a passage in Diodorus, where he dates the year of a total solar eclipse to the reign of the Athenian archon Hieromnemon, which he also gives as Ol. 117,3. The only astronomically possible date for this event is August 15, 310 BCE, which fixes our epoch

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The Ancient Greek Calendar | Polysyllabic (www.polysyllabic.com)
Content: The Athenians seem to have taken a rather casual attitude towards their calendar. It appears they used neither a regular formula nor continuous direct observation to determine the length of the months. Most likely, they followed a general rule of alternating months (29 and 30 days long), subject to periodic correction by observation.

In addition to this calendar, which has been called the festival calendar, Athenians maintained a second calendar for the political year. This "conciliar" year divided the year into "prytanies," one for each of the "phylai," the subdivisions of Athenian citizens. The number of phylai, and hence the number of prytanies, varies over time. Until 307 BCE, there were 10 phylai.

After that the number varies between 11 and 13 (usually 12). Even more confusing, while the conciliar and festival years were basically the same length in the 4th century BCE, such was not regularly the case earlier or later. Thus documents dated by prytany are frequently very difficult to assign to a particular equivalent in the Julian calendar, although we are usually secure in assigning an approximate date
---

Title: Kalenda ya Uigiriki ya Kale | Polysyllabic (www.polysyllabic.com)
Content: Wanahistoria wa zamani wa tarehe ya Olimpiki kwa kutoa idadi ya Olimpiki na mwaka ulio ndani ya mzunguko, 1-4 (Olimpiki yenyewe ilifanyika mwaka 1). Kwa kuongeza, orodha za washindi wa Olimpiki zilitunzwa, na 3 c. Mwandishi wa BCE Timaios aliandaa orodha ya kusawazisha kulinganisha washindi wa Olimpiki, Athene Archons, Spartan Kings, na makuhani wa Hera kutoka Argos.

Olimpiki 1,1 inahusiana hadi 776 KWK. Kwa kweli hatuhitaji kuamini sikukuu halisi ilifanyika tarehe hii, lakini wakati wanahistoria wa Uigiriki wanaandika katika nyakati za baadaye, wanapata matukio yao wenyewe kwa kutumia hii kama wakati. Tunaweza kuanzisha uunganisho sahihi kwa enzi ya kawaida kutoka kwa vyanzo tofauti, lakini dhahiri zaidi hutoka kwa kifungu huko Diodorus, ambapo anaanza mwaka wa kupatwa kwa jua kwa jua kwa utawala wa Athene Archon Hieromnemon, ambao pia hutoa kama Ol. 117,3. Tarehe pekee inayowezekana ya kisayansi kwa hafla hii ni Agosti 15, 310 KWK, ambayo hurekebisha wakati wetu

claim: Mara tu wimbo unapoanzishwa kwenye simu, kigeuzi cha ndani hubadilisha data ya dijiti kuwa ishara ya sauti ya analog, kisha ishara hiyo huingia kwenye kebo ya aux yenye waya wa shaba; hapa inasafiri kama wimbi linalobadilika la umeme kwa sababu nyaya za AUX husambaza tu ishara za analog na si dijiti
question_src: Je! Wimbo husafirishwaje kwenye kebo ya aux kutoka kwa simu na kucheza kwenye gari?
all_claims: Mara tu wimbo unapoanzishwa kwenye simu, kigeuzi cha ndani hubadilisha data ya dijiti kuwa ishara ya sauti ya analog, kisha ishara hiyo huingia kwenye kebo ya aux yenye waya wa shaba; hapa inasafiri kama wimbi linalobadilika la umeme kwa sababu nyaya za AUX husambaza tu ishara za analog na si dijiti [2].
Waya huo wa shaba hubeba “wimbi endelevu la habari ya umeme” kuelekea pembejeo ya aux ya redio ya gari [1].
Redio huchukua ishara hiyo, huiimarisha na kuielekeza kwenye spika.

Ndani ya spika, mkondo wa umeme unaopita kwenye koili unaunda uga wa sumaku unaobadilika ambao unashirikiana na sumaku ya kudumu, kusukuma na kuvuta koni ya spika na hivyo kutikisa hewa, hatua inayofanya tufe sauti halisi inayosikika ndani ya gari [3].
Hivyo mchakato ni: ubadilishaji dijiti-kuwa-analog → usafirishaji wa mkondo katika kebo ya shaba → ukuzaji (amplification) → mwendo wa koni ya spika → sauti.

claim: Waya huo wa shaba hubeba “wimbi endelevu la habari ya umeme” kuelekea pembejeo ya aux ya redio ya gari
question_src: Je! Wimbo husafirishwaje kwenye kebo ya aux kutoka kwa simu na kucheza kwenye gari?
all_claims: Mara tu wimbo unapoanzishwa kwenye simu, kigeuzi cha ndani hubadilisha data ya dijiti kuwa ishara ya sauti ya analog, kisha ishara hiyo huingia kwenye kebo ya aux yenye waya wa shaba; hapa inasafiri kama wimbi linalobadilika la umeme kwa sababu nyaya za AUX husambaza tu ishara za analog na si dijiti [2].
Waya huo wa shaba hubeba “wimbi endelevu la habari ya umeme” kuelekea pembejeo ya aux ya redio ya gari [1].
Redio huchukua ishara hiyo, huiimarisha na kuielekeza kwenye spika.

Ndani ya spika, mkondo wa umeme unaopita kwenye koili unaunda uga wa sumaku unaobadilika ambao unashirikiana na sumaku ya kudumu, kusukuma na kuvuta koni ya spika na hivyo kutikisa hewa, hatua inayofanya tufe sauti halisi inayosikika ndani ya gari [3].
Hivyo mchakato ni: ubadilishaji dijiti-kuwa-analog → usafirishaji wa mkondo katika kebo ya shaba → ukuzaji (amplification) → mwendo wa koni ya spika → sauti.
claims_retained: Mara tu wimbo unapoanzishwa kwenye simu, kigeuzi cha ndani hubadilisha data ya dijiti kuwa ishara ya sauti ya analog, kisha ishara hiyo huingia kwenye kebo ya aux yenye waya wa shaba; hapa inasafiri kama wimbi linalobadilika la umeme kwa sababu nyaya za AUX husambaza tu ishara za analog na si dijiti [2].
Waya huo wa shaba hubeba “wimbi endelevu la habari ya umeme” kuelekea pembejeo ya aux ya redio ya gari [1].
prompt:

Document ID: 2
Title: Aux Inputs vs. USB Connections (www.lifewire.com)
Content: The main difference between a USB (Universal Serial Bus) connection and an auxiliary input is that USB cords send digital information while aux cables send analog signals. USB cords transfer data as you would to a computer, while aux cables transmit audio as you would to an amplifier or pair of headphones.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: The Physics of How Your Earphone Jack Works (Just in Time to Say Goodbye) (www.wired.com)
Content: At the most basic level, an earphone is a loop of wire with current running through it. This electric current in the loop then interacts with a permanent magnet which in turn pushes the air---that's sound.

all_claims: Kulingana na “Nadharia ya Nadra ya Dunia”, uwepo wa viumbe vyenye akili kama wanadamu unaweza kuwa tukio adimu sana kwa sababu unategemea mfululizo mrefu wa bahati mbaya ya hali mahususi: nyota na mfumo wa sayari lazima wawe katika eneo linaloweza kuishi, sayari yenyewe iwe na ulinganifu sahihi wa misa, iwe na walinzi wa gesi kama Mshtarii kuikinga na athari nyingi, iwe na satelaiti kubwa, gesi uhamaji (tectonics) na uwanja wa sumaku unaoleta utulivu wa muda mrefu kwa angahewa, pamoja na mzunguko sahihi wa elementi za kemikali katika bahari na angahewa [1].

Zaidi ya hayo, hatua muhimu za kibiolojia—kuibuka kwa seli za eukaryoti, uzazi wa kijinsia, “mlipuko” wa Cambrian, na hatimaye mageuzi ya akili ya kibinadamu—zinaweza kuwa zinahitaji matukio mengine adimu yasiyotarajiwa [1].

Kwa kujumlisha vichujio hivi vyote, wanasayansi wanaodai hipotesi hii hupendekeza kwamba ingawa ulimwengu una nyota bilioni nyingi, nafasi ya upatikanaji wa mchanganyiko huu kamili ni ndogo sana, hivyo kuweka uwezekano wa uwepo wetu kuwa “mdogo sana” katika mizani ya kozmolojia.
claims_retained: Kulingana na “Nadharia ya Nadra ya Dunia”, uwepo wa viumbe vyenye akili kama wanadamu unaweza kuwa tukio adimu sana kwa sababu unategemea mfululizo mrefu wa bahati mbaya ya hali mahususi: nyota na mfumo wa sayari lazima wawe katika eneo linaloweza kuishi, sayari yenyewe iwe na ulinganifu sahihi wa misa, iwe na walinzi wa gesi kama Mshtarii kuikinga na athari nyingi, iwe na satelaiti kubwa, gesi uhamaji (tectonics) na uwanja wa sumaku unaoleta utulivu wa muda mrefu kwa angahewa, pamoja na mzunguko sahihi wa elementi za kemikali katika bahari na angahewa [1].

Zaidi ya hayo, hatua muhimu za kibiolojia—kuibuka kwa seli za eukaryoti, uzazi wa kijinsia, “mlipuko” wa Cambrian, na hatimaye mageuzi ya akili ya kibinadamu—zinaweza kuwa zinahitaji matukio mengine adimu yasiyotarajiwa [1].

claim: Usiku, nyota na miungano yake huchukua nafasi ya Jua, na ndege huelekeza safari zao kwa kutazama usanifu wa anga kama walivyofanya mabaharia wa zamani
question_src: Je! Ndege zinajuaje ni njia gani Kusini wakati wa kuhamia kwa msimu wa baridi?
all_claims: Ndege wanaohama hutegemea mchanganyiko wa viashiria vya anga, kijiografia na kibaolojia ili kujua njia ya kuelekea Kusini wakati wa msimu wa baridi.
Mchana hutumia nafasi ya Jua ambalo huchomoza mashariki na kuzama magharibi kama dira ya asili, wakirekebisha mwelekeo kadiri linavyosogea angani [1].
Usiku, nyota na miungano yake huchukua nafasi ya Jua, na ndege huelekeza safari zao kwa kutazama usanifu wa anga kama walivyofanya mabaharia wa zamani [1].
Ndani ya ubongo wa baadhi ya spishi kuna madini ya magnetite yanayowawezesha kuhisi uga sumaku wa Dunia, hivyo kubaini mahali kilipo kaskazini au kusini ya sumaku bila kuona [1].

Mbali na viashiria hivi, ndege hufuata alama za ardhini kama mito, mabonde, barabara au vilele vya milima ambavyo hujichora vyema kutoka juu, na hivyo kurahisisha ufuatiliaji wa njia zinazoshuka kuelekea maeneo ya joto [3].

Hatimaye, wanasayansi wanakisia kuwa uwezo huu huungwa mkono na “GPS” ya ndani inayojumuisha macho (eneo la “nguzo N”) na chembe ndogo za chuma kwenye sikio la ndani ambazo huimarisha utambuzi sahihi wa mwelekeo [2].

Ndani ya ubongo wa baadhi ya spishi kuna madini ya magnetite yanayowawezesha kuhisi uga sumaku wa Dunia, hivyo kubaini mahali kilipo kaskazini au kusini ya sumaku bila kuona [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Je! Ndege zinajuaje njia gani Kusini? (www.wonderopolis.org)
Content: Jambo moja ndege hutegemea ni Jua. Jua linachomoza mashariki na huweka magharibi. Ndege zinazoruka kusini kwa msimu wa baridi zinaweza kukaa kwenye wimbo kwa kutumia nafasi ya jua angani siku nzima kama mwongozo.


Kwa kweli, jua linapochomoza, sio msaada sana kama mwongozo. Kwa bahati nzuri, ndege wengi wanaweza pia kuzunguka kwa msimamo wa nyota angani mara moja usiku unazunguka. Constellations ziliongoza mabaharia wengi usiku kabla ya teknolojia ya kisasa kuja. Ndege zinaweza kutumia nyota kama misaada ya majini kwa njia ile ile.


Ndege pia zina faida ya mtazamo wa jicho la ndege. Watekaji wa kibinadamu waliopotea msituni wakati mwingine lazima wapanda juu ya mlima wa karibu ili kuweza kuona sura za mazingira au za mwanadamu, kama barabara au pwani, kupata njia yao ya kurudi nyumbani. Ndege huchukua tu angani ambapo wanapata mtazamo mzuri wa kila kitu chini yao. Wakati mwingine kusafiri kusini ni rahisi kama kufuata njia ya mto ambao husafiri kusini kwa joto la joto.


Mwishowe, wanasayansi wengine wanaamini ndege wengine wanaweza pia kupata mwongozo wao kutoka kwa sumaku ya Dunia. Aina zingine za ndege zina madini ya sumaku inayoitwa magnetite kwenye akili zao. Wataalam wanaamini madini haya yanaweza kusaidia ndege kugundua sumaku ya Dunia na kuitumia kuwaongoza kusini.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How Do Birds Navigate? (www.nationalgeographic.org)
Content: The flight paths used by birds in their annual migrations are called flyway s.


Scientists are not entirely sure how birds navigate their flyways. They seem to have an internal global positioning system (GPS) that allows them to follow the same pattern every year. A young bird imprint s on the sun and stars to help orient it. Some researchers think a bird may also recognize landmark s.


Individual organ s also contribute to a bird’s remarkable navigational ability. A bird’s eyes interact with its brain in a region called “cluster N”, which probably helps the bird determine which way is north. Tiny amounts of iron in the neurons of a bird’s inner ear also help in this determination.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How do migratory birds find their way ? - News - EducaPoles (www.educapoles.org)
Content: nother tool is the earth's magnetic field (earth's north and south magnetic poles). Some birds, like pigeons, have a small zone in their brain made of magnetite (magnetic mineral), just like a small compass. But other scientists think it's rather in their eyes that some birds have a system which indicates them where the magnetic north is...


Of course, birds also use their knowledge of the landscape: they follow rivers, valleys or roads, or locate themselves with particular mountain peaks.


Other tracks are still to be explored. For example it seems that some birds could find their way by following their sense of smell...

prompt:

Title: How Do Birds Know Which Way is South? (www.wonderopolis.org)
Content: One thing birds definitely rely upon is the Sun. The Sun rises in the east and sets in the west. Birds flying south for the winter can stay on track by using the Sun's position in the sky throughout the day as a guide.


Of course, once the Sun sets, it isn't much help as a guide. Luckily, many birds can also navigate by the position of the stars in the sky once night rolls around. Constellations guided many sailors at night before modern technology came along. Birds can use the stars as navigational aids in the same way.


Birds also have the benefit of a bird's eye view. Human hikers lost in the woods sometimes must climb to the top of the nearest mountain to be able to see natural or man-made landscape features, like roads or coastlines, to find their way home. Birds just take to the sky where they get an awesome view of everything below them. Sometimes traveling south is as simple as following the path of a river that travels south to warmer temperatures.


Finally, some scientists believe some birds may also get some of their guidance from Earth's magnetic field. Some species of birds have a highly-magnetic mineral called magnetite in their brains. Experts believe this mineral may help birds detect Earth's magnetic field and use it to guide them south.

Title: How Do Birds Navigate? (www.nationalgeographic.org)
Content: The flight paths used by birds in their annual migrations are called flyway s.


Scientists are not entirely sure how birds navigate their flyways. They seem to have an internal global positioning system (GPS) that allows them to follow the same pattern every year. A young bird imprint s on the sun and stars to help orient it. Some researchers think a bird may also recognize landmark s.


Individual organ s also contribute to a bird’s remarkable navigational ability. A bird’s eyes interact with its brain in a region called “cluster N”, which probably helps the bird determine which way is north. Tiny amounts of iron in the neurons of a bird’s inner ear also help in this determination.

question_src: Je! "Mfano mdogo" ni nini?
all_claims: “Mfano mdogo” (model minority) ni dhana iliyoibuka katika vyombo vya habari zaidi ya miaka 50 iliyopita inayodai kuwa kuna kundi la wachache—linalotajwa mara nyingi kuwa ni Wamarekani wa Asia—linalofanikiwa kupita kiasi katika elimu, uchumi na utamaduni, na hivyo linawekwa kama mfano wa kuigwa kwa makundi mengine ya wachache[1].

Hadithi hii husifiwa kwa kuonyesha takwimu za ufaulu wa kikundi hicho, lakini pia hutumika kuashiria kwamba mafanikio yao yanatokana na maadili ya “kufanya kazi kwa bidii” na “nidhamu ya kitamaduni,” na hivyo kuibua presha na matarajio yasiyo na msingi kwa watu kutoka jamii husika[2].

Wataalamu wanaonya kuwa simulizi hili hupunguza utajiri wa tofauti za tabaka, kabila na historia ndani ya kundi hilo, na hata kuwalaumu wale wasiopata mafanikio kana kwamba hawajajituma vya kutosha[4].

Aidha, simulizi hilo linaweza kusababisha msongo wa kisaikolojia kwa makundi mengine ya wachache, kama vile watu wanaojitambulisha kama Amerika ya Kusini, ambao hukabiliwa na shinikizo la kuifikia “kiwango” hicho kinachodhaniwa[3].
claims_retained: “Mfano mdogo” (model minority) ni dhana iliyoibuka katika vyombo vya habari zaidi ya miaka 50 iliyopita inayodai kuwa kuna kundi la wachache—linalotajwa mara nyingi kuwa ni Wamarekani wa Asia—linalofanikiwa kupita kiasi katika elimu, uchumi na utamaduni, na hivyo linawekwa kama mfano wa kuigwa kwa makundi mengine ya wachache[1].

question_src: Je! Benki ingefanyaje pesa ikiwa ningeweka dola bilioni 1 kwenye akiba yangu, ukizingatia riba itakuwa mamilioni?
all_claims: Iwapo utaweka dola bilioni 1 katika akaunti ya akiba yenye APY ya 1.50%, benki italazimika kukulipa takriban dola milioni 15 kwa riba kila mwaka; hata hivyo, benki itageuza hizo dola bilioni 1 ziwe mikopo yenye viwango vya juu zaidi na kuvuna mapato mengi zaidi [1].
Kwa mfano, sehemu ya amana yako inaweza kufadhili rehani kwa 5.50%, mkopo wa mwanafunzi kwa 6.65% au salio la kadi za mkopo kwa 16.99% APR [1].
Hata ikichukua wastani wa 6% kwenye mikopo yote, mapato ya riba yatakuwa takriban dola milioni 60 kwa mwaka.
Gharama yao ya kuku­lipa riba ikibaki milioni 15, faida ya kimsingi ya riba inaweza kufikia karibu dola milioni 45 kabla ya gharama nyingine.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Finance 101: How Do Banks Make Money? - Money Under 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Content: It all ties back to the fundamental way banks make money: Banks use depositors’ money to make loans. The amount of interest the banks collect on the loans is greater than the amount of interest they pay to customers with savings accounts—and the difference is the banks’ profit.


For example: You currently have an emergency fund of $10,000 in a high yield savings account that may pay 1.50% APY. The bank uses that money to fund someone’s:


* Mortgage at 5.50% APR
* Student loan at 6.65% APR
* Credit card at 16.99% APR


Your bank may have paid you $150 in a year’s time but they earned hundreds or thousands more from the interest on loans (made possible with your money). Now, think about this process repeated with millions of banking customers and billions of dollars.
---

question_src: Ikiwa ningeunda kampuni, kuwa na deni la $ 1M, kwenda kufilisika, ni vipi kampuni ambayo nina deni kupata pesa zake? lazima nilipe?
all_claims: Ukifungua LLC/Shirika, ukakopa $1M, kisha kampuni ikafilisika, deni hilo linageuka kuwa dai dhidi ya mali za kampuni na hukidhiwa kutoka katika mali zitakazouzwa na msimamizi wa kufilisika; ikiwa mali hazitoshi, kiasi kilichobaki hakitalipwa na kampuni tena [1].

Kwa kawaida, wewe binafsi huna wajibu wa kulipa salio ikiwa hukusaini dhamana ya kibinafsi (personal guarantee) au kuahidi mali yako kama dhamana, kwa sababu mkopeshaji anaweza kudai tu mali za kampuni [2].
Hata hivyo, uliposaini dhamana au uliweka nyumba/mali yako kama rehani, mkopeshaji ana haki kuja moja kwa moja kwenye mali zako binafsi ili kukusanya deni hilo [2].

Isitoshe, hata bila dhamana, mkopeshaji anaweza kuomba korti “kupasua pazia la shirika” ikiwa uliunganisha fedha zako na za kampuni, hukufuata taratibu rasmi za ushirika, uliianzisha kampuni bila mtaji wa kutosha au ulifanya udanganyifu; hali hizi zinaweza kukufanya uajibike binafsi kwa deni lote [3].

Kwa hiyo, iwapo haukutoa dhamana wala kufanya vitendo vinavyoruhusu kupasuliwa kwa pazia, deni litabaki kwa kampuni na hutalazimika kulipa kutoka fedha zako binafsi, lakini ukiwa na dhamana au ukiwa na makosa yaliyoelezwa, utachukuliwa kuwajibika.
claims_retained: Ukifungua LLC/Shirika, ukakopa $1M, kisha kampuni ikafilisika, deni hilo linageuka kuwa dai dhidi ya mali za kampuni na hukidhiwa kutoka katika mali zitakazouzwa na msimamizi wa kufilisika; ikiwa mali hazitoshi, kiasi kilichobaki hakitalipwa na kampuni tena [1].

prompt:

Title: Ikiwa kampuni itaenda nje ya biashara nina deni kwa wakala wa ukusanyaji? (www.debtcollectionAnswers.com)
Content: Deni ambalo unadaiwa kama mdaiwa kwa kampuni ambayo inakwenda katika utawala wa kufilisika itakuwa sehemu ya mali ya kampuni hiyo kufilisika.


Walakini, kile kinachotokea ikiwa unadaiwa pesa kwa kampuni inayoenda nje ya biashara, na jinsi deni hilo litakusanywa, inategemea sehemu ya hali ya deni.



"Ukweli kwamba kampuni ya faili ya kufilisi


deni una deni. "


Ikiwa mkopeshaji anakusanya deni lakini anaenda nje ya biashara, utahitaji kuendelea kufanya malipo kwa mkopo au unahatarisha uharibifu wa ripoti zako za mkopo na alama za mkopo. Ikiwa kampuni inatoa faili kwa kufilisika, korti itakuamuru wapi kufanya malipo yako ya kila mwezi ikiwa hiyo itabadilika. Ikiwa una mzozo wowote juu ya kama deni ni halali, ongeza ugomvi huo mara tu utakapoarifiwa kufilisika. Ikiwa haufanyi, deni linaweza kuzingatiwa kuwa halali.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: When You Might Be Personally Liable for LLC or Corporate Debt (www.nolo.com)
Content: If you cosign on a business loan, you are as equally responsible as the corporation or LLC to pay it back. This is usually the simplest way to voluntarily make yourself liable for your company's debts. Similarly, if you personally guarantee an obligation of the corporation or LLC then the creditor can come after your personal assets if the business defaults on the loan.


## Pledging Your Property as Collateral


If you have a new company or your company does not have many assets, a creditor may require you to provide some sort of collateral before approving the loan. If you agree to pledge your house or other personal assets as collateral for the business loan, the creditor may be able to take your property and sell it to satisfy the obligations of the company.


## Piercing the Corporate Veil


Above we discussed the ways you can voluntarily make yourself personally liable for a corporate or LLC debt. However, a creditor can also try to go after your personal assets by eliminating the limited liability protection provided by the corporation or LLC. This is commonly referred to as piercing the corporate veil.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: When You Might Be Personally Liable for LLC or Corporate Debt (www.nolo.com)
Content: more likely to pierce the corporate veil if:


* Corporate formalities, such as holding annual meetings and keeping minutes, were not followed.
* Certain owners exerted too much control over the corporation or LLC.
* Owners commingled personal funds with company funds or used personal funds to satisfy company obligations.
* The company was not sufficiently capitalized when it was formed.


(To learn more, see Piercing the Corporate Veil: When LLCs and Corporations May Be at Risk.)


## Fraud


A corporation or LLC's owners may also be held personally liable if they are found to have committed fraud

Title: If A Company Goes Out of Business Do I Owe Debt to Collection Agency? (www.debtcollectionanswers.com)
Content: The debt you owe as a debtor to a company that goes into bankruptcy administration will become part of the assets of the company in bankruptcy.


However, exactly what happens if you owe money to a company that goes out of business, and how that debt will be collected, depends in part on the status of the debt.



"The fact that a company files for bankruptcy does not automatically erase any


debt you owe."


If a lender is collecting the debt but goes out of business, you will need to continue to make payments on the loan or you risk damage to your credit reports and credit scores. If the company files for bankruptcy, the court will instruct you where to make your monthly payments if that changes. If you have any dispute over whether the debt is valid, raise that dispute as soon as you are notified of the bankruptcy. If you don’t, the debt may be considered valid.

Content: Ikiwa unashikilia mkopo wa biashara, unawajibika sawa na Shirika au LLC kuilipa. Kawaida hii ndio njia rahisi zaidi ya kujifanya kwa hiari kuwajibika kwa deni la kampuni yako. Vivyo hivyo, ikiwa unahakikisha jukumu la shirika au LLC basi mkopeshaji anaweza kuja baada ya mali yako ya kibinafsi ikiwa biashara itafanya mkopo kwa mkopo.


## Kuahidi mali yako kama dhamana


Ikiwa una kampuni mpya au kampuni yako haina mali nyingi, mkopeshaji anaweza kukuhitaji kutoa aina fulani ya dhamana kabla ya kupitisha mkopo. Ikiwa unakubali kuahidi nyumba yako au mali zingine za kibinafsi kama dhamana ya mkopo wa biashara, mkopeshaji anaweza kuchukua mali yako na kuiuza ili kukidhi majukumu ya Kampuni.


## Kutoboa pazia la ushirika


Hapo juu tulijadili njia ambazo unaweza kujifanya kwa hiari kuwajibika kwa deni la ushirika au LLC. Walakini, mkopeshaji anaweza pia kujaribu kufuata mali zako za kibinafsi kwa kuondoa ulinzi mdogo wa dhima iliyotolewa na Shirika au LLC. Hii inajulikana kama kutoboa pazia la ushirika.

Document ID: 2
Title: When You Might Be Personally Liable for LLC or Corporate Debt (www.nolo.com)
Content: If you cosign on a business loan, you are as equally responsible as the corporation or LLC to pay it back. This is usually the simplest way to voluntarily make yourself liable for your company's debts. Similarly, if you personally guarantee an obligation of the corporation or LLC then the creditor can come after your personal assets if the business defaults on the loan.


## Pledging Your Property as Collateral


If you have a new company or your company does not have many assets, a creditor may require you to provide some sort of collateral before approving the loan. If you agree to pledge your house or other personal assets as collateral for the business loan, the creditor may be able to take your property and sell it to satisfy the obligations of the company.


## Piercing the Corporate Veil


Above we discussed the ways you can voluntarily make yourself personally liable for a corporate or LLC debt. However, a creditor can also try to go after your personal assets by eliminating the limited liability protection provided by the corporation or LLC. This is commonly referred to as piercing the corporate veil.
---

question_src: Je! Kwa nini idadi ya watu wa Amerika ya Kusini ilikataliwa na kufichua magonjwa ya Ulaya, lakini wachunguzi wa Ulaya hawakupata magonjwa makubwa kutoka kwa wenyeji?
all_claims: Wachunguzi wa Ulaya walipoleta mabomba kama ndui na surua, yalienea haraka miongoni mwa wenyeji wa Amerika Kusini ambao hawakuwa wamewahi kukutana nayo wala kutengeneza kinga ya asili, hivyo vifo vikubwa vilifuata [1].
Katika Ulimwengu wa Kale magonjwa hayo yalikuwa yamesambaa kwa karne nyingi, hivyo Waulaya wengi walikuwa tayari wamenusurika ama kupata kinga ya kudumu, jambo lililowalinda walipovuka Atlantiki [1].

Maendeleo ya magonjwa ya mlipuko hutegemea eneo lenye watu wengi na mfumo mbovu wa kutenganisha maji taka na maji safi; miji mikubwa ya Ulaya kama London ilitoa mazingira bora kwa vimelea kubadilika na kuwa hatari zaidi [2].

Kinyume chake, kabla ya uvamizi, Amerika ya Kusini ilikuwa na miji michache na idadi ndogo ya watu ikilinganishwa na Ulaya, hivyo magonjwa makubwa ya kuambukiza yalikuwa machache au hayakuweza kubadilika huko [3].

Zaidi, magonjwa mengi hatari ya binadamu hutokana na zoonoses; Ulaya ilikuwa na mifugo mingi kama ng'ombe, nguruwe na farasi, ilhali Ulimwengu Mpya uliishi na wanyama wachache waliowekwa, na hivyo haukuzalisha magonjwa mapya yanayoweza kusambaa kwa wageni [4].
Kwa sababu hiyo, Waulaya hawakupata magonjwa makubwa mapya, wakati wakazi wa Amerika Kusini walipungua kwa makadirio ya hadi 90 % katika karne ya kwanza ya mawasiliano.

question_src: Je! Kisafishaji kizito cha koti nzito kinaweza kufanya kazi kwa kiwango kikubwa cha maji yaliyosimama?
all_claims: Ndiyo; kisafishaji kizito cha kukimbia, hasa aina za asidi au caustic, kinaweza kufanya kazi hata panapokuwa na kiwango kikubwa cha maji yaliyosimama kwa sababu fomula yake ni nzito kuliko maji, hivyo hupenya na kushuka moja kwa moja hadi kwenye kizibo kilipo badala ya kuelea juu ya uso wa maji [2].

Mara kinapofika kwenye kizibo, athari zake za kemikali—kuchukua au kutoa elektroni—hutengeneza joto na gesi zinazosaidia kuyeyusha mafuta, sabuni au taka nyingine zilizoganda, na hivyo kuondoa kizuizi bila haja ya kuondoa maji yaliyosimama kwanza [2].

Hata hivyo, ili kuongeza ufanisi, fuata maelekezo ya mtengenezaji kama vile kumwaga vikombe 1½–2 vya kisafishaji, kusubiri karibu dakika 15, kisha kusafisha bomba kwa maji baridi kwa dakika tano ili kuondoa mabaki na kulinda bomba [1].

Content: Asidi ya sulfuri ndio kiungo muhimu cha kusafisha maji safi ya asidi ya kiwango cha juu. Ni ya kutosha kusafisha kuzama na nguo za choo ambazo wasafishaji wengine huacha nyuma. Tumia kwa kumwaga moja na nusu kwa vikombe viwili vya safi kwenye bomba, ukisubiri kwa dakika 15, kisha ukatoka kwa dakika tano na maji baridi.

Document ID: 2
Title: How Drain Cleaners Work (home.howstuffworks.com)
Content: * Oxidizing drain cleaners contain substances such as household bleach, peroxides and nitrates. These chemicals cause the organic material of the clog to lose electrons and become oxidized. The product is heavier than water, so it can move through standing water, and it releases heat and gas to help clear the blockage. * Acid drain cleaners aren't commonly found in stores, and some are sold only to plumbers. These typically contain high concentrations of sulfuric acid or hydrochloric acid, substances that increase hydronium ions in a solution and attract electrons from the clog. The hydronium ions react chemically with the material in the clog, and the reaction releases heat, which is necessary to melt congealed grease [source: Sheridan].
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How Drain Cleaners Work (home.howstuffworks.com)
Content: Be they liquid, gel or powder form, most of the drain cleaners you'll find on store shelves use strong chemicals, and they come in liquid, gel and powder forms. All chemical reactions involve moving electrons, and drain cleaners work by either taking or giving electrons to the clogging substance, generating heat in the process. There are three main types of drain cleaners:

 * Caustic drain cleaners contain substances such as lye and caustic potash. They're bases, so they give electrons to the clogging substance, and their hydroxide ions create the reaction that clears the clog. Their alkaline, or basic, chemicals release heat and turn grease into a soap-like substance that's more easily dissolved. These drain cleaners are typically heavier than water, which enables them to reach the clog through standing water.

claim: Kwa mtazamo wa kibaolojia wanadamu huchukuliwa kama omnivores kwa kuwa jamii zote za kibinadamu humeza nyama, ingawa kiasi chake hutofautiana
question_src: Je! Wanadamu ni omnivores? Kwa nini vegans wengi wanasema sisi ni mimea ya mimea?
all_claims: Kwa mtazamo wa kibaolojia wanadamu huchukuliwa kama omnivores kwa kuwa jamii zote za kibinadamu humeza nyama, ingawa kiasi chake hutofautiana [1].
Uchunguzi wa anatomia unaonyesha mpangilio wa meno yetu si maalumu kwa wanyama wala mimea pekee bali ni wa mchanganyiko, tabia ya wanyama wanaokula vyakula vya aina zote mbili [3].
Aidha, kibofu chetu cha nyongo ni kikubwa na hifadhi nyongo nyingi inayohitajika kuvunja mafuta mengi, kiadaptasia inayoonekana kwa carnivores na omnivores pekee [2].
Vilevile, mwili wa mwanadamu hufyonza chuma (heme iron) kwa ufanisi kutoka vyanzo vya wanyama, ishara nyingine ya kuzoea lishe inayojumuisha nyama [4].

Hata hivyo, wapenzi wengi wa lishe ya vegan hudai sisi ni mimea ya mimea kwa sababu katika zama za sasa hatuhitaji tena nyama, maziwa au mayai ili kuishi au hata kustawi, hivyo kimaadili ni bora kuepuka bidhaa za wanyama [5]; wao pia husisitiza kuwa hatuna makucha makali, meno ya kuchana nyama au tindikali kali ya tumbo kama ilivyo kwa wawindaji halisi [6].

question_src: Anabolism dhidi ya catabolism, ni nini kila, kila mmoja anaathirije mwili wa mwanadamu, ni nini chanya/hasi ni za kila mmoja.
all_claims: Catabolism ni mchakato wa kimetaboliki unaovunja miundo mikubwa kama protini, wanga na mafuta kuwa vitengo vidogo—mfano kuvunjwa kwa kipande cha mkate kuwa molekuli rahisi za sukari—na kutoa nishati inayotumika mara moja; ukikosa chakula, huenda hatua hii ikavunja hata misuli na mafuta ya mwili ili kupata nguvu za kuishi [1].
Huchukua chochote usichotumia sasa na kukihifadhi kama mafuta, hivyo huweza kuongeza uzito bila kujali ubora wa chakula unachokula [3].

Anabolism ni kinyume: huchukua vitengo vidogo kama asidi ya amino, virutubishi na seli, kisha kuvifunga kuunda tishu mpya, kuponya majeraha na kujenga misuli, jambo linaloonekana pia kwenye ukuaji wa watoto na kuimarika kwa nguvu ya misuli [2].
Hutegemea upatikanaji wa virutubishi bora kama mboga, matunda na nyama konda ili mwili upate “vifaa vya ujenzi” vya kutosha [3].
Kiumsingi, catabolism hutoa nishati ilhali anabolism hutumia nishati kuunda molekuli mpya [4].

Chanya za anabolism ni ukarabati wa tishu, ukuaji na kujenga misuli; hasi ni utegemezi wake kwa nishati na lishe bora, hivyo hukwama ukikosa virutubishi.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Anabolism dhidi ya Catabolism: Jukumu wanalochukua katika kimetaboliki yako (Health.ClevelandClinic.org)
Content: Unapofikiria catabolism, fikiria digestion, anasema DiMarino. Utaratibu huu unachukua miundo mikubwa kama protini, mafuta au tishu na kuzivunja katika vitengo vidogo kama seli au asidi ya mafuta. 


Catabolism hufanyika wakati unachimba chakula. Kwa mfano, ni mchakato ambao unafuta kipande cha mkate kuwa virutubishi rahisi mwili wako unaweza kutumia, kama sukari (sukari ya damu). Na ikiwa mwili wako haupati chakula na virutubishi unahitaji mafuta ya kuishi kila siku, catabolism ni utaratibu ambao huvunja misuli na mafuta kwa nishati.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Anabolism vs. Catabolism: The Role They Play in Your Metabolism (health.clevelandclinic.org)
Content: ### What is anabolism? 


Anabolism is the opposite of catabolism: It’s the mechanism that takes smaller units like nutrients, cells, or amino acids and bonds them together to create bigger structures. 


“One example of anabolism in action is when your body is trying to heal a cut. It adds tissue and structures around that wound,” DiMarino explains. “It’s also the process involved in a child’s growth and in building stronger muscles.”
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Anabolism vs. Catabolism: The Role They Play in Your Metabolism (health.clevelandclinic.org)
Content: Catabolism functions no matter what you give your body, states DiMarino. It breaks down food, whether it’s junky or nutritious. Whatever it doesn’t use for energy now, it stores for later (hello, extra pounds). 


But anabolism is entirely different. It only functions properly when you’re getting enough nutrients through foods like vegetables, fruits and lean meats. Your body needs high-quality building blocks to heal, repair and grow.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Difference Between Anabolism and Catabolism - An Overview (byjus.com)
Content: The major differences between Catabolism and Anabolism are the way the molecules are utilized in the body. Anabolism creates molecules the body needs for functionality and it uses energy in the process. Catabolism, on the other hand, breaks down complex molecules and releases energy which is available for the body to use.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Anabolism vs. Catabolism: The Role They Play in Your Metabolism (health.clevelandclinic.org)
Content: When you think catabolism, think digestion, says DiMarino. This process takes larger structures like proteins, fats or tissues and breaks them down into smaller units such as cells or fatty acids. 


Catabolism occurs when you’re digesting food. For example, it’s the process that dissolves a piece of bread into simple nutrients your body can use, like glucose (blood sugar). And if your body isn’t getting the food and nutrients it needs to fuel daily living, catabolism is the mechanism that breaks down muscle and fat for energy.

Catabolism occurs when you’re digesting food. For example, it’s the process that dissolves a piece of bread into simple nutrients your body can use, like glucose (blood sugar). And if your body isn’t getting the food and nutrients it needs to fuel daily living, catabolism is the mechanism that breaks down muscle and fat for energy.

Content: ####Anabolism ni nini? 


Anabolism ni kinyume cha catabolism: ni utaratibu ambao unachukua vitengo vidogo kama virutubishi, seli, au asidi ya amino na kuzifunga pamoja kuunda muundo mkubwa.

Content: ### What is anabolism? 


Anabolism is the opposite of catabolism: It’s the mechanism that takes smaller units like nutrients, cells, or amino acids and bonds them together to create bigger structures. 


“One example of anabolism in action is when your body is trying to heal a cut. It adds tissue and structures around that wound,” DiMarino explains. “It’s also the process involved in a child’s growth and in building stronger muscles.”

Aidha watu huogopa kuhukumiwa; wanaopata kidogo wanaweza kuhisi huruma au dharau, ilhali wanaopata zaidi wanaweza kuzushiwa wivu au chuki [3].

Title: Why Can't We Talk About How Much We Make? (www.elle.com)
Content: These primal definitions we attach to money (from power and control, to freedom, peace of mind, and security, to love—giving money without strings attached or giving money with strings attached) indicate that we, as a society, too often conflate earning power with success and personal value, and regard a low income as a result of poor choices or even moral failings. "I think people are generally afraid that if they reveal they make less than one of their friends they'll be regarded with pity, while if they reveal they make more they'll be treated with resentment," said Jennifer Wright

Content: “It goes against social conventions to talk about how much money you have or how much money you make,” she told me. “I think there’s also reluctance, among the people I interviewed for my book, to recognize how much money they have, partly because they’re worried they have more.”


Some of that reluctance comes from having a lot of money in a society that is known to be unequal. “It’s convenient, right? That we have this taboo,” Sherman said, in the sense that not talking about money might allow people who have the most of it in a given society to ignore that fact.

Title: The Extreme Discomfort of Sharing Salary Information (www.theatlantic.com)
Content: “It goes against social conventions to talk about how much money you have or how much money you make,” she told me. “I think there’s also reluctance, among the people I interviewed for my book, to recognize how much money they have, partly because they’re worried they have more.”

Title: Why Do Onions Make You Cry? Enzymes, Treatments & More (www.healthline.com)
Content: Onions spew enzymes and sulfenic acid when their skin is broken. These compounds combine to produce propanethial S-oxide, an irritating gas.


Propanethial S-oxide is a lachrymatory agent, meaning that it generates tears when it touches the eye. Propanethial S-oxide turns into sulfuric acid when it touches the water layer that covers and protects your eyeballs.


But just like onions, your eyes are also equipped with a defense mechanism meant to protect them from harm. When the nerves in each eye detect a lachrymatory agent, they generate tears to flush it out.

Goggles can prevent the gas from reaching your eyes while cutting onions, but they aren't really necessary, he added.


"Some people may cut the onions in a bowl of water," Rosa said. "I'd personally recommend using eye drops, like comfort drops, to help lubricate or rinse the eyes and dilute the gas exposure to the eyes."

question_src: Je! Kwa nini tunasema "jozi ya suruali/jeans/kaptula" wakati unazungumza juu ya kitu kimoja cha mavazi wakati wazi sio kuzidisha?
all_claims: Tunasema “jozi ya suruali/jeans/kaptula” kwa sababu kihistoria vazi hilo lilitengenezwa kama vipande viwili tofauti—kipande kimoja kwa kila mguu—vilivyovaliwa kwa pamoja kisha kufungwa kiunoni, hivyo kuonekana kama vitu viwili vilivyo katika umoja mmoja [1]; matokeo yake, Kiingereza kikaanza kutaja vazi hilo kama “pair” (jozi).

Aidha, nomino kama “trousers,” “shorts,” na “jeans” ni plurale tantum, yaani maneno yanayopatikana tu katika wingi; Kamusi ya Kiingereza ya Oxford huainisha aina hii ya nomino kuwa hutumika tu katika fomu ya wingi ili kueleza jambo linalochukuliwa kiakili kama mbili au zaidi, hata kama kimwili ni kitu kimoja [2].

Rekodi za kwanza za matumizi ya “trousers” katika wingi huko Marekani zinaanzia 1840, neno likiwa ufupisho wa “pantaloons,” ambalo chimbuko lake ni mhusika wa tamthilia za Commedia dell’Arte aliyevaa soksi na suruali fupi mbili zinazofanana, jambo lililochochea mtazamo wa “vipande viwili” [3].
Hivyo, mkusanyiko wa historia ya utengenezaji wa vipande viwili na kanuni ya kisarufi ya plurale tantum ndiyo chanzo cha kusema “jozi” tunaporejelea vazi moja la chini.

all_claims: Tunasema “jozi ya suruali/jeans/kaptula” kwa sababu kihistoria vazi hilo lilitengenezwa kama vipande viwili tofauti—kipande kimoja kwa kila mguu—vilivyovaliwa kwa pamoja kisha kufungwa kiunoni, hivyo kuonekana kama vitu viwili vilivyo katika umoja mmoja [1]; matokeo yake, Kiingereza kikaanza kutaja vazi hilo kama “pair” (jozi).

Aidha, nomino kama “trousers,” “shorts,” na “jeans” ni plurale tantum, yaani maneno yanayopatikana tu katika wingi; Kamusi ya Kiingereza ya Oxford huainisha aina hii ya nomino kuwa hutumika tu katika fomu ya wingi ili kueleza jambo linalochukuliwa kiakili kama mbili au zaidi, hata kama kimwili ni kitu kimoja [2].

Rekodi za kwanza za matumizi ya “trousers” katika wingi huko Marekani zinaanzia 1840, neno likiwa ufupisho wa “pantaloons,” ambalo chimbuko lake ni mhusika wa tamthilia za Commedia dell’Arte aliyevaa soksi na suruali fupi mbili zinazofanana, jambo lililochochea mtazamo wa “vipande viwili” [3].
Hivyo, mkusanyiko wa historia ya utengenezaji wa vipande viwili na kanuni ya kisarufi ya plurale tantum ndiyo chanzo cha kusema “jozi” tunaporejelea vazi moja la chini.

question_src: Je! Kuna sababu ya kibaolojia kwamba wanadamu wanavutiwa na tabia fulani za usoni (kama vile taya iliyofafanuliwa) au ni upendeleo wa kitamaduni tu?
all_claims: Ndiyo, kuna msingi wa kibaolojia unaoelezea kwa nini watu wengi huvutiwa na tabia fulani za usoni, ingawa ladha za kitamaduni huchangia pia.

Kwanza, muundo laini na rangi ya ngozi huchukuliwa kuwa kidokezo cha uzazi na afya njema, hivyo homogeneity ya ngozi ilihusishwa moja kwa moja na ukadiriaji wa kuvutia katika wanaume, ikionyesha kuwa ngozi inaweza kuwa “alama” ya afya ya ndani na ubora wa jeni [1].

Pili, ulinganifu wa uso unaonekana kuvutia zaidi kwa sababu viwango vya juu vya ulinganifu vinapendekeza mtu aliyeepuka magonjwa na vimelea wakati wa kukua, na hivyo kuwa na kinga thabiti na jeni “bora” kupitisha kizazi kijacho [2].

Tatu, taya iliyofafanuliwa—hasa kwa wanaume—inaashiria viwango vya juu vya testosterone vinavyohusishwa na mfumo wa kinga wenye nguvu na uwezo wa uzazi, jambo ambalo wanawake wengi hulitafsiri kama ishara ya virility na nguvu [3].

Hata hivyo, mabadiliko ya kitamaduni yanaweza kubadili “kigezo” kinachopendelewa, kama vile utafiti ulioona ngozi ya giza ikikadiriwa kuvutia zaidi kinyume na matokeo ya zamani, ukionyesha kuwa upendeleo wa uzuri si wa kibiolojia pekee bali pia huathiriwa na maadili ya kijamii yanayobadilika [1].

Title: Facial Symmetry and Attractiveness | The Evolution of Human Sexuality (sites.psu.edu)
Content: The Evolutionary Advantage theory proposed that symmetrical faces are perceived as more attractive because the symmetry indicates good health in an individual. Everyone’s genes are designed to develop a face perfectly symmetrical, but as we grow, develop, and then age, disease, infections, and parasites cause imperfection in our appearance (asymmetry). Thus, those that have less asymmetry and imperfections, are perceived as having better and stronger immune systems to withstand the infections and parasites that occur naturally. So, symmetry is a good indicator of a person having good genes to pass on their offspring.

Title: Why is a Jawline Considered Attractive? (thejawline.net)
Content: A strong Jawline is attractive to the opposite sex


This is a well documented fact, right from an evolutionary perspective. A strong jawline in men is considered to be a sign of high testosterone levels which translates into greater virility. High testosterone levels are a sign of a strong immune system which means greater strength and stamina; therefore a strong jawline in men is considered a trait that is attractive to women.


Women with sharp jawlines are equally attractive to men and a well defined jawline in women is considered a sign of strength, grace and responsibility; traits that are extremely attractive to men. Some of the most beautiful actresses and models are observed to have an extremely chiseled jawline.

Everyone’s genes are designed to develop a face perfectly symmetrical, but as we grow, develop, and then age, disease, infections, and parasites cause imperfection in our appearance (asymmetry). Thus, those that have less asymmetry and imperfections, are perceived as having better and stronger immune systems to withstand the infections and parasites that occur naturally. So, symmetry is a good indicator of a person having good genes to pass on their offspring.

Title: While You Are Sleeping (www.webmd.com)
Content: It tends to go up and down a little during the day, and the same is true at night, although while you’re sleeping it can be 1 to 2 degrees lower than in the daytime. Body temperature starts to fall as bedtime approaches, paving the way for a good night’s sleep. Your body also tends to lose heat, which helps you fall and stay asleep. That’s one of the reasons experts say you shouldn’t exercise close to bedtime: Exercise heats you up. We sleep better when we’re cooler. Your temperature starts to rise toward morning, preparing your body for wakefulness.

question_src: Wataalam wa seismolojia: Je! Unaamuaje ikiwa tetemeko la ardhi lilikuwa likitokea kwa asili au ikiwa ni ya kibinadamu?
all_claims: Wataalamu wa seismolojia huchunguza mambo kadhaa: kwanza hutafuta uhusiano wa kijiografia na shughuli za binadamu kama kuchimba mafuta, kupasua miamba au kujaza maji majabali; matetemeko yanapoonekana kuwekwa mkusanyiko karibu na visima vinavyoingiza au kutoa vimiminika, na hutokea muda mfupi baada ya taratibu hizo kuanza, hulenga kutilia shaka chanzo cha kibinadamu.

Kawaida mtetemo huo huanzishwa na sababu kama gurudumu la mbele kuinuka ghafla wakati wa kuharakisha au kugonga shimo, hivyo kushusha uthabiti wa upinde wa mbele na kuruhusu mikono ya ‘handlebar’ kwenda upande–kwa–upande kama “tank-slapper” [4].
Vipengele vinavyochochea zaidi ni matairi yaliyochakaa, pivoti zilizolegea na upakiaji usio sawa, ambavyo hupunguza uwezo wa mfumo wa kusimamisha kuzuia marudio ya mtetemo [3].
Pia, usambazaji wa uzito uliokithiri nyuma unapunguza mzigo kwa gurudumu la mbele na kufanya upinde huo uwe mwepesi, kitu kinachoongeza nafasi ya wobble utokee katika mwendo wa juu [5].

Kwa kuwa mitetemo hujenga kasi ndani ya sekunde chache na inahusisha nguvu kubwa za tairi na fremu, kuisahihisha ni gumu; dereva mara nyingi hukosa muda wa kurejesha uthabiti kabla pikipiki haijapoteza mwelekeo kabisa [1].

question_src: Jinsi papa anaweza kugundua damu kutoka kilomita mbali. Je! Molekuli kadhaa za damu zinapaswa 'kufikia' papa?
all_claims: Papa hutegemea pua zilizo chini ya snout ambazo huruhusu maji yenye molekuli za damu kupita juu ya safu za seli nyeti, mfumo ambao ni mamia ya mara nyeti kuliko harufu ya binadamu [1]; wanapogundua, fosasi ya upande unaofikiwa kwanza huwashwa na kuwasaidia kujua mwelekeo wa chanzo cha harufu [2].
Baadhi ya spishi kama papa wa limao zinaweza kutambua damu katika dimbwi kubwa au dutu iliyoko umbali wa mamia ya mita, lakini si “tone moja” linalovutwa kutoka kilomita kadhaa [1].
Harufu lazima isafirishwe na mikondo ya bahari, hivyo molekuli nyingi—si chache tu—lazima zikusanyike hadi kufikia kizingiti cha upokezi, mchakato unaochukua muda na kudhibitiwa na kasi ya maji [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Can A Shark Really Smell A Drop Of Blood From A Mile Away? (www.ripleys.com)
Content: Even though there’s just a 1 in 3.7 million chance of being killed by a shark, people are so fearful of the predators that they’ve developed myths about them—such as their ability to smell a tiny drop of blood from miles away.


While sharks do have a strong sense of smell, this statement is largely overblown. Some sharks can identify blood a quarter-mile away, but the scent doesn’t reach them instantaneously or necessarily cause them to attack.


[Image: blue shark nostrils]


Sharks have a heightened sense of smell and olfactory system that is hundreds of times stronger than a human’s. Their nostrils, located beneath their snouts, are used only for smelling and not for breathing. They do have the capacity to detect tiny amounts of various compounds in the water. Some types of sharks, such as the lemon shark, can even detect a scent in a large swimming pool or a substance that is several hundred meters away.


But a shark more than a quarter-mile away won’t smell your blood and decide to make you into a yummy snack. Smells reach a shark through the currents, and it would take time for the scent to travel that distance to a shark’s nostrils. The motion of the ocean carries smell molecules with it, so, the more motion, the faster the smell will travel.


If you do start to bleed while swimming in the ocean, there is some time to get safely to shore in case a rogue shark decides to attack.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Akili za Shark - Ukweli wa Shark na Habari (www.shark-world.com)
Content: Papa zina pua ambazo hutumia tu harufu. Wakati wao kuogelea, maji hutiririka kupitia pua, huletwa ndani ya duct ya pua na kusonga folda za mwisho za ngozi ambazo zina seli za hisia. Baadhi ya papa, kama vile papa wa limao (Negaprion brevirostris), wanaweza kugundua kiwango kidogo cha damu kwenye maji.


Maana ya harufu ni ya mwelekeo, hii inamaanisha kwamba ikiwa harufu inatoka upande wa kushoto wa papa, papa kwanza hugundua kabisa katika fossa ya kushoto badala ya kulia na inaweza kugundua eneo la chanzo cha harufu.


Inahitajika kusisitiza kuwa ni nyeti sana kwa harufu na inaweza kutofautisha mawindo kutoka kwa papa mwingine na hata kutoka kwa mtangulizi na kujibu kwa njia ya kuamua kwa harufu inayozalishwa na mawindo yaliyojeruhiwa au ya kutisha.
---

prompt:

Title: Je! Papa anaweza kuvuta tone la damu kutoka maili mbali? (www.ripleys.com)
Content: Hata ingawa kuna nafasi 1 tu kati ya milioni 3.7 ya kuuawa na papa, watu wanaogopa sana wadudu kwamba wameendeleza hadithi juu yao - kama uwezo wao wa kuvuta damu ndogo kutoka maili mbali.


Wakati papa wana hisia kali za harufu, taarifa hii inazidiwa sana. Baadhi ya papa zinaweza kutambua damu umbali wa maili, lakini harufu hiyo huwafikia mara moja au lazima kuwafanya kushambulia.


[Picha: Blue Shark Nostrils]


Papa zina hisia ya kunukia na mfumo wa uhuishaji ambao ni mamia ya mara zaidi ya mwanadamu. Pua zao, ziko chini ya snout zao, hutumiwa tu kwa harufu na sio kwa kupumua. Wana uwezo wa kugundua idadi ndogo ya misombo anuwai kwenye maji. Aina zingine za papa, kama vile papa wa limao, zinaweza kugundua harufu mbaya katika dimbwi kubwa la kuogelea au dutu ambayo iko umbali wa mita mia kadhaa.

The sense of smell is directional, this means that if the aroma comes from the left side of the shark, the shark first perceives it precisely in the left fossa rather than the right and can detect the location of the source of the smelling.

claim: Firewall ni kifaa au programu inayochuja trafiki ya mtandao na kuruhusu tu data inayopaswa kufika au kuondoka kulingana na sheria ulizoziweka
question_src: Je! Moto wa moto hufanyaje kazi?
all_claims: Firewall ni kifaa au programu inayochuja trafiki ya mtandao na kuruhusu tu data inayopaswa kufika au kuondoka kulingana na sheria ulizoziweka [1].
Ufanisi wake unategemea usanidi sahihi, na hakuna firewall iliyo kamilifu [1].

Pakiti za TCP ni rahisi kuchujwa kwa kuwa vichwa vyake hubeba anwani za chanzo, marudio na taarifa ya mlolongo, hivyo kurahisisha kulinganishwa na sheria za uchujaji [1], ilhali pakiti za UDP hukaguliwa zaidi kwa nambari za bandari kwa sababu hazina maelezo mengi kwenye vichwa vyake [2].

Kitaaluma, kuna aina tatu kuu: firewalls zisizo na hali (stateless) ambazo hukagua kila pakiti moja kwa moja bila kuzingatia mkondo wa data [3]; firewalls zenye hali (stateful) ambazo hukusanya safu ya pakiti, kutathmini hali ya muunganisho na kisha kutumia sheria, hivyo kuongeza usahihi na ufanisi [4]; na firewalls za kiwango cha programu (application firewalls) ambazo huenda mbali zaidi kwa kuchambua yaliyomo halisi ya data, si vichwa pekee [4].
claims_retained: Firewall ni kifaa au programu inayochuja trafiki ya mtandao na kuruhusu tu data inayopaswa kufika au kuondoka kulingana na sheria ulizoziweka [1].
Ufanisi wake unategemea usanidi sahihi, na hakuna firewall iliyo kamilifu [1].
prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Je! Moto wa moto hufanyaje kazi? Teknolojia ya Firewall ilielezea (cybersecurity.att.com)
Content: Firewall vichungi trafiki ya mtandao ili upate tu data ambayo unapaswa kupata. Hakuna firewall inayofanya kazi kikamilifu, na ufanisi mwingi wa firewall inategemea jinsi unavyoisanidi.


Ili kupata ufahamu wa kimsingi wa jinsi milango ya moto inavyofanya kazi, ni muhimu kuelewa jinsi pakiti za TCP zinavyofanya kazi.


Takwimu ambazo kompyuta yako hutuma na kupokea kwenye mtandao au mtandao wa ndani unajumuisha pakiti za TCP na pakiti za UDP. Pakiti za TCP zinaweza kuchujwa kwa ufanisi zaidi na milango ya moto kwa sababu zina habari zaidi katika vichwa vyao.


[Picha]


Pakiti za TCP zina habari kama anwani za chanzo na marudio, habari ya mlolongo wa pakiti, na upakiaji wa malipo. Habari hiyo inaruhusu interface yako ya mtandao kutoa data vizuri, na firewall inaweza kulinganisha habari hiyo na sheria ulizoisanidi. Kwa mfano, data yote ya HTTPS hupitishwa kupitia pakiti za TCP. Wakati data ya HTTPS inatumwa kwa kompyuta yako kupitia interface yako ya mtandao wakati unapita kwenye wavuti, mfumo wako wa kufanya kazi utajua kuwa ni data inayotakiwa kwenda kwenye kivinjari chako cha wavuti. Hiyo inatumika ikiwa unatumia wavuti - kwenye simu yako, kwenye PC yako, au hata kwenye mashine ya seva kwenye daftari lako. Kwa kuenea kwa mtandao wa vitu, unaweza kuwa unatumia mtandao kutoka kwa skrini iliyoingizwa kwenye jokofu yako. Takwimu zako za HTTPS hutumiwa kwa njia ile ile bila kujali.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: How do firewalls work? Firewall technology explained (cybersecurity.att.com)
Content: UDP packets can be filtered by port, but their headers lack the information that TCP packets have for more sophisticated filtering.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: How do firewalls work? Firewall technology explained (cybersecurity.att.com)
Content: Stateless or packet filtering firewalls inspect each packet individually, without considering the trends of the data you're receiving.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: How do firewalls work? Firewall technology explained (cybersecurity.att.com)
Content: Stateful firewalls do what stateless firewalls do, and they also consider the connection states of streams of data. This is the bouncer who may see one high school kid and then reject the whole group of high school kids, rather than asking each of them to prove their age. Stateful firewalls will collect a series of packets before it determines their connection state, and then compares those findings to the firewall rules, rather than applying the rules to each individual packet of data.
3. Application firewalls generally do everything that stateful firewalls do, and they also analyze the actual data content of the packets, not just the headers.
---

question_src: Je! Kwa nini watu wengi wanafurahiya kutatanisha na wengine kwa kiwango fulani?
all_claims: Watu wengi hupata “furaha” ya kutatanisha au kuwanyanyasa wengine kwa sababu tafiti zinaonyesha kwamba wengi wao wamepitia msongo au kiwewe kikubwa katika miaka mitano iliyopita, na uonevu huwa mbinu ya muda mfupi ya kupunguza maumivu hayo [1].

Asilimia 66 ya wanaokubali kutukana ni wanaume, jambo linaloendana na malezi yanayowakataza wavulana kuonyesha hisia na badala yake kuwatia moyo kupata umaarufu kupitia tabia za kuwachezea wengine [2].
Kwa wengine, uonevu hufunika kutoridhika kwao binafsi; kumlenga mtu mwingine huwapunguzia aibu yao ya ndani na kuwapa hisia ya nguvu ya haraka [3].
Pia, wale waliowahi kunyanyaswa huelekea kuendeleza mtindo huo ili kurejesha udhibiti wanaohisi wamepoteza [4].
Kukosa elimu kuhusu hotuba ya chuki huwafanya baadhi wasione madhara yake, hivyo “utani” wa kikatili huonekana kama burudani isiyo na tatizo [5].
Hatimaye, urafiki na uhusiano wa kifamilia wasio na usalama huwalazimisha wengine kubagua ili kukubalika, na kibali cha wenzao huwapa msukumo wa kimwili na kihisia kuendelea [6].
claims_retained: Asilimia 66 ya wanaokubali kutukana ni wanaume, jambo linaloendana na malezi yanayowakataza wavulana kuonyesha hisia na badala yake kuwatia moyo kupata umaarufu kupitia tabia za kuwachezea wengine [2].
prompt:

Title: Why do People Bully? The Scientific Reasons - Ditch the Label (us.ditchthelabel.org)
Content: Our data shows that those who bully are far more likely than average to have experienced a stressful or traumatic situation in the past 5 years. Examples include their parents/guardians splitting up, the death of a relative or the gaining of a little brother or sister.


It makes sense because we all respond to stress in very different ways. Some of us use positive behaviours, such as meditation, exercise and talking therapy – all designed to relieve the stress.


Others use negative behaviours such as bullying, violence and alcohol abuse, which temporarily mask the issues but usually make them worse in the long-term.


The research shows that some people simply do not know how to positively respond to stress and so default to bullying others as a coping mechanism.
---

kutoka kwa zaidi ya wauzaji 100 tofauti nchini China, jambo linaloongeza gharama na ugumu wa usafirishaji, ubora na *firmware* [2].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Yes, you can build your own smartphone (www.zdnet.com)
Content: A number of people have asked me whether it possible to build a smartphone out of easily available parts. Absolutely. It won't be as sleek or as powerful as one you could pick up, and you will have to assemble it yourself, but it's one of those projects that's very doable.


Here's one example built around a Raspberry Pi board, and Adafruit Fona GSM board, a 5-megapixel camera, 802.11n Wi-Fi, and a 3.5-inch display. You'll have to shop around for some of these parts, but the last time I looked they were all still available.


Now, this might not be a device that you want to carry around with you as a daily smartphone, but it's something that you could integrate into a bigger project, such as an IoT hub or maybe a rugged handset for use in an off-road vehicle or boat.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Nataka kujenga smartphone yangu mwenyewe (forums.tomsguide.com)
Content: Labda karibu haiwezekani kujenga smartphone yako mwenyewe. Sio rahisi tu kwamba unahitaji ubao wa mama, na processor. Kuna mambo mengi zaidi unahitaji kuwa na wasiwasi juu yake pia. Chip ya kuhifadhi, kasi, dira, kamera mbili, chip ya redio (ikijumuisha GPS, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, na simu za rununu), Chip ya Mdhibiti wa USB, bandari ndogo ya USB, jopo la LCD, skrini ya kugusa, betri, slider, kibodi, kesi, nk .... wengi wa wauzaji ni kutoka China. Na sidhani kama unaishi China. Hata kama unaishi China, labda lazima uwasiliane na wauzaji wote nchini China (ikiwezekana zaidi ya 100) kupata sehemu za kibinafsi za smartphone.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Make Your Own Cellphone From Scratch. (www.instructables.com)
Content: n fact, you can make a cellphone in much the same way you'd make anything else: find the right parts, figure out how to connect them together, and try to do it in a way that's attractive and robust. Because of the ubiquity of cellphones, there are companies making the components they're made of; with some digging, I was able to find versions of these parts that are possible to buy in small quantities and that are possible to assemble by hand. This wasn't necessarily easy, but it's a very different problem than trying to learn the physics needed to understand how a cellphone tower works
---

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Ndio, unaweza kujenga smartphone yako mwenyewe (www.zdnet.com)
Content: Watu kadhaa wameniuliza ikiwa inawezekana kujenga smartphone nje ya sehemu zinazopatikana kwa urahisi. Kabisa. Haitakuwa nyembamba au yenye nguvu kama moja unayoweza kuchukua, na itabidi ujikusanyie mwenyewe, lakini ni moja wapo ya miradi hiyo ambayo inawezekana sana.


Hapa kuna mfano mmoja uliojengwa karibu na bodi ya Raspberry Pi, na bodi ya Adafruit Fona GSM, kamera ya 5-megapixel, 802.11n Wi-Fi, na onyesho la inchi 3.5. Itabidi ununue karibu kwa sehemu zingine, lakini mara ya mwisho nilionekana wote walikuwa bado wanapatikana.


Sasa, hii inaweza kuwa sio kifaa ambacho unataka kubeba karibu na wewe kama smartphone ya kila siku, lakini ni kitu ambacho unaweza kujumuisha katika mradi mkubwa, kama vile kitovu cha IoT au labda kifaa cha rugged cha matumizi katika gari la barabarani au mashua.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: I want to build my own smartphone (forums.tomsguide.com)
Content: It's probably near impossible to build your own smartphone. It's not just that simple that you need the motherboard, and the processor. There are much more things you need to worry about as well. storage chip, accelerometer, compass, two cameras, radio chip (incorporating GPS, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and cellular), USB controller chip, Micro-USB port, LCD panel, capacitive touchscreen, battery, slider, keyboard, case, etc.... Most of the suppliers are from china. And I don't think you live in China. Even if you live in China, you probably have to contact all the suppliers in china (possibly over 100) to get the individual parts of a smartphone.
